Reviews.Title: “Another Visit”
Reviews.Author: DesertFan79
Reviews.Content: My second trip to Amsterdam and my second stay at the Eden Hotel. This time was very similar to the last stay. Room was small but clean and safe. Black out shades, great AC (last summer) and great heat (this winter) made for excellent sleep. The bed was the Euro equal to a full/double which would be a bit tight with someone else. The bathroom is proportionate to the room, but what is needed. Last time just a shower and this time a shower/tub with the same room. The hotel staff was very friendly. This time I did have rental car to park. The staff took care of this, but it was around $45 US per day so beware. I would suggest dropping a rental car unless you are using everyday. I did have the hotel breakfast this time, it was very good and average cost by European hotel standards. The TV is a bit rough, but I assume most people do not travel to Europe to watch TV in the hotel. Not much else to say except if you are looking for a very nice basic hotel you this is it. It is in Rembrandt Square which places you central and within walking distance to downown (redlight, train station, etc) and the museum district. I do not think I will even look for another hotel next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, good service!”
Reviews.Author: PizzaBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Eden for 4 nights during a holiday in Amsterdam. When we arrived the staff asked if we wanted an upgraded room for the same price, of course we said yes. The staff was friendly and nice. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, you have walking distance to most attractions. I can warmly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - we will be returning very soon!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10am and were allowed to check in , even though check in was not until 3pm! As it was my boyfriends birthday we were upgraded to an executive room with a view if the canal. The room was lovely, the bed was very comfortable, there were tea and coffee making facilities and the bathroom was lovely too. The hotel also gave us a voucher for champagne and oysters in the Bat downstairs as a gift for my boyfriends borthday. The location of the hotel was perfect, you step off the number 9 tram and the hotel is less than a 2 minute walk. The service was greeat, the reception staff were really helpful and we will deifnitely come back. Thank you to everyone who made it special.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to the dam”
Reviews.Author: lisa c
Reviews.Content: Where start....i thought i would be a good idea to go to Google maps and find our the trains buses etc to gt once of the plane this is a vital part of your trip!!!you will get lost of not! be organized!Once of the plane there is a train station under the airport get the train to Amsterdam central here you are 2 miles walking away from hotel or you can get tram. We couldn't find the hotel for ages but it does stand out once you get here.Room wasn't ready to 3pm but we expected this. When we g into our room it was clean and comfortable but small on the bed was two dressing gowns n slippers with a bag of rituals goodies i was in my element.TV was great few English channels all broken down into genres to what you prefer. Was unhappy about tea n coffee there was only one of each and i need my morning coffee! when i asked for a few more packets of coffee they said it was 7 euro i said doesn't matter!I was gobsmacked we over Â£300 for 3 nights i thought they could of give us some coffee. Later that evening i was in bed whilst my partner was in the shower thank god we locked the door someone was trying to get in ...i freaked got my partner out of the shower and he went to the door it was a couple stating that it was their room....both cards said room number 300...the couple said sorry...but what would of happened if we were not in the room but our money and passports where and people could get into our room i was livid!! Then reception phoned us and said they had put us into the wrong room and someone will e up to help us move we had been here for a least 4 hours!!!we stood our ground an said no so they had to leave it and we didn't release we where in the executive suite ha-ha hence the robes n slippers!The rest of the trip was enjoyable different world over there but very very expensive to get breakfast in hotel is 17 euro each!Even ho we where on 3rd floor very noisy from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, comfortableâ€¦ but confusing!”
Reviews.Author: MrsFletche
Reviews.Content: Too explain the â€˜confusingâ€™ label above; I must confess that this is my fault as there are several Eden hotels dotted around Amsterdam; many of which have changed their name recently from Hampshire Eden. This led to me being convinced that we were staying in another of the Eden establishments (to the point of trying to check inâ€¦) â€“ and then further confusion when we were informed that our actual hotel is made up of the 4* Eden Rembrandt Square and the 3* Eden Amsterdamâ€¦ After using a â€œbuy-two-nights-get-third-freeâ€� offer, naturally we were in the 3* â€˜halfâ€™ of the hotel; however the rooms were fine as a base for three nights â€“ clean and comfortable with plenty of storage space. The bathroom does have a frosted glass door, which may feel a little awkward if youâ€™re not travelling with your nearest and dearestâ€¦ English channels including the BBC & Sky News were available; the room did not have tea or coffee-making facilities. We did not pay for the hotel breakfast, preferring to grab a coffee and a pastry on the run. There is free wireless internet available; a new password is posted on reception each morning. The bar area was comfortable and welcoming, with drinks on a price parallel to the local bars. The hotel is located on the Amstel River, a few minutes walk from Rembrandtplein. We walked around the city easily; it is a 15 minute walk to Dam Square and about 30 minutes to the Anne Frank House. However, walk around the canal ring and it is easy to lose your bearings so take a map or good phone app! All in all, this was a pleasant base to discover Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but very basic hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Ctdemon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. I found it to be clean and generally comfortable. A few minor gripes would be that the bathroom is really small which would not be an issue but in the room we stayed in (219) there was a shelf located under the wash basin which meant that every time time you sat on the loo you banged your thigh on this shelf the room was so small!! The double beds are actually 2 singles pushed together which is not ideal for a romantic weekend away although they are comfirtable. The last gripe is that the rooms open directly into a brightly lit corridor and light poured into the room all night making it difficult if you are a light sleeper and need it completey dark. On the plus side the tram stop to Dam square is a 5 min walk away and It is located within walking distance of Rembrandt square where there is a lively night life. I had a decent stay but wouldn't return to this hotel as I think there are better ones out there for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and great position”
Reviews.Author: luckdragons5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights having chosen it due to its proximity to the flower market which we walked through every day. The hotel reception was busy when we arrived but the staff were friendly and efficient. We had a room upgrade which was appreciated. The Rituals toiletries helped to make the hotel seem that little bit more classy AND there were tea/coffee making facilities which were very welcome. Robert, the concierge was always a great help. I would be quite happy to stay here again. Amsterdam is a great city to walk around.We loved being near Rembrandstplein with all its cafes and restaurants. My highlights of the stay were the handbag museum, Van Gogh Museum and Keukenhoff Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tearduster
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to get to from Central Station by a Number 9 Tram although we walked it in twenty minutes. Round the corner is the very good 'Rembrandt Square' which is surrounded by plenty of places to eat and relax. Although the hotel rooms were very small, they were clean. The reception area is relaxing and we never felt unwelcome there. I thought the coffee and drinks were reasonably priced too. I was able to print my boarding pass back to Scotland for free and no bother. A free safe was in the room for valuables. We would definitely use this hotel again. Best of all we liked the relaxed atmosphere, the small rooms were the only downside.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty room”
Reviews.Author: Charlaboosh
Reviews.Content: Loved the flower picture above the bed, nice touch. Only problem we had was check in wasnt until 3pm, you could register your name and drop of your suitcase. They also only gave us one towel and had to leave 50euro deposit (but you do get it back at the end)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, no frills”
Reviews.Author: shabaBelfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a stag weekend with 9 others. We paid a good price for the room and breakfast although not great, was included. The hotel is central and the staff are pleasant. The rooms are small but clean. There is some wear and tear of the room but I have given the hotel 4/5 for location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Hairs in the bed!”
Reviews.Author: lizj61
Reviews.Content: Had already booked when read the reviews about poor cleanliness so immediately checked bed and found hairs and torn sheets. Also hair in bath and on toilet seat. Promptly rectified i.e. Bed changed and hairs removed from bathroom (though not apparently actually cleaned as the bath was not wet!). In addition, second morning found had only been left one bath towel for both of us! Good points: friendly, efficient Concierge and nice chips!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for good value”
Reviews.Author: Zoran999
Reviews.Content: Good location in amsterdam. nearby parking garage. nice rooms. at the ground floor you can find a free wifi.(and save 15 euro).

Reviews.Title: “Cozy,central very cost effective”
Reviews.Author: BALDWIN2
Reviews.Content: This is a no thrills hote. Very clean efficient and extremly well located. Breakfast is rather rich. Only hint I have do not take single rooms as they can be very very small. Thus always ordera double. Also hotel rates at the hotel site are inexpensive in case you order early enough. It is my fourth stay and I would certainly recommend it again

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: bimeycharlie
Reviews.Content: First hotel room (247) smelt of sick, but we were moved to 240 with no problems. Rooms are small by other city standards but average for Amsterdam. Bar was great. Location was superb. 20 min walk from Central station, or 5 mins from subway. As another reviewer mentioned, we booked through hotels.com, and were under the impression that taxes had been paid but got stung about â‚¬4 a night when we checked out. Overall would deffo stay there again. (noticed that the hotel was offering much cheaper prices booking directly a few days before check in compared to hotels.com/expedia etc etc)

Reviews.Title: “Everything was lovely.”
Reviews.Author: Isk752
Reviews.Content: There are a few hotels in Amsterdam with "Eden" in the title. I haven't stayed at them but this one is a good one. The location was good. My girlfriend and I enjoy walking and we walked everywhere. The staff were nice and the concierge was very helpful and helped us get tickets to museums and other events. We stayed for a week and were given a complimentary room upgrade. It was a nice surprise and because of that the hotel turned out to be one of the better value for money choices we made in our 6 week holiday through Europe. There is also a very nice gym nearby that has a deal with the hotel, which I found really nice. There is a cost for each visit though. Apparently no wi-fi in the rooms but we managed to still get a connection. The hotel breakfast was also really good. Great range and hearty. For us, this place was hard to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: aaron050741
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in Feb 2012 for 3 nights. our stay was very pleasant, the staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was in a great location within walking distance of everything. The rooms were modern however the standard of cleaning was not the best, there were a few stains on the carpet and hairs in the bath. Having said that it was perfect for what we were looking for and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our haven on arrival!”
Reviews.Author: Sian F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to drive to Amsterdam for the weekend and 'wing it' as we are only four hours away. But on arriving on a busy Saturday afternoon we realised this was a difficult plan! We finally found a parking and walked to find a hotel, Eden Hotel was a posh looking hotel we didn't think we could afford. As I waited with bated breath to find out the price the receptionist told us they only had executive rooms, as it was already 4pm though she gave us this room at standard room rates! 88 for the night. It was like heaven to get out of the busy city into this calm relaxing hotel where the service was amazing! We felt like we were paying top notch rates as the service was that efficient. The room was also stunning, with working air conditioning and a VERY comfortable bed. I would highly recommend this hotel. On arrival in Amsterday we were offered a hotel room for 90 euro that looked like a hostel! This is good value for money. They also arranged an excursion for us so all was organised! They also offer parking at 30 euro for the day (it's normally 45 if you park on the street!). Stay here it's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our room!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFrances
Reviews.Content: We visited here during the "deep freeze" of Europe and, as a result, spent a lot more time in our hotel room than we ordinarily would have. Fortunately we LOVED our room! It was on the top floor and overlooked the canal. The decor was clean and the overall vibe was chic and comfy. Best of all, the location is superb and in walking distance or an easy trolley ride to all the restaurants, attractions and nightlife you could ask for. (Because it snow-stormed, we didn't get to ride bikes around town.)The concierge and staff are pretty good (but not exceptional) at recommending places to eat and drink. The piano bar in the lobby seems cheesy, but we had a super fun night singing and drinking along to a bunch of classic rock standards. The breakfast is really great but super pricey (something like 26 Euros), though there are terrific cafes (with cats!) in the big square behind the hotel. We were on our honeymoon, but almost everyone else here appeared to be business travelers. Still, I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “short stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: deisegirl_03
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some good and bad points. It has a good central location, with a tram line just outside, The hotel is basic and clean with nice, accomodating staff. Had to complain however about the first room (room 125) that we were given. It was virtually impossible to get any sleep due to the large volume of traffic from the street outside!! Also the bathroom was minisule. The closet was actually bigger.!!! The second room was slighter bigger with a better bathroom. The beds are very soft, which is good or bad, depending on your preference.All in all this hotel is good for a short break, but you get what you pay for when it comes to hotels in amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “simple hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: getaroundkaty
Reviews.Content: We had a problem with our room 338 it was near the lift shaft and hummed all the time - we asked to move - this didn't seem a problem to them and they knew all about the lift - suggest they either soundproof the rooms around this or get the lift mended. We moved to a room on the next floor and on the opposite side and it was quieter and larger. Our rooms were of decent size for Amsterdam - the beds were clean and comfy, but the carpets and lower parts of both rooms were in need of a good clean - but it's nothing horrendous as some people have said and maybe the weather had taken it toll - ice and snow. The walls near the window seemed to have dust all over them - it was attracted to the textured wallpaper. The windows do open and you can control the temperature - other reviews have said not. Also there is a flatscreen tv, usual European hotel options but also BBC 1, 2 which was a bonus. The bar stays open till 11pm, but there is another bar called the Soprano's in the hotel - we walked in and out again - not our scene - no real ales and tragic pianist doing jokes....when there are friendly bars just over the bridge why bother. We didn't have breakfast at E18 each a bit too expensive - so cannot comment on the food There is a swanky restaurant attached to the hotel - we didn't try this so ditto. Downside is it is E7.50 extra to have a kettle in your room it only supplied 3 teabags and 2 coffees. This seems to be general practice now in a lot of hotels, which I'm not keen on as I like a cuppa when I get in from a night out. This hotel is in a good area for seeing everything. Also you are not far for decent restaurants and bars. Transport is good everywhere, even better on a bike.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Claire028
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my partner. The location of the hotel is perfect for a tourist attractions. The hotel itself was fine, basic but clean and beds were super comfortable. Corridors and rooms could do with some TLC but nothing major. Breakfast was very nice, anything you want and staff were very helpful. I would definitely return to this hotel if stay in Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “stayed one night”
Reviews.Author: Janey B
Reviews.Content: nice clean hotel, nice and friendly staff, not far from everything thats was going on, shopping and nite life. i would highly recommend hotel eden to any one traveling to amsterdam and would stay there again.The staff were there for any little thing, and it was done straight away.

Reviews.Title: “1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect for 1 night stay...excellent location, clean room and reception area, friendly and helpful staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Amsterdam, and I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great location, horrible cleaning”
Reviews.Author: tatiana63
Reviews.Content: I would like to rate this hotel great. The location is fabulous. Rooms are small but have all you might need. TV only shows BBC and Europe news in English. The cleaning in this hotel is horrible. They removed the garbage plastic bag from the receptacle and left it on the table on top of my things. May be we are spoiled in the US. But I am originally from Russia. This is the worst cleaning I experienced in many years of travel in multiple countries. If the fix it, I would give them 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “good choice of hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Luis L
Reviews.Content: excellent location, good breakfast, king bed and service ok.

Reviews.Title: “dirty with pubes in the bed”
Reviews.Author: adam p
Reviews.Content: i checked in on the 25 of jan 2012 in the 3 star part of the hotel and was horrified by the standard of there so called 3 star lol the bed was dusty like it had been sleeped in it had hairs and pubes in the bed no joke with dust every where and its not just me being fussy there was thick dust every where in the bed head board every where. i had to clean my self i told the manager about this problem and he offered me another room which was bigger but twice as dirty what a joke i had to go down in the morrining when people was booking in and and tell them again infront of the other guests and raise my voice and say there was pubes in the bed and it was discusting then i got moved up to the 4 star which was very nice but seems like they onily clean the 4 star side of the hotel and just put the people in the 3 star side like hens and stags dont dont dont book the 3 star side belive me get the 4 star side if you can afford it but on the up side great locaction in the middle of everything

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lisi_rosebud
Reviews.Content: The Eden Hotel is in a perfect location for exploring Amsterdam. The river Amstel is right on the door step with the Opera House a stones throw away. Rembrant square is at the back of the hotel with a selection of cafes, bars, resturants and coffee shops. The flower market is a 2 min walk away and the Leidseplein about 10 min walk. Red light is 10 min walk and central station about 15/20mins. If you dont feel like walking though, there is a tram stop (number 9) on Rembrant square which will take you to and from the centre. The Hotel is quiet. Nothing special but a good place to rest your head after a busy day in Amsterdam. Staff are ok. We spoke to some friendly ones and some not so approchable ones. Rooms are slightly on the small side and quite dark with loads of dark wooden furniture. But does the job for a 3 night stay. The bed is very comfy. Sheets & Towells changed every other day but room is cleaned daily (bins changed, etc) There are marks on the carpet/walls and the bath/shower could do with a good scrub but rooms are clean enough. Big downside is the room is heated by a small radiator by the window and it isnt the warmest so rooms were quite chilly. All rooms are charged for City Tax when you leave - quite cheap though so no worries. I would recommed this hotel if you can find a nice deal for it. Isnt the greatest but does the job and the location couldnt be better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tatty_Tanton
Reviews.Content: The hotel isnt in the best location, about 15 min walk to Dam square. But it is right next to the ice bar and plenty of other shops. The hotel its self is very modern, clean and friendly. the rooms have TV and hairdryer and the breakfast was lovely! Deffinatly stay here again as it is just the right amount of space away from the hustle and bustle in a pretty area!

Reviews.Title: “I would certainly go back!”
Reviews.Author: Stumpy118
Reviews.Content: This hotel overall was really good. Nice and modern with nice friendly staff, and a nice breakfast. The only small negative was our room was not ready on check in time but we were given complimentary drinks for the inconvenience. The location was perfect, with plenty going on within walking distance, and a short tram ride to central station. I will certainly go back to this hotel when I next visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, room, and price”
Reviews.Author: apad03
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights in this hotel and we were very happy with our stay. The location of this hotel is very central to everything in Amsterdam. Amsterdam isnt that big of a city anyways so you should really try to find the best price/quality hotel. This hotel fits that bill. The front desk is very helpful and the lobby is very modern and well maitained. They have a nice resturant/bar but really you should be out in Amsterdam looking for a bar instead. The front desk is especially helpful. They helped us find a couple of resturants, call cabs, helped with our luggage, etc. Very friendly and always asking if we needed anything. The best part about this hotel is the price of the rooms and what you get for that price. The rooms are very nicely decorated and maintained. The bathrooms are updated and comfortable. We got a room with a view of the canal in front of the hotel and it was great. When we checked into our room, put our luggage down, and opened the window it was beautiful to see the houseboats and the city from your window. Really if you are spending any time in your hotel room outside of sleeping and changing clothes your doing it wrong. Get yourself a comfortable hotel to sleep and get out there to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: PieBelly_manicolo
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel with my partner. After reading some of the reviews, we were a little sceptical. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The reception is bright and modern. The receptionist Leoni was very helpful and checking in took no time at all. You will also need to pay an additional City Tax in addition to what you have already paid for your room. This is standard everywhere and is charged at 5%. Our room was perfect, over looking the river with a great view. The room had all the amenities required. Coffee making facility and blow dryer. Even the shampoo and shower gel is of good quality. Towels were replaced daily. My only tiny moan is that it was slightly cold, however, my partner switched on the air con which is also a heater. Problem solved. The location of the hotel is excellent. You can get a train from the Airport to Central Station and get on #9 Tram which will take you to Rembrandtplein Square, the back entrance of the hotel is on the square. We walked from Central Station as it was a 20 minute walk and there is so much to see as you walk through the city. There is lot's of bars, coffee shops, Cafe's & Restaurants around the hotel and felt very safe. There is a really classy bar in the hotel which also has smoking room. Very smart inside. It also has a restaurant and looks very nice, though, did not sample anything. Overall I would recommend this hotel, the location, staff, quality and value for money and I would return when staying in Amsterdam. Book it and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quite simple but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: NYC_D12
Reviews.Content: My girlfiend and I stayed here in November 2011. The hotel was simple yet nice. The rooms were decent and the bathroom was nicely appointed. The staff was helpful and there was free wifi in the lobby which was very helpful with our communication back home. The lecation was excellent, we really were only steps to rembrant square which had a great nightlife from, restaurants and bars/clubs. This hotel was approximately 10 minutes or so by cab from the red light district. All in all it was a nice hotel, but the location is the best thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eden Hotel really good and central”
Reviews.Author: DeeEngland
Reviews.Content: Went to Amsterdam on a DFDS package and had 2 nights in the Eden hotel we arrived quite early and were surprised when they told us our rooms were ready. Take no notice of the bad comments as we found the hotel, staff and position of the hotel great. There was free internet in the lobby and enough computers for all to use. The hotel is right on the canal at the front and if you walked through to the back you were right on Rembrandt Square which was decked out as Winterland very festive. The breakfast at the hotel was one of the better ones we have experienced with both continental and english cuisine there was fresh fruit salad and freshly squeezed juices. On our last day 4th December they had put out little festive bags for the guests to take which were filled with chocolate santas among other goodies what a lovely touch. Would definitely stay here again. If you stay here the ice bar 4D experience which is on the same street is definitely worth a visit and not too expensivex

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eden Amsterdam for 3 nights with my Girlfriend, the first thing that struck us was the great location with brilliant views over looking the Amstel River alongside a lovely Bar/Cafe Amstel Hoeck that became our regular location for a middle of the day coffee or early evening Drink. The hotel was lovely to look at straight away greeted by concierge on the door who showed you to reception, the rooms were nicely decorated but i feel for the cost more attention to detail was needed not to mention the size of the room probably not enough to swing your arms as a double bed filled the room, we started by noticing a rip in our bed sheet and the ceiling tile was dropping down on the bath room, which meant for me being over 6ft tall a slight stoop was needed to shower. on the second day smelt smoke in the hall way during the day that later that night led to us being woken up with an over powering smell of another hotel user smoking in the corridor, the hotel seems to speak about a 150 euro fine but we saw no evidence of this. overall i really enjoyed our stay and for 3 nights the little things can be forgotten because i would go back there and the location really was brilliant

Reviews.Title: “trip to amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sna1
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for 2 days. The hotel is quite comfortable but can get noisy with the guests walking in and out. Room was clean and functional. The price is right. You can use tram #9 to get to the hotel from Central Station. Did not have the breakfast as there are plenty of other alternatives. On weekends the breakfast places open around 9. The hotel is worth it for a three star hotel. Nothing fancy but adequate. Staff is very helpful. Use them to your advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Heinerost
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a good service performance. The rooms are very simple.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Neanie15
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a couple, we have nothing bad 2 say about this hotel. Great location, friendly staff, beds sooo soft didnt want 2 get out. Everything was perfect. Amsterdam is just so expensive, dont use the small shops/supermarkets for drinks or snacks, nothing is priced and we sware they do it 2 charge us touriists more. Toliets are also hard 2 find around the city be prepared 2 pay 50c. Anne frank, sex museum and red light area are a must see. The coffeshops close 2 the hotel were all more expensive than the ones further away.. If we went bk we would go bk 2 this hotel great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place, not best for business.”
Reviews.Author: Paolo P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cute, very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. The room was extremely small. The power went out three times in my room, apparently because I had too much water in my iron (which I had to ask for, because there aren't any ironing boards in the room). There is no Internet in the room, only in the Hotel lobby / bar area. The bathroom was nice. I'd recommend the hotel for brief vacation stays, and maybe for single-night business stays.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall stay”
Reviews.Author: Bongoqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel to be fine. Im quite surprised by some of other peoples experience of this hotel. I guess it is pot luck what room you have, but ours was okay and clean, and there was a picture of a tulip on the wall that was quite cool. There was one member of staff that was rather rude, but there was also another member that was the exact opposite and really friendly and helpful who went out of her way to help us one day. I guess it is expensive as we paid Â£312 for 3 nights no breakfast, but amsterdam is expensive. Location is okay, right by rembrant square and 20mins walking distanc from red light district & van gough, heineken museum etc The benefit is that it is easy to get to, and quiet. Its near a few bars, but the coffee shops are not brilliant in this area (unless we went to the wrong ones!). Theres a really tasty falafell take away place near by which i highly recommend!!. There were no tea and coffee facilitates, but i dont think that should determine what makes a good hotel. The double room is two single beds pushed together but this is typicalof european hotels, and they were quite large single beds.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations for the price”
Reviews.Author: Autumnlady
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, near to tram stop, but in easy walking distance of many attractions and Dam Square. Our room was large, clean & very comfortable. Beds comfortable with crisp clean bedding, and area with desk, easy chairs, tv. There were tea/coffee making facilities, although if you take milk you will have to ask as they don't provide it as standard. We had a lovely view of the canal from our window, and took some lovely pics with the autumn trees. The concierge was a great help, and all the staff were friendly, polite, and nothing was too much trouble for them. Would definitely stay here again as felt it should have had a higher star rating, and was excellent value for money. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, comfy, would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was just as we expected it to be but even better. The room was clean and tidy and just a nice size (wasn't too small or too big). We arrived a little earlier before check in time and they had our room ready for us so we didn't have to wait. Its location was great, within walking distance from Rembrandtplein, Leidseplein and most other places. Also there is an ice bar around the corner which is worth paying a visit too. Overall, i would visit this hotel again and it should be rated a 4 or 5*

Reviews.Title: “Should be rated with 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Nina980 Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was great, room with really comfortable madrasses, staff was really nice, good service. Nice and quiet area in the middle of everything, 2 minutes walk to the rembrandt place with a number of restaurants, theater and hot night life. 5 minutes walk to the flowermarket and shopping streets. Shopping is one of the best with a lot of trendy shoppingstreets wherever you go. The hotel give you a very good value for the money and should be rated to 4 stars!!! We will return to Eden next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, but could be better without a few minor down points....”
Reviews.Author: Luke T
Reviews.Content: We were staying here as a group and had booked 3 rooms for 6 people - two in each. One of our group (the friend I was sharing with) arrived earlier than expected and asked to check in - he was given a key pass card to an apartment outside of the hotel. This would have been fine, but the bedroom in the apartment was in disrepair - the skylight blind didn't work and there were no curtains in the bedroom. The beds were really small and not what I would consider being worth the cash spent on the room. The downstairs part of the apartment was nice enough, but a bit of a waste of space really - a kitchenette on the side seemed a bit pointless. The worst point for us though was the apartment we had been given was at the top of 4 flights of very narrow and steep stairs - not ideal at all. After a good look around the appartment we went back into the hotel and asked politely at reception to have a room in the hotel itself. There was no issue and the receptionist gladly gave us our keycards to the new room. This room was much closer to meeting expectation - clean, spacious enough, with a nice ensuite bathroom. No complaints about that at all. Also, I am a very light sleeper, and I have to say that I slept as well as I could in this room - it was on the internal corridor link of the hotel though, so we weren't facing out onto the street which perhaps made it a quieter area of the hotel. I would have rated the hotel a bit higher than I have but for our final parting memory. We had checked out and were waiting in the lobby (free wifi here is a real bonus by the way - as are the desktop pc's free to use and browse the web) - anyway, we were waiting for a friend to check out and one of the bar staff (older woman with shorter hair) asked if we wanted a tea each before leaving. We said we were close to being out of cash and couldn't afford one, but thanked for the offer. The lady made the gesture that she would offer it to us complimentary - so we agreed. She brought the tea (in paper cups) and a biscuit for us each and we proceeded to drink our parting "gift". As we got up to leave and made our way to the exit, she followed us saying "Excuse me, are you going to pay?". We had made clear that we didn't want to have to afford to buy the Tea's beforehand - Tea's that we were never going to have in the first place, until they were offered gratis. Luckily between us someone could cover the 7 euros 50 for these small teas. It left a rather sour taste (not the tea - the experience). Overall I would say this hotel is located superbly for getting around Amsterdam - we walked most places from here and I would suggest that walking is the best way to get around the city - the trams seem to have a complicated pre-pay scenario for tickets which doesn't make it easy to hop on and hop off. If you are heading further out of the city on the Metro, you can get a 24 hour ticket for 7 euros - this was handy for us as we made two trips to the Amsterdam ArenA on Friday and then again on Saturday. Breakfast wasn't included in our tariff, but the St James' Gate Irish bar in Rembrandtplein just behind the hotel serves an excellent array of breakfasts including veggie one's - and their menu of daytime and evening meals is also excpetional - the portion of fish is one of the largest I've received. Two recommendations in terms of the RLD - if you are heading to Amsterdam for a "lads trip" or Stag do - take in the Banana Bar - you will not be disappointed with the experience! A decent sports bar in the RLD is called "Old Wembley" - cheapest pints of Heineken in the city I'd say at 4 euros a pop. Heineken experience is also worth doing - though be prepared for a lengthy queue once in the attraction for the "brew you" simulation. Don't bother with the World of Ajax Stadium Tour - hardly get to see anything of real interest and don't even get to see the dressing rooms. Van Gogh museum was superb. On this trip I didn't take in Anne Frank House, but I have been there before and it was also amazing. Just a heads up though - we failed to make use of the concierege attraction booking system available at the hotel - if you are planning on taking in any of the sights, I'd suggest using that service as we queued to get into everytyhing we did for at least 20 minutes due to not having pre-bought tickets. There appeared to be no extra cost if tickets were bought on site at the Eden Hotel either, so do make use of this if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks charm, ok for business travelers, card-key light switch is inconvenient, large and impersonal except for nice concierge.”
Reviews.Author: gr8ful47
Reviews.Content: First, the good: concierge was excellent and front desk staff was very good. I like the cool unusual light 'mural' in the headboard area. Free wifi was awesome but only worked in lobby, and each day you need a new password. What I found annoying was you must use the card key to turn on the room light on and off. It is hard to see how tom orient the card in the dark and takes extra time fumbling in the dark after a long day with bags and stuff. It was inconvenient enough to make me not want to stay here again. Also, you need the card key for the elevator also. I understand this may be needed for security, but other hotels don't do this in Amsterdam where I have stayed. The hotel is sort of business oriented and has a 1980s vibe that lacks charm. It is just a block from the Rembrandtplein and has easy access to restaurants, bars, etc. It is not that close to most of the museums.

Reviews.Title: “great room, nice staff, reasonable location and vfm”
Reviews.Author: Stopstick
Reviews.Content: Spent a very enjoyable long weekend at the Eden Hotel. Shared room with a mate and we both found it comfortable at a reasonable price. Close to Rembrand Square meant it was easy to get to the centre of Amsterdam by tram (2.60 euros) and close enough too for some bars and cafes and baker shops for snacks and beverages of all kinds. Never used the hotel for food. Breakfast was offered at 15 euros - just a little pricey I think. Staff were very pleasant though and liked the security measures - concierge, swipe cards for the lift etc. Happily return there again. .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: loulou9025
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel friday 4th November til7th of November 2011. What a fanstatic hotel and great location-walking distance to all areas on Amsterdam, 10 mins from Dam sqaure, red Light District, 2min from Rambrant sqaure,Waterlooplein 2 secs over the Bridge. Very clean, modern,fabolous resturant,bar and helpful pleasent staff. We would defintely stay here again. We realised on our last night that there is a fine dinning resturant and Piano Bar attached to the rear side of the hotel.-The resturant and bar was advertised in the lifts but the location was not clear on the advert ( shame we didnt realise sooner) Really comfortable beds, changed and cleaned daily.

Reviews.Title: “needs a little attention”
Reviews.Author: gabewong
Reviews.Content: i stayed for five nights in a ground floor room with a double bed that faced a back lane. while i can sleep through possibly anything, you might wish to avoid this if you are a light sleeper as the noise from people passing this lane can be quite intrusive since its close to a number of clubs. the room was dimly lit, the furnishings and bathroom were a little worn out and needed attention. there is free wifi in the lobby and bar which is a bit of a consolation. bar staff and concierge were friendly while the check-in staff were indifferent. the wifi was down one day and when i enquired about where i could get internet access, the receptionist just shrugged her shoulders. she could have suggested what i found later, that they had a few computers in the bar area which had working internet connections that were free for hotel guests. putting aside the great location, i would definitely not be coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Inferior room standard”
Reviews.Author: richard315945
Reviews.Content: We were led to believe that we had booked into the Eden Rembrandt four star. When we arrived we were led into their sister hotel the Eden Amsterdam at the back of the same building. The room was small and although clean was worn and threadbare and the duvet had cigarette burns.Room facilities were limited and on one day our room was not made up until 4pm. I think this would be a good budget hotel but not if you were hoping for something a little more special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: Outstanding value for money at Â£60 per night for a twin room - stayed here in December 2010. Large room and bathroom both immaculate with plenty of wardrobe space. Nice to find a room not over heated. Very friendly desk staff with no hard sell on having he hotel breakfast which was excellent value for money for the quality and quantity on offer. Very near the Flower Market and several nice bars and cafes and 5 minutes walk to the nearest metro station for getting to Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam without the fuss”
Reviews.Author: Christopher D
Reviews.Content: Great location - good hotel and Friendly staff I have stayed here on business a few times this year and found it to be the best kept secret in Amsterdam. Having stayed at many other city centre hotels in Amsterdam over the last 2 years. All of which have been fine but none has compared to the nice surroundings and ambiance. Just walking out the front door of the Eden really reminds you that Amsterdam has such a great history and culture. The hotel is situated right in the heart of Amsterdam and close to all the Museums and sights. Recommend this hotel for a weekend or business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay and Location but NO Wi-Fi in the room”
Reviews.Author: laxin16
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here during our European beer tour and I was very pleased with our stay. The hotel is a bit of a hike from the central train station especially with luggage. Therefore, I would strongly suggest taking a tram or taxi from central to the hotel. The hotel itself is conveniently located just minutes from Rembrandt square and other attractions. We walked everywhere in Amsterdam as taxis and trams were rather expensive. The room was nice with two twin sized beds a small flat screen TV and typical European bathroom. There was a safe which we used at no additional cost. The only drawback is thereâ€™s NO Wi-Fi in the room. You had to sit in the lobby to use the Wi-Fi which is very inconvenient. Overall, I would recommend this hotel based on location.

Reviews.Title: “would go back & great location”
Reviews.Author: BettySpagetti
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed this hotel, it was a great location for bars on a night in rambrant square. also not long to get to the main tourist things like the dungeon, madam tussards, dam square. it is also very close to a main shopping street. the hotel itself i thought was nice, much bigger than it looks from outside & i found the room an ok size. it was decorated very nice & i thought quite trendy. yes we had a chip in the bath & the shower glass screen wasnt big enough but for the location & cost & handy free security safe in the room i thought it was ideal. we didnt have a nice view from the room but that didnt bother us as all we wanted was a good location & a safe clean room. we went on a dfds trip & it cost for the travel on dfds & the room for 1 night b&b a total of Â£110 each so all in all think a good price for 3 nights away. the breakfast was lovely too and was all help yourself.you could choose from bacon, scrambled egg & sausages & toast & then on top of that all continental items like smoked salmon, cheese, meats, croissants,cereal etc etc. only thing i could say negative was it was busy & we had to wait/hunt for a table. all in all i would stay here again & also found all the staff helpful & friendly. the concierge was the best though & he is a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DG-KWI
Reviews.Content: Rooms are so small and the Toilet is even smaller. This is the smallest ever room that I have ever stayed in. Just about a foot distance from the bed to the wall and the Toilet dont even talk about it. On the other hand very clean and neat. Paid Eu:70/- for a single room with no Breakfast or Internet. Location is city center just infront of Rembrandt Square, 5mins. walk to the flower market, 4mins walk to shopping street & 7mins walk to Dam Square. If its just a room to stay the night while your out the whole day then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rosescarnations
Reviews.Content: A great location by the Amstel river/canal. A pleasant experience though first room we were offered was extremely small & dull in all respects - this was a comfort room. Upgraded to a better room & enjoyed our stay. Nicely equipped hotel friendly concierge & staff. Dissappointed to have to pay a Tourist tax on hotel room - doesn't exactly attract me to a return visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Daimond in the Sky weekend”
Reviews.Author: PSJandJ
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in excellent location. I rang before we arrived and commented on the "dirty shower" review on Trip Advisor. We had a lovely room overlooking Amstel. We booked Room only so breakfast was expensive but provided excellent choice. Good cafe next door for cheaper start to the day. Stayed 4 nights, all staff very pleasant and helpful. Good tram connections in Rembrandt Square you can easily take train from airport and tram from Central station. We would definitely stay again.. Did a guided bike tour which I can recommend. Saturday night was quite noisy ..lots of revellers ..If you sleep lightly ask for a room at the back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and close to all your party needs”
Reviews.Author: FCRanch
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location. Our room was clean and quiet. Room location makes the difference. Close to all attractions. "Coffee shops" on one side and Gay bar on the other. A lot of fun with a live and let live attitude. Be careful of bicycles. They have priority. Go early morning to see Anne Franks house. Line up can be quite long. Book with easy jet and get a combo rate. That was our case. Overall, great location to see Amsterdam and experience a liberal attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: SANDRA W
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, rooms very clean, and right in the heart of Rembrandt Square. Would recommend this hotel, we arrived at midday, and was able to go straight to our room. The rooms are reasonably small, but you don't go to a fantastic city like Amsterdam to sit around in your room all day. Breakfast was good value, with a choice of breads, smoked salmon, salads, cooked, and fruit. Lovely comfy beds and pillows too! Anne Frank house a must, very moving! And obviously the famous Red Light District is an eye opener!!

Reviews.Title: “Super location but not the best rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gottogetaway01
Reviews.Content: Spent almost a week here middle of August. Right in the Amstel area & hopping distance from Rembrandtplein where there are tons of restaurants/bars and transit options. Was very surprised at how middle of the city it was located when others say its not great. Had to take a taxi from Centraal Station due to luggage and cold and during rush hour - very expensive. Entrance of hotel is nice. I read here there is a new section and and old one. I of course got the old one and you could tell. I wore my flipflops constantly in the room as carpet was pretty old and floors in shower were full of dirt/mildew etc. However, hotel totally full and was on a month long stay of Europe and didn't want to fight the fight when staying in multiple hotels. Lobby staff helpful. The newer Eden is on the back side of the hotel through the lobby which I discovered on the last night! The buffet restaurant is really expensive for breakfast so didn't use it. Found tons of quickee places for a bagel/croissant/juice/coffee just a couple of streets away there were fraction of the cost. Since there are so many options in Amsterdam I will look for another one next time but if you are looking for eaee of location, its for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: thetathams
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with great staff especially concierge and bar staff - our room was small with no tea or coffee making facilities - friends had a larger room with these facilities so good to check beforehand - the room was clean and well decorated - we were too busy packing in the sights to be much in there really!!!! would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: prcire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here whilst celebrating a wedding anniversary. Although it doesnt look like it from the outside, the hotel is quite large and backs onto a second hotel through the reception area. Our room was great for what we were looking for and the location was perfect as you could exit out the back of the hotel onto Rembrandt Square or out the front onto one of the main canals. Overall I think the hotel was okay value for money, although from our investigations, decent hotel accommodation in Amsterdam tends to be a bit pricey. I must say that one of the key features of the hotel is the Con-siege in the lobby - lots of great information / maps etc, which really added to our stay and exploration of Amsterdam. I would reccommend this hotel to a friend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: alliswell252
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Eden Hotel. I stayed there a couple nights to do some sightseeing before a conference for work. Being on the Amstel was terrific and I walked everywhere I wanted to go. The room and bathroom were small but clean and the space was very functional.

Reviews.Title: “Huge let down for money paid”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: From the entrance of the hotel you expect the rooms to match, unfortunately this is not the case. Me & my husband went to Amsterdam for a break in September 2011 and choose this hotel as looked nice from pictures. The 'queen' size bed was two single beds pushed together and we even had 2 single duvets! The bath had was very worn with big chips in - you would never have a bath in! The wardrobe door was broken, the skirting board was broken, the walls dirty, there are no windows to open. Noise was horrendous, every movement could be heard. Oh and no tea/coffee facilities! All in all disappointing,would never stay here again, the smaller hotels look much better!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: onthegoNagoya
Reviews.Content: The Eden is a lovely hotel in the old section of the city. We were upgraded on our arrival and had a room with a view overlooking the convergence of 5 canals. It was the weekend and we knew to expect noise from the canal boats and the street traffic-but it didnâ€™t detract from the pleasant atmosphere. Small quaint room, and one of the most comfortable beds Iâ€™ve ever slept in. The bathroom is miniscule, but adequate. No room service, and no mini-bar. Had to walk downstairs to ask for ice. Full Buffet breakfast is worth the money. No pets and no smoking. Front desk will issue a coupon for a discount on parking close by. Great base and easy starting point for walking anywhere in the city. Many bars and restaurants close by. Concierge will give you a street map. We really enjoyed our stay and hope to go again soon! Perfect getaway for couples! Tip: Definitely visit the Floating Flower Market-you can even buy tulip bulbs that can be mailed to the US.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Beau2011
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend recently visited Amsterdam for 2 nights in August 2011 and stayed at the Eden Hotel. This hotel was surprisingly big inside, the staff were friendly and spoke good English. The room was clean, tidy and good value for money with en suite facilities including a bath/shower. While we were there one of the lifts was broken but we did not mind. I booked room only as there were many local cafes around the hotel and we planned on going out for breakfast. We walked from the central train station to our hotel and is was a good half an hour walk away. If you have heavy luggage I would recommend getting a taxi, but as we only had one bag we were fine plus we go a good look at Amsterdam. The hotel was only around a 15 minute walk to the red light district and about 15 minutes walk from the start of the main shopping area. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Avisha G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay here. The location was convenient and also close to the metro. The rooms are are not very spacious, however it was comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. We were not happy with the first room we were given as there is a club on the street adjacent to the hotel and we could not get a good nights sleep. The next day we were given a new room.

Reviews.Title: “great time and sleep”
Reviews.Author: john046079
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eden hotel amsterdam in febuary 2011 with me and my partner.I must say i cant knock this hotel yes it needs to be refubished but as awhole great value for money and great sleep the beds are sooo comfy clean room and great clean bathroom which i did not expect. You cant knock eden for the value very good hotel good polite staff service was ok and everything you need is very close by. I would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not more than 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Esa I
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a quite big disappointment. We had quite big expectations for this hotel since it was not cheap but... The standard room was small and located in the first floor and the view was in the dirty and very small courtyard. We did not actually know if the sun was shining! The room was not cleaned properly and had no minibar. There was some odd smell in the room and it felt humid. WIFI was only available on the lobby and the connection in the room was expensive (15â‚¬ /day). Soundproofing was poor. Staff unfriendly. Only plus was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price, tho location excellent”
Reviews.Author: wizziebutt
Reviews.Content: Had to argue about our room; they first gave us a very tiny room with an awful view with two twin beds looking very used up pushed together. Finally moved to to a slightly larger room, still an awful view, but a double bed. Hotel was clean, the maids did an excellent job each day. Does not have an exercise facility. Price is high for what you get. Would not book there again.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: julieei
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night ( a DFDS mini break )..we had a twin room-along a narrow corridor -away from everything! Early check in- room was availble, Clean hotel, nice room and bathroom, except the new styled 'glass door'!. the window had no view- except for a lookout onto an internal space complete with pigeons and rubbish...we kept the curtain closed..as it was away from the reception area, i found the WiFi did'nt work in our room. That said breakfast was fine- nice informative concierge and good locality for canl tours/bus...l would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we could expect”
Reviews.Author: Thiago S
Reviews.Content: They changed our room to a better one with a double bed and no charge. It was a great night! Certainly we would come back to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: slim8589
Reviews.Content: Funny isn't it how you can have a totally different experience from another guest in the same hotel at the same time? We stayed for 3 nights and loved it. The hotel could not be better located. The city is very compact and the hotel is in walking distance from all of the sights. It is also opposite one of the canal bus stops so that worked for us too. The hotel is not flash, but it is not shabby either, certainly more upmarket than, say, a travelodge. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful (I needed to print out my boarding pass and they did it for me). The rooms are small, the shower door bangs into the desk unit one way or the toilet the other. However, we did not go to Amsterdam to sit in our room and view it simply as a place to sleep. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean, everything worked, so overall very good. There was a hairdryer, safe, plenty of storage, a desk and a flatscreen tv that gets the BBC as well as news channels. It is a shame that the review before this suggests you should not stay, we would go back tomorrow! One word of warning, there is a city tax (5% of your room cost) to pay on checkout, so if you are on a budget watch out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value and location on the Amstel River”
Reviews.Author: corsagi
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel, perfectly situated along the Amstel River, and very close to the Flower Market. I walked everywhere in Amsterdam - as the central location of the hotel was convenient for this, and I enjoyed walking to see the sights . The single bed was expected for this single traveller. The bedding was comfortable, and the room was quiet. Nice, clean bathroom. Great breakfast buffet was included. What was a surprise is that the hotel is actually connected to the more expensive Hotel Eden Rembrandt Square. Each hotel is in a separate tower, but they share the restaurants located in between each hotel's lobby. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: Theresa061
Reviews.Content: Clean room. No amenities. A little high priced for what you get. I would not return here, but it is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Rustylee123
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel with friend, got told with a smile that we had been upgraded to a room with its own lounge area, etc. We where then escorted out of the Hotel to a bedsit with rotten carpets etc. We went back to reception to complain that this is not what we booked and were told the hotel is fully booked. As male friends we could accept this because we only needed a base and nothing romantic. We asked if they would add breakfast to our booking, as we in reality where doing them a favour. We where told a flat no!. The deception at reception on arrival was disgraceful. We where kept awake in the morning with pigeons pecking on the apex of our roof. We went back to reception and demanded to be moved, The manager laughed but then we were then moved to a nice room in the main hotel. The staff then managed to lose some of our belongings during the changeover! The staff basically couldn't give a dam about your stay. Shame

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms....”
Reviews.Author: racedk
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for exploring Amsterdam. Metro, trams nearby as well as restaurants and shopping. Clean room, ok breakfast. Get a room overlooking the canal - I think thoose are the best ones. Make sure when you book. Friendly helpfull compromising staff when we were unsure about paying for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Scooby7UK
Reviews.Content: The Eden is a standard tourist hotel but its location makes it perfect for a visit to Amsterdam. Located on the Amstel it is within walking distance of all the main tourist attractions and about a 30 minute walk from the central station (where you'll arrive if you've come by ferry or plane). The prices are very competative vs some of the other hotels, and be wary of properties described as "City Centre" by some of the budget airlines which can be a 30 minute tram ride fom where you need to be. The rooms are clean and comfortable and we didn't hear any noise at night despite there being a club in the alley behind our room. There are many tour groups that use the hotel and I guess they must heve breakfast included becausae at 18Euros each it certainly wasn't worth the money. It wasn't a problem though because there is a very nice Cafe just next door (back entrance), or if you walk a bit further (5 mins) across Rembrandt Qsuare you'll find a Hema which does coffee and a croissant for 2 Euros and you can sit with the locals! For evening meals you'll be spoilt for choice! - You could try Febo which is how the Dutch do Fast Food (near Hema) which is McD type food sold through self service vending displays, and if you like Chinese, you must try Wok to Walk (about 6 in the city) which offers superb, freshly cooked chinese food. The free WiFi worked well (although you need to know that the access code changes daily) and the safe in the room means you don't have to carry your valubles with you.

Reviews.Title: “We will not be returning to Eden Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: GMG78
Reviews.Content: The faults are just too numerous to mention in detail. From the rude and unhelpful staff to the shabby 'hostel' feel to the place, it was a poor end to an otherwise great trip around northern Europe. There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms, no information on the hotel services, the breakfast or the local area. There were definitely no nice touches that could make all the difference to a stay in such an establishment. The hotel staff clearly have a problem in providing even the basics, as like a previous reviewer, we had no loo roll either! When we left the container open to signal this, we returned to find a wad of the stuff hanging out as if to signal the staff member's irritation! Had we not booked the stay via Railbookers (their service and previous hotels were all good!) we would have been tempted to move to an alternative location. Needless to say, we will not be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Woz69
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I was informed that I had been given an upgrade to an Apartment which was not in the main hotal. Unfortunately the Apartment was very out dated, shabby, smelly and dirty. This was not an upgrade! It was an insult! I have never stayed in such a poor room in any hotel in 20 years of travelling all over the world. I would not recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: daskid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located along the main street of the tourist area. The good thing is, it's not in the central part but a bit farther, more peaceful and quiet area and I didn't mind walking a couple of minutes more for this hotel. It's close to everything: cafes, bars, RLD, canal, bridge and tram station. I really like my room - it's like the small version of my Intercontinental hotel room in Warsaw. The look of the room is modern, I got a good night sleep, the bathroom looks new and clean. It has also its own tub and liquid soap dispenser. The buffet has wide variety of food and drink choices. I also liked the unlimited fresh fruit desserts. The hotel staff are very nice and really got what I expected from the time I decided to stay in this hotel. I will definitely consider staying here again in my next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, let down by bad service”
Reviews.Author: Tash103
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Amsterdam and we stayed 2x nights at Eden Hotel. The hotel is in a good location, close to rembrant square and Waterlooplien markets. Roughly 20-30min walk from train station, and a quick tram ride to Dam square. The hotel is very well kept in the lobby and reception area, although we found the rooms were not quite what they looked like on the internet. It also has a restaurant/bar area downstairs. We didnt eat here as it was quite expensive. The staff were terrible. We would not stay here again because of this. When we had asked for assistance on two occasions, after a long wait in line, the lady on reception was not willing to help and pointed us in the direction of the concierge desk which had nobody there to assist. It took nearly an hour for us to find someone who could put our luggage in the storage room for the day. We also asked for some toilet paper for our room as the cleaner had forgot to put any in, and when we returned later on at night, no loo paper! - and we had to ask another two times after that! its not a hard request. The rooms are presented quite nicely, excellent bed, very comfortable, and shower was average. Wouldnt stay here again due to bad service. Plenty of other places to stay in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “In serious need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: leanne051
Reviews.Content: While the front desk staff were friendly and helpful, the generally poor state of the rooms left us extremely disappointed. The carpets in the rooms were so filthy we couldn't take our shoes off. The bathroom has glass walls, which is not great when you're travelling with your elderly father, as I was. Worst of all, the sheets and towels were so worn they had holes in them! This was consistent across several rooms as we stayed there as a group. The daily room service was also poor, with consumable complimentary items not supplied right from the start and not replaced during our week-long stay. I would recommend everyone steer clear of this hotel until they upgrade their housekeeping services and renovate the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: aaadna
Reviews.Content: We loved Eden Amsterdam - central location, very good breakfast, clean. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL ,WILL USE AGAIN AND AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: ally1237
Reviews.Content: First trip to Amsterdam and read all the reviews on internet before going there decided in the end to book up with the EDEN HOTEL . I was a bit apprehensive as to what to expect but after my short tram ride to rembrandtplein and a two minute walk around the corner i was well impressed by the entrance to the hotel once you enter that wide sliding you enter the long and very impressive hallway , this part of the hotel is apparently a star less than the adjoining hotel but you wouldnt think it . the reception staff were very friendly and although we arrived at the hotel at 0700 we were allowed to book in and leave our luggage in the luggage room . we were told we could try back at around 1100 to see if our room was ready but to no avail but it was ready for around 1300 . The room was on the second floor which was easily accessed by the lift which can only be used with your pass card along with the door to the stairs so the place is quite secure. Our room did not have a canal view but that did not matter as we were not planning on staying in much . The room was relatively big plenty of room to move around . the bathroom was very clean and tiled all over with scented soaps at the sink and shower and there was a bath . Our rear window looked out onto a fire exit and the windows of the other Eden , but not a problem . there was also a tv on the wall facing the bed ( no tea or coffe ) only in the superior rooms . the bed which was two singles joined together was very big and comfy we slept in every day and never got disturbed by the cleaners just leave the reminder on the door handle to let them know.. we didnt eat the breakfast or dinner there as it is expensive but the smell in the morning was great. there is a quiet bar in the main hallway which is reasonably priced , and when that closes we were invited into the adjoining eden where there was a piano bar open until 0400 and was very entertaining although very pricey , great service though as you are taken to your seat and served all night with your bill presented at the end . After a long day out walking we came back to find our room cleaned and towels changed every day with handkerchief box and tissues all topped up (great service) At check out our flight was in the evening but the concierge was happy for us to leave our luggage with them for as long as we had to . Also he was very helpfull with travel tips on how to get around as we had to get to the Arena for a concert . the hotel is very well situated for the ten minute walk to anywhere in the city , just a short walk around the corner to rembrandtplien where the bars are open till 0200 during the week and you can sit and chill out in the afternoon with a coffee or beer watching the locals on the bikes or the street entertainers , very clean and safe area . another short walk across the bridge to waterlooplein where there is a daily market and if you venture further on to the quayside there is a walkway around the area which takes you back into the main city use all the little side streets as you may miss out on some little surprises . Amsterdam is a beautifull city with lots to see we walked everywhere from out hotel the longest walk was to Ann franks house which was about fifteen minutes but everything is easy to find with the map gifted to you by the hotel . One piece of advice if you are going with kids , read the street signs as you walk around as everytime we went walking we always ended up back in the red light district all roads seem to lead to there ( a must see ) not to seedy , we went to see it during day and at night . still very busy in day time . didnt manage to get into ann franks house or the royal place due to the long qeues , so make sure you are up early to get in any of those places . ENJOY we will certainly be back

Reviews.Title: “Great location - recommended”
Reviews.Author: PhilNorwich
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this for my 50th. I was a little worried when I saw some of the reviews; but needn't have been . The Eden is in a simply great location just off Rembrant Square but far enough away not to be bothered by the noise. The flower market is a 5 minute or so walk. All of the staff that we encountered were polite and spoke very good English and the concierge was very helpful. The standard room, very comfortable and up to date. The buffet breakfast (included in our deal) was more than adequate. All the tea and coffee you could drink, cereals, pastries, croissants, cheese, ham, salad, as well as hot buffet of scarmbled eggs, sausages and bacon. We wouldn't hesistate to either return or recommend. My only slight niggle is that there is omnly one pc connected to a printer, which is frustrating when you're trying to check onto your flight and print your boarding pass and someone is sitting there on youtube or facebook!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: retiredandlovingit0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating both our 60th birthdays as well as 30yrs together and, after advising the hotel of our special occasion, they were wonderful in providing us with an upgrade to a very large room with treats. The staff were very professional and helpful and the location was perfect for us. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable stay, well recommended....”
Reviews.Author: Captain3004
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as a short city break with the wife, we loved the city, and the hotel. Will return to Amsterdam next year, and will definately plan to stay at the Eden Hotel once again. Great location away from the noisy centre, but close enough to walk to it. Rembrandt Square was still vibrant and busy, and a great base for our stay. Staff in the hotel very pleasant, helpful and knowledgable. Possibly the most comfortable mattress and pillows in any hotel room I have ever stayed, extremely comfortable and modern room. Great shower too, does make a difference, and room/hotel very clean also. 4.5 stars out of 5, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beware it could be you ....”
Reviews.Author: tony_ant_2011
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Hotel via Expedia. Arrived at the Hotel and was told the hotel was over booked so we were given an "upgrade" to an apartment. We were of course pleased thinking this might mean an upgrade to a suite. We were directed to concierge who were to show us to our room. We were taken out of the hotel to a house several doors down the road. We began to become suspicious. Concierge opened the door for us and told us our room was on the top floor. He did not offer to take our cases to the room and walked back to the hotel. As soon as we went through the door a damp, dank smell hit us. Eventually managed to reach the top floor but by this time effort of climbing the stairs that even Edmund Hilary would have found challenging had brought my partner close to an asthma attack. The stairway and halls very poorly decorated so by now we were fairly sure we were in for an unpleasant experience when we opened the door to our room. And we were right! The room was disgusting. I'm not sure whether this was staff accommodation or a student squat either way it was not fit for purpose. The furniture was damaged and badly warn. I wish we had stopped to take photos before leaving but the smell was unbearable. There was a "No smoking" sign on the door but it was clear that people had been smoking in the room recently. We left the room and began our decent to ground level simmering with anger. Upon reaching reception I demanded that we were given the room we booked. They were reluctant but eventually agreed. They however made no apology for trying to put us in that room or they distress they had caused. The room we were eventually given was of an acceptable standard. This event however blighted the start of the holiday. When we returned to the hotel later in the evening there was a light on in the top floor apartment so someone clearly had been put in that room. So as the headline says .. beware, it could be you!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room ever.”
Reviews.Author: Cosmic1255
Reviews.Content: What i don't like: The hotel is overpriced. Low ceilings. Incredibly dark and narrow corridor, floor of which is like roads in russia. I even thought that they put carpeting on a earth. Rooms are EXTREMELY tiny. To help your imagination i have to say that i wasn't able even to open my luggage because there wasn't enough space. Blankets are thin as a pillows. Cleanliness is bellow average. Please check photos which i added to my review. View from the window was "fantastic" on the wall of the next building. I guess 70% of rooms have same view. Glass door to the WC. Internet was slow. Get ready to pay tourist fee on checkout. What i like: its not far away from interesting places. I coming back to Amsterdam again this year and i will look for another hotel. I will not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hit & Miss”
Reviews.Author: DavidWasHere
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks on business. The room was tiny, with no coffee/tea facilities. Service varied dramatically depending on the member of staff. On the plus side it's in a reasonable location and the concierge service was great. Internet access was ok. I think this used to be a good hotel but has recently gone downhill a bit. If my company hadn't been picking up the bill I would have been very disappointed. I've stayed in far better for far less!

Reviews.Title: “Not brilliant...”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Trotter
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by a very pleasant receptionist who allowed us to keep our luggage in hotel as we were a couple hours early than check-in. From first impressions of the entrance hall it was clean and modern. However our room on the other hand...was really poor. It was clean so that wasn't an issue, but it was incredibly small, defiantly not big enough for two people. The beds were two singles put together, which made it very awkward to sleep in. It was very dark, with our only window facing a building wall and looking into other peoples rooms. The toilet doors are frosted glass, with no locks ( which is quite unsettling if you're wanting privacy in the toliet!) You have no coffee/tea facilities. Also the room itself seemed to need a lick of paint...walls and ceiling had marks and cracks, very very basic. Yes its quite good locations. But for the price we paid which wasn't cheap to be given a below average room really isn't brilliant business. Just to say aswell they will take a 50euro deposit off you at start of stay, which is fine, however when we checked out they told us they would now take city tax off our deposit, they failed to tell us at the start we'd have to do that. Overall it's not somewhere I would recommend. Service was good, but the hotel itself was not.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it we hope to be back”
Reviews.Author: barzeloren
Reviews.Content: The hotel stuf are very nice and kind and help as much as they can with every problem. The room is modern with LCD T.V. with local chanels. The best thing is the location of the hotel, near every thing. We ask for KOSHER meal, and got one free of charge. The bed is very soft and we didn't wont to get out of bed.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: travelbee28
