Reviews.Content: Eden Hotel was an oasis after a harrowing stay at Tulip Inn Amsterdam Centre (awful place). The room was small, but average for European standards. The bathroom was clean and modern. Staff were super friendly, and the food at Flo Brasserie and the breakfast buffet were wonderful. There are 2 sides to the hotel, a 5 star and a 4 star. I stayed in the 4 star at a rate of about 140 Euros/night. There was some flooding in the hallways (3rd floor) after moderate rains, but it did not affect my stay and it seemed to have been taken care of quickly. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for location, very poor in other aspects...stay away”
Reviews.Author: mariariel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden hotel for 6 nights. On our arrival at 3PM we were told that our room is not ready yet, and will be ready in 15-20 minutes. We were even granted a free drink voucher (which included local drinks, beer, coffee and tea). When we returned to the reception to check in, the receptionist kinda forgot about us and we had to remind her to call and check on our room. So she did and found out that no one has checked the room yet, so it will take another 20 min. Needless to remind that we were after a sleepless night and half day of wondering around the city. Then after 20 mins, when we approached once again the reception, we found out that the receptionists had changed. One receptionist was giving service to another guest so i approached another one, who couldn't give a damn about me standing there till after he was reminded by the other receptionist to approach me. the ignorant receptionist's name was Nick. After that we checked in. Room was of a good size, facing a building wall. Every morning except for Sunday we were awakened by hammers and radio and voices of construction workers performing works on a building next to the hotel. No one thought of telling us about this, let alone appologizing. The general feeling at the hotel is that they are pretty much feed up with the tourists plus "this is us doing you a favour, so shut up and be greatful". Rooms were not vacumed at all, housekeeping missed our room one day. The walls are worn out, bathtub needs some major repair. I found other person's hair in it. Bed linen have not been chaged once during the whole stay. TV had around 3-4 channels in English, all other stuff was on demand for 12.5EUR. Lift was out of order throughout 4 days in a row. No one from the staff has not once appologized or suggested that we use the other lift situated behand the bar. We had to discover it by chance. There were 4 PCs for public use in the lobby, however only 2 out of 4 worked throughout the whole stay. One PC was out of order because it required its mouse to be changed. No one cared, of course. Wi-FI free in the lobby, often not working due to updates. Staff at reception clueless. Dear Management of Eden Amsterdam! This is a honest, from-the-heart review meant for you to take some measures. The above incidents cannot be faced by travellers who arrive at your hotel expecting to get what they pay for, and they do pay quite a lot. What a waste. It used to be a nice hotel. Your staff has to be improved or at least guided how they should treat tenants. Nice lobby is not enough nowadays! It is so disappointing to come to one of the most beautiful and friendly capitals in the worls to discover such a low-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Stevens87
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden Hotel for a two night stay with friends on my first trip to Amsterdam. Arrived at the hotel to be greated by the lovely concierge manager, who couldnt have been more helpful! Rooms were very modern and comfortable. As we were travelling in a group of four we had rooms next to each other with a connecting door which was great. This would be ideal for a family travelling with children. The beds were AMAZING! So soft and comfortable... could have slept in them all day! The hotel was in a perfect location, just round the corner for the flower market and the shops. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of Dam!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it in every way except for the lack of double glazing!”
Reviews.Author: geordies94
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely helpful and courteous and held our luggage securely both as a result of our early arrival and also on our departure. The room was spacious, clean and had all that we needed for our brief overnight stay on a Friday night. However, we had a room with a lovely view overlooking the canal and were kept awake all night by noisy voices and long lasting blasts from car horns. The breakfast room was large and the food good.It was only the lack of sleep which spoiled our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque Location and Gold Standard in Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: Connie_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I arrived late in the evening for my three night stay, check-in was quick and my room was clean, quiet and provided a good environment for a comfortable nightâ€™s rest. The next morning I found the view outside the Eden Hotel Amsterdam every bit as spectacular as described online! A beautiful view of the canals was awaiting me and it was breathtaking. I also met the gold standard in concierge service, a true master of his craft. In the three mornings I was at the hotel I watched him masterfully direct the various groups of international tourists, gently guiding them into the best holiday experience with helpful suggestions, navigating tips and the like. I found his advice to be flawless and particularly helpful. A simple piece of advice to always follow the tracks on the way back to the hotel kept me from going the wrong way many a times when Iâ€™d reach a fork in the winding streets. He also advised me not to walk to the Lindbergh Tours office since there would be a shuttle bus that would pick up at the hotel. I had about 45 minutes before the shuttle was scheduled to arrive so I sought out a little breakfast spot I could dine in quickly in lieu of the hotelâ€™s breakfast buffet. He had to give it some thought since it was early Sunday and most places were not open yet for breakfast. But then he smiled and thought of Georgeâ€™s Deli above the grocery store just a quick walk from the hotel through Rembrandt square. The Eden has two hotels that are actually connected---the Eden Hotel Amsterdam exits towards the canals and Eden Hotel Rembrandt which exits Rembrandt Square (which is a great spot to stop for an afternoon break or for dinner). Georgeâ€™s Deli made the perfect simple breakfast of poached eggs with toasted rounds, REAL freshly squeezed OJ and tea! I dined there every morning. When I returned to the hotel, I admit I started becoming a bit anxious as I didnâ€™t want to loose my spot on the Lindbergh bus tour for a trip to the Keukenhof Gardensâ€¦an online purchase where I scored a ticket at a 50% discount while I was planning my trip. But I soon observed that the concierge was completely in control of the situation for all his hotel guests needs and sure enough the shuttle to the tour office finally rambled up just in the knick of time. As I was riding the shuttle I realized it would have been a bit of a hike to have to walk quickly and even perhaps slightly confusing if you were not familiar with the route, and so I was glad I had waited for the bus. Upon return from my tour I walked back to the hotel at a leisurely pace and enjoyed exploring the surrounding area. The last morning of my stay, the concierge was hard at it again handling all the tourists yet he had made a point of putting out an APB for the airport shuttle bus which he had warned me was highly unreliable. He had various colleagues keeping an eye out for the bus and made several calls giving the confirmation number he had secured for me the day before when he called in a reservation. Yet no bus appeared. It almost seemed like he was a cat setting the trap for the mouse----which would be the shuttle driver---who didnâ€™t stop at our hotel even though he reported he did and was forced to come back and get me because of all the extra points of control the concierge had put in place. This hotel was in a very convenient, picturesque location, the room was comfortable and the concierge service exceptional. I definitely would like to make a return visit here.

Reviews.Title: “This used to be a nice hotel --”
Reviews.Author: jonathandrake
Reviews.Content: When this was a Best Western, the quality was high. We've stayed here many times since 1999, and always found it to be welcoming, hospitable, and with a nice bar in front, where you could get a good cup of hot chocolate, and a pleasantly relaxed lobby area. The rooms were comfortable, the staff was friendly, and it was a nice tourist hotel. However, the new management has consolidated everything into one check in desk, where the staff are exceptionally rude, and the cleanliness in the rooms has gone way down, to say nothing of the newly cramped rooms, lack of mini=fridges, no wifi in the rooms, and the general atmosphere gone. It's a hotel for business people, drab and colorless. It's over -- the place has lost all its charm. And there are mice from time to time, as well, and poor sanitation in general -- also, the rooms aren't kept up, and some of them desperately need simply a coat of paint, some new light bulbs, and little touches like that. But the whole place has gone downhill. Once, I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Now, I would stay anywhere else. It's sad.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wcraft
Reviews.Content: A friendly and welcoming hotel in a quiet location yet near attractions and transport. We had a room overlooking the canal so perhaps a bit noisier but worth it to watch the passing traffic. Rooms were rather small but well equipped. Staff were helpful, especially the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a super little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nettles16
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated in a nice, pretty and quiet setting not far from the centre of Amsterdam. The style of the building is interesting, not bland or samey at all. The number nine tram stops at 'The Zoo' and the hotel is only a few steps away from the stop. The hotel was clean and pleasant to stay in. Our room was very large and overlooked the park next door. The bed was comfortable and there was a large settee and plenty of other furniture to use, all stylish. The TV was also comprehensive and available in several different languages. The shower room was a tad on the small side and there was a bit of a smell from the drains, but this was cured by putting boiling water down them, so no problem and certainly not bad enough to complain about. We didn't eat there as we were room only, but there were plenty of places nearby to grab a bite. You cannot check in before 3pm, but you can leave your bags there and return later.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GiovanniMondo
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to a conference for three days at the RAI. The hotel was basic for my needs, as I was out most of the time. Thank goodness I was travelling alone, as the room dimensions would have been cramped for two people. The desk chair could barely be slid into as it jammed between the desk and the bed. Downsides - no tea/coffee making in the room. Other than a wall mounted soap dispenser nothing in the way of toiletries. If it's marketed for business, the room safe was an inch too short to fit my laptop. There was an odd stain on the bedspread. It was very obvious with the way the bedspread was over the bed when I arrived. It was a little offputting, but as I tossed the bedspread onto a chair I wasn't that worried, but if they'd been one or two more hygiene issues then this would have been one of those hotel rooms you don't want to walk around in bare feet. Back to the positives. Breakfast buffet was reasonable, but was not included in room rate. Day two I went looking for a cafe nearby, but midweek at 7am none were open, so that sort of forced me to pay the â‚¬18 for the hotels. The bar looked fine and had free internet. Internet in my room was â‚¬15 per 24 hours. If I was on a personal (non-business) budget I'd stay again at the â‚¬108 per night BUT only after shopping around (via TA) for what I could get for the same elsewhere in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location lovely hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Montysmummy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam. After reading many reviews and looking at many hotels we settled on the Eden for location. Hotel in walking distance of most things. Staff extremely friendly and very helpful held our bags as we arrived early and when we checked out at 12pm we had a 9pm flight so again they were great in holding our luggage. The rooms were a little on the small side but clean and modern. Breakfast was continental help yourself with lots of choice plus tea and coffee. Visited the Ice Bar (at the bottom of the road) although expensive was a great experiance :) Very pretty and would go again to stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tong998
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Mon-Fri for a short break. Staff helpful,but as one of the other reviewers mentioned,be prepared for a 50 Euro deposit once you check in,and to pay a 5.30 Euro city tax PER NIGHT on check out!! Would we stay at this hotel again? yes,as it is in a good location,close to the shopping areas and trams.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but...”
Reviews.Author: ziopatrizio
Reviews.Content: ...the room quality and service should be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Heli30
Reviews.Content: This one was quite ok, good value for money. We spent two nights at the hotel, had asked for early check-in beforehand but it wasn't possible. However, luckily there was a good, spacious luggage room. Room rather small, as well as the bathroom. Not enough space for luggage. Cleanliness was good and a bed was quite comfortable. No minibar. Very good location to explore the city. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that. Concierge was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “be careful”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireladScotty
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a party of friends for a long weekend. Rooms just 3 star (no plug in basin, no coffee/tea facilities, smell of drains in some rooms). Breakfast very good if a bit chaotic (too many guests at the same time). BEWARE the taxi services offered by the hotel, especially TCA, who overcharged massively for a (very fraught) visit to the bulb festival. Excellent restuarant in hotel.Great position on the Amstel in the heart of town. Strongly recommend the hop-on,hop-off water buses. Queues for all major attractions (typically 45 mins). Overall, just about worth 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: siamtraveler85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eden hotel for just two nights, but had a very pleasant experience. After a long flight and traveling, check in was a breeze and we that our rooms had all the amenities we needed. The beds were also quite comfy and the location was so close to all the shops and restaurants. The concierge was particularly helpful in giving directions and tips about the canal bus tour and surrounding area. Just around the back entrance of the hotel is rembrandt square which had lots of nice restaurants, one in particular was outstanding both in value and service, L'opera.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiitalia
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had an early flight into Amsterdam and check in is at 3pm so couldn't go to rooms yet but the hotel kept our luggage and gave us a ticket for it. We had a room only stay so I cannot comment on food/bar etc. I was personally shocked to find out as soon as we checked in that we had to pay a 50 euro deposit but i was fine when we were told we'd get the WHOLE deposit back at the end if no damage etc. We were in a double standard room, bed was a good size, the room was an ok size, not a lot of space near wardrobe but room was modern and bath room has a translucent door, which could be annoying for some. Good air conditioning in room and nice big windows, room was clean although a few tiny marks on bed covers and in bathroom but that doesn't bother me at all. The stay was good over all and the hotel was in a great location for us, close to dam square/short tram journey to the train station/fairly close to vondel park! The only thing that did annoy me was at the end we did NOT get our full deposit back, when we checked out we were only given around thirty three euros as we were taxed every night we stayed by the government. Not a problem if we had known about that from the start! Apart from this, hotel was nice and will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location thats about it”
Reviews.Author: Travelmonster420
Reviews.Content: Our room was really small and not clean. Would def stay somewhere else next time

Reviews.Title: “Good location poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: rakeshsaral
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. It is the dirtiest hotel I got. No service, no housekeeping and the behaviour of staff unaccepatable. The hotel says it is three star but you have to ask for even the basic things. Rooms are stuffy. I will not recommend any one to stay there. No value for money. Few good hotels in the vicinity for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “If u have monei to spend it worths, if not...leave it!!!Expencive!”
Reviews.Author: rossella91
Reviews.Content: We had to book this hotel as the position is realli good, a short distance walking from the main attractions. The hotel presents 2 parts. The first one is cheaper but I do not know anithing about the services, the part we reserved was realli smart and posh! The room was spacious, clean (u can even sit down in the shower like u are being ur house!) and warm and also had a kettle (tea coffee and chocolate were available). the bathroom was amazing! there was a lot of confort there. There was a safe box in the room and a tv (it does not work if u don't pai for it) and u can bui films to watch, also there was a guardarobe and u could leave there ur clothes to wash but u had to pai for that. The staff is efficient, thei helped us with the taxi when we left the hotel. Around the area is plenti of pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location closed to all best places of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ale09111982
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect located. Near to all best and important places in Amsterdam, as museum,restaurants,clubs. Hotel cleaned with good services. Pity for some rooms that they sell as double, but have twins beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but don't stay here if you're tall!”
Reviews.Author: CYates1983
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the heart of Amsterdam and within short walking distance of most of the main sights, which was really convenient and definitely a big selling point. The rooms were quite basic but attractively furnished - no tea/coffee making facilities though, which was a shame. Despite having booked a room with a queen bed (on account of my husband and I being tall!), we were told the hotel didn't actually have any such rooms and our room (515) turned out to be very small. In particular, the bathroom was a challenge - to be blunt, sitting on the toilet meant having your knees pressed up against the wall in front of you. There was also no privacy as the bathroom had a frosted glass door with no lock - so avoid if you're travelling with a partner and haven't reached the 'comfortable' stage yet! We weren't too impressed with the service as when we found our double bed was made with two single duvets, we requested a double duvet which didn't turn up until 5 hours (and a reminder phone call) later. Housekeeping was also inconsistent, arriving at different times every day (9.30, 13.30 and 15.30). The concierge was excellent though, very friendly and helpful. Luggage storage was organised promptly and for free. All in all a good, but not great, hotel - we would recommend it to anyone who wishes to be located centrally, and doesn't plan to spend much time in their room!

Reviews.Title: “Went for Gay Pride”
Reviews.Author: xxxdarren
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect location if your going for gay Trips, I payed 500.30 euro for 3 nights at gay pride week, I found the staff to be very cold and not very friendly, Not very chatty, I think i will choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff - beware the tours/car hire”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemumtraveller
Reviews.Content: You cannot fault this hotel on service and location. (Kids eat free with paying adult) Lots of internet computers available and easy access!! In easy walking to distance to many main attractions - Robert on Concerierge was very helpful in directing us to places of interest and good information about the best public transport options.Very safe although occasionally noisy at night. My 9 year old daughter and myself went on a tour and were suprised that while you were picked up, you were not dropped back. ( walked 2 kms back to hotel) Same with hire cars apparently. The tour also left people behind - there was no number counting and checking and certainly no remorse. The guide was rude when I asked if we were to be taken back to the hotel. Tour companies need to put in their brouchure that they do not return customers to hotel and not ask for undesrved tips! Would loved to have stayed longer in Amsterdam and definately would stay at Eden again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Zowie1958
Reviews.Content: Nice staff and easy to find, I felt comfortable and it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Keely0207
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel before check in time, so was told we would have an apartment to stay in. Sounded great .... However we were taken round the back of the building down a side alley to a dirty dingy den where there were 4 apartment rooms. The stairs were so steep we literally had to crawl up them. The room was biggish - but was a complete let down to what we had seen on the internet. Our room overlooked the back of the hotel and was absoultely filthy. We decided to ask if we could have a room in the hotel - which we did eventually - but the staff on the help desk wernt very helpful at all. The room we got was basic but a whole lot better than the apartment. The bathroom was small but did the job i guess. Location was great - glad we didnt stay near Dam square - was glad of the piece and quiet at our hotel. All in all, good value for money. But don't be fooled by the apartment rooms - a big let down!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: no1urbanwarrior
Reviews.Content: This is a great value 4* hotel in a superb, central location in Amsterdam. No more than 20 - 30 mins max walk from any of main attractions and Central Station (trams will be quicker of course). This time I stayed in single room which is down a couple of corridors but no big deal unless you're really pedantic and looking for something to moan about. Bedroom is fine and enough room. Decent size telly and shower cubicle (I'm 6'4"). Two main exit points - one overlooking lovely canal - great views, the other virtually on vibrant Rembrandt Square. If you arrive well before check-in you can always leave bags in secure luggage room and same on check-out day if you don't want to lug them about. Concierge service always very courteous and obliging. Can't comment on bars or restaurant as I've never tried them.

Reviews.Title: “right in the heart of amsterdam great value”
Reviews.Author: dafmanSussex
Reviews.Content: well i have to say that i read some reviews before i booked this hotel and thought that i would be put off but i am glad that i did book and can say that the hotel was in the heart of the city right on the canel the 2 rooms we booked where very clean tea and coffee in the rooms the staff where very helpfull the breakfast was great the local bars and resturants where very helpfull also clean food was first class we went on the dinner cruise which is 4 courses and all beers wines soft drinks where in the price a great way to tour the canels at nite in all a very good three days at the eden hotel and would not have a problem in staying here again later this year

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: martinchisholm
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for a few nights, nice hotel with pleasant staff and a helpful concierge. We stayed in a standard room with a queen bed, the room was small but nicely decorated, very simple. I think with regards to noice levels, it would depend what room you are in, but our room overlooked a bar, so at the weekend it could be a bit noisy, but not overly so. It is situated just around from Rembrant square, where there are many cafes and restaurants at which to eat, as well as access to several trams into the Dam Square and beyond. Overall a nice, basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SJF89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were very disappointed with this hotel, especially as we had booked after looking at reviews on this website. When checking in we were offered an 'upgrade' to an appartment which we took-I suggest that you do not do this! I think that the rooms in the main hotel are newer. The appartment (although very spacious and looking out over a canal) was falling apart- the kitchen tap fell off, the toilet door handle was falling off, one of the lamps in the room had had its cord cut in half, there were rips in the lounge, the light over the kitchen table didn't work, there was no soap in the bathroom when we arrived, and I found hair and old contact lenses in the shower and in the bathroom basin!! We told staff about this, and in fairness we were given soap straight away and the next day the bathroom was properly cleaned. We were also offered a room change. Although the kitchen tap was fixed, the light over the table was never fixed. On a more positive note the hotel is in an excellent location, very close to the train/tram line and very close to a few nice restaurants/pubs. There is also free internet.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JinDXB
Reviews.Content: Great location just 10 minutes away from anything. Only stayed 1 night with my partner. Took the basic room which was well appointed but small. Staff ok... some very cheering and helpful some could do with a smile on their face... Concierge desk great!! Very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. In 5 minutes he come up with good tips and explanations... a good mix of attractions and things to see / visit and less touristy stuff complemented with personal recommendations! Recommendable and to go back to... but will book a bigger room next time!

Reviews.Title: “Needs major improvement”
Reviews.Author: DRinlondon
Reviews.Content: How do I even begin to describe how terrible my experience at this hotel was?! Stayed three nights at the Eden Hotel with several other colleagues when we travelled to Amsterdam for a big industry event. I was among the lucky few that managed to get a double room but for those with a single room, there was barely enough space to stretch your arms out, let alone have a suitcase in there. The single rooms are TINY! My room was at the end of a dark, dingy corridor and I was greeted with a sickening stench emanating from the open drain in the bathroom. Since there was no air freshener, I had to use my deodorant spray to mask the smell! The shower was really dirty and water did not drain well, so I was left showering with soapy water reaching up to my ankles. Further, the shower gel dispensers were not fitted properly and kept falling off. The carpet in the room also seemed very dirty despite its dark brown colour. A colleague even found pieces of broken glass on the floor in his room, which goes to show that cleanliness is not a priority here. A few other incidents that I have to mention: - Customer service is terrible. I had couriered a large number of corporate materials from the UK for use at the trade fair and phoned the hotel ahead to ask them to hold it for me. Reception insisted they had never received the parcel. This was despite the parcel being clearly marked with my name and me having a delivery confirmation from the couriers! This meant that I was unable to take any corporate brochures to the trade fair and was in no position to have another delivery sent from the UK at such a late stage, which was a big issue for us. I asked several people at the hotel and the concierge was not in the least bit interested in helping me out - even walking off at one point, never to be seen again, while I was using his desk phone to speak to the couriers. Finally on the second day after more persuasion, a different concierge said that the parcel had been sitting in the luggage room for several days! - A colleague phoned Reception to book a taxi and the call was promptly forwarded to the concierge's mobile phone. On check out, believe it or not, he was charged for that phone call! Also, forget about taking the lift because it barely works and a very basic breakfast is 19 Euros! The positives: WiFi terminals in the lounge and the hotel is centrally located close to Rembrandt Square and several tram lines. We would have definitely changed hotels if we had the choice but due to the big trade fair taking place in Amsterdam, hotel rooms for large delegations were scarce. The state of this place is such a shame because the hotel can really do well with its competitive rates and prime location. Major improvements required!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: stamphappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden Hotel for two nights in December. It's well placed, only a couple of hundred metres from a metro station looking out on one of Amsterdam's lovely canals. The room was cosy, but not too small, and very well heated in the middle of some seriously cold weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overall stay in this hotel Average”
Reviews.Author: kat_g1971
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 11th Jan fairly early in the morning (due to flight time)s and we were expecting not to be able to check-in. To our surprise the desk were able to check us in and away we went for the day. They asked for a Credit Card, something we weren't expecting....... The room was small, but clean and adequate for our needs. The bed was comfy, although we're not used to a double bed, so smaller than we'd hoped for. Occasionally you could hear other guests in the room opposite, but this didn't bother us too much. No tea or coffee in the room, which would have been nice to have in the morning. Oh and there's a safe in the room. The hotel is a great location for walking round the city and would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst sleep and hotel service I ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: wunderbar1983
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mostly because of the location - not so far from both the city centrum and main museums. But this seems to be its only advantage. When we were checking in, I said two times to the receptionist that I want to pay in cash and was already holding this money in my hands. But she said she needs my credit card number for any accidentals. I didn't have one with me, so we gave the card of my girlfriend. We were really surprised when she received an SMS from the bank saying 350 euro were blocked on her card (full room cost + 50 euro deposit). When I asked her why she didn't warn us about this operation - she said "It's ok, it's not a charge, I just blocked the money and it will be unblocked when you check out". But this procedure can last up to 45 days (!) and my girlfriend needed this money on next day, because the bank should have charged her monthly loan payment. And because there is no such bank in the Netherlands it was impossible to add any money to the card. And now she has to pay additional charges from the bank because of the unprofessional staff of Eden Hotel Amsterdam! Apart from the unprofessional staff, the beds in our room were terrible! I'm not a fastidious person and can sleep practically everywhere, especially when I'm tired. But I have never slept on such an uncomfortable bed! Although our room was in a quiet part of the hotel and we didn't hear any noise from the street, we woke up for several times during every night we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Takster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the price that we got it at, it was in a real good location not to far from shops and restaurant. Dam square is also within walking distance about 10-15mins. The rooms were nice and not small at all. The reception staff were always friendly and the bar was a nice atmosphere. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice...for a two night stay.”
Reviews.Author: WISALSU
Reviews.Content: The hotel is across the street from a canal. During one of our canal rides we went right past it. I thought the room was wonderfully decorated. I LOVED the giant lighted tulip picture used as a headboard. It really made the room look lovely. All else pretty basic. No room amenities (coffee/tea etc). Modern feel in the decor though. A nice bar/gathering area in the Lobby with free computer access that was great . Staff were very nice. Depending on what you will be seeing in Amsterdam I think the location was fine. We walked a block or two behind the hotel and had Tram access. Which is how we got back to the Airport. We took the Tram/to the Train Station/and the Train to the Airport. There are Lockers at the Train Station where you can store your luggage after checking out of the Hotel. That was very nice on our last day there. We also picked up the Canal Rides at the Train Station (Hop On/Hop Off) This is a must to see Amsterdam! There are several different colored routes to take. Really enjoyed the relaxation of the canal rides on our last day there. It's been a few months since I was there but would absolutely stay here again if ever back in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful the hotel might block your money without telling you!”
Reviews.Author: clementine_11
Reviews.Content: I made a booking for 1 night (31.12.2010) at Eden Hotel Amsterdam through booking.com because the location and the price of the room was ok. On 01.01.2011, I paid the price of the room while checking out which was 105 euros. Then when I came back to home, I noticed a big balance difference in my bank account and when I called the bank, they said the Eden Hotel charged me on 31.12.2010 and 01.01.2011 for a total of 904 euros! When I called the booking.com and the hotel, they said the money was not charged it was just blocked but the thing is nobody told me about this blocking thing! This negligence of the hotel staff left me in a very difficult situation since I had to pay my rent that day but I couldn't pay it because they have blocked 904 euros in my account! I cannot understand how they block such a big amount of money for only 1 night and especially without saying anything.. So be very careful if you decide to stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room, poor service”
Reviews.Author: LorcDog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days in November. I choose this hotel on the basis of the price and location, both of which I could not argue with. However, I found the reception staff to be quite rude and the room was quite small. Oh, and when I asked for recommendations of local restaurants the only recommendation given was the hotel's own! Despite all that I would consider staying here again if the price was right as the rooms were clean and the location is hard to beat for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: lietjeopvakantie
Reviews.Content: A bar was located on the other side of the street, we notice during the night. VERY NOISY till 5 in the morning. When we complained the next day, they told us that this happens during the weekend. Why didn't they tell before...!? The bed wasn.t clean and the bathroom was clean by first view... Ladies at the desk were very nice and helpfull. Location manager learned how to get a long with complains. So NOT helpfull and we still haven't heard from him.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER book at this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: Aztravelernew
Reviews.Content: So we booked our stay at the Eden Hotel for 3 nights in September back in April, but due to work committments we realized we won't be able to make our trip to Europe. We called the hotel a couple weeks after we made the reservation asking them to not refund us the money, but give us a coupon or credit to be able to stay another time within the next 1 year. We had only postponed our Europe trip and were definitely looking for an accomodation in Amsterdam except on a later date. The hotel Management made us spin in circles for days, only to find out that they would not budge at all and cooperate with the customer. Ofcourse, we ended up losing our money but the experience with this hotel management was much worse than the money we lost. We understand what non-refundable booking means, which is why we never asked for a refund. All that we were hoping for was be able to book on a later date. But apparently, this hotel cares more about short term profit than building customer relationships.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: AndreaOregon_USA
Reviews.Content: The price of the hotel could not be beat. Clean room, no frills, but excellent location. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam is expensive, Excellent hotel + fab location!”
Reviews.Author: jas_lo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden hotel for a long weekend at the end of October with my best friend. (25-30 age group). The hotel was easy to find, a good 20min. walk from central station.It was clean, bed comfy & the pipping hot power shower was amazing! + the free internet access in the coffee shop was a bonus! Most guests were families or city workers so there was no noise or disturbance at night, so guranteed a good nights sleep. The location is fantastic! Rembrant Square is literally behind the hotel (a good spot for nightlife). We were able to walk to all the tourist sites!! the decor in the hallway's is slightly dated but overall very good in a very expensive city!!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, pretty average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dee_jay_ay
Reviews.Content: Location was OK, next to a metro stop. Hotel was clean but plain. Rooms were spartan. Service pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “sorely needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Babs077
Reviews.Content: -no working "down" button on any lift; glass door on bathroom does not provide privacy and doesn't latch; "double" rooms too small for 2 people with luggage; if taking bath one must stand up to get soap out of squeeze container; there is NO bar soap or ANY hand soap; rowdy neighborhood with no police presence; great view of canal, tho.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but functional”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Girl1114
Reviews.Content: We had just stayed in 4 star hotels before coming to this hotel. There was a clear difference between the 4 star hotels and this 3 star hotel. The walls had some scuffs and the shower floor was damaged but it still seemed fairly clean. The room was very small. On the plus side, they did have free internet, comfy beds and a decent location. Rembrandt square is very close by and has cute cafes and a few nightclubs. It is also right on the canal which was very pretty to walk along.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Foxily
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in October for a weekend with 3 girlfriends. The hotel was really good for our needs. Breakfast was included in the price & I'm sure if we got up earlier we'd have benefited from the smoked salmon that had been on offer. The staff in the restaurant were young & busy. The concierge was superbly professional & helpful with taxi to airport at a good price 40euros. It was a good location for us to get to bars & restaurants. Best thing about the room was the bed, wow it was amazing best hotel bed ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jardon187217
Reviews.Content: Some rooms are very close to a night club in the same street, and the noise during the night was really terrible. Next time I will choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Stay Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Dizzyelmo
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of this hotel and others in Amsterdam, no where seemed to come off well (or at least, certainly not those within our budget!) I don't know whether we were just lucky, but our experience of this hotel was nothing like the complaints we had read. We were in Amsterdam for the Marathon and stayed a couple days after to do the 'tourist thing' too. Location was perfect - very pretty on the canal and so close to tram and metro links - plus you could walk places very easily. Lobby area and bar very modern and staff friendly on check-in / out and any time we asked questions of them. Excellent English - par for the course in Holland. I had requested a quiet room and we were given a room on the 5th floor (top), which was certainly quiet. Lovely room - clean, spacious (again, were we just lucky as people seem to complain the rooms are too small??) and lovely modern bathroom (great hairdryer too!). Because we were 5th floor, we looked out over the wall people have complained about. Comfortable bed and TV gave us some English news channels & dutch radio - as we weren't planning on spending much time in our room, TV was not a priority for us! Breakfast was not included in our booking and we were however shocked at the 19.50euro price of this!! We decided to eat elsewhere. On marathon morning however, the restaurant staff were very kind to us - we had brought our own porridge and they made this up for us - no charge - which I thought was very good of them (I got charged for this in London - hence the suprise!) I've stayed off Dam Sq before and that put me right off Amsterdam. This location out at Waterlooplein was far superior - less dirty / seedy area, and Rembrantplein just behind hotel for cafes, food, bars etc. At the price we paid (Â£370 for 2people / 3nights + flights) this hotel is not to be scoffed at and we would definately recommend (especially for future marathon runners).

Reviews.Title: “wifi access in foyer is a joke”
Reviews.Author: CKE80Y
Reviews.Content: The standard rooms are too small - go next up if you can afford. didnt want to hold our bags over night (did in the end). Everytime we wanted to use wifi we had to go into foyer/reception as it is NOT available in your room - What a joke. High speed is available in room at rediculous (rip off expense).

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: tors87
Reviews.Content: My partner and I started our 7 week tour of Europe in this place, and it could not be topped! Bit of a walk from the main station, but the facilities and feel of the place are second-to-none. Rooms are clean and new, perfect size as well. Breakfast was amazing, and the free internet was an unexpected plus! Beware the automated mini-bar though, we went to put some fruit in there (ie. moved a drink) and it was automatically charged to our room. Luckily the staff were very friendly and understanding. A must-stay!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL IN PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Roamer5040
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden Hotel for 5 days in early September. We found the hotel to suit us fine. The room was modern but a bit small and was cleaned every day. Bed very comfortable. Did experience noise in the middle of the night from a side alley at the hotel. The location of this hotel is good, within walking distance of all the main parts of the town, Rembrandsplein, Dam Square, Leidseplein, Red Light District etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: furbal13
Reviews.Content: Regardless of what follows the staff I dealt with when I check in an checked out were friendly and very helpful. Also, to be fair I must highlight I checked in late (gone 10) and left early (before 7) so there was no oppotunity for them to resolve anything below as I didn't have the time or energy to complain (though personally feel there shouldn't be the need in a hotel that caters fo Business Traveller's who by nature have tight schedules. However, the room was not good. It wasn't clean - I'll be the first to admit I'm slightly OCD about bathrooms (I like them to be spotless and mold free) But this was not a bit grim. The sink/bath/toilet were clean. However, the psot for the vanity mirror (which by the way is usless for anyone under 5" 6) was thick with dust - the dried on kind thats been there for a while. The flush on the toilet was black with mold. When I went to hand my suit on the door for the steam to work it's magic that two was covered in a layer of dust. It was tiny. The queen size bed was by the window and I couldn't walk around it without turning sideways to draw the curtains. The gap the main side of the bed was filled with a huge chair. Thank fully there was only me as two people would have been unable to stand in the main part of the room and would have needed to move into the corridor to the bathroom. It was dark. Even with the lights on I was squinting - great turn down lighting - very hard to work by and quite depressing. The advertised wired internet in the room was not there. There was a wire but it was to dark to see where it went and after the bathroom I didn't want to be under the desk. The free wireless in reception may have worked but since I was given the wrong code.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: 8lettersuk
Reviews.Content: It's true what they say you get what you pay for. This hotel is actually at the back of the similarly named for added confusion Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel. You can access the hotel via either lobby so the only major difference we found was the room quality. Our friends upgraded to the sister hotel on arrival and we decided to stay in this hotel. The rooms are a little small but perfectly adequate, the bathroom however tended to flood and make the carpet in the small hallway of the room wet. Other than this though the hotel more than made up for it in being well located for budget accommodation. Staff were helpful when you could find them but to be fair it was easy enough to walk through to the alternate reception for the sister hotel. Overall a great budget hotel in a lovely location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - thinks it's better than it is”
Reviews.Author: juc77
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased when arriving - the location is great - right on the Amstel, and the reception is nice. However, the staff were rather aloof with only minimal welcome. The lift is small and very slow. The room was a decent size but not a double - two singles pushed together. The main problem was cleanliness. The bed linen and carpet was stained, some dubious smudges on the walls, filthy - and I mean filthy - coffee cups, dust on the bed side units and hairs in the bath. I showed reception the state of the cups and told them we weren't happy with the room. They offered us an "upgrade". We checked the room before moving - it was no better, the bath looked even more unclean, so we stayed where we were and requested a change of bed linen. There was barely an apology for any of this, instead a disregard bordering on arrogance, and in fact the staff all gathered round reception to listen while we raised the issue and it felt rather oppresive. I did not feel fully settled in the room at all and was disappointed by the hotel overall and the staff attitude. Someone else may have a better stay but I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: scottishlass78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights would say that the positive far outway the negatives. Room was clean and comfortable and had a safe. My only complaint about the room would be that we had no view just a brick wall and that the bathroom door was glass with a large space at the top and bottom so not much privacy. The reception staff were pleasant enough but were nothing special, the concierge was very friendly and helpful as were the housemaids. Had one drink in the bar but again service was ok but nothing very special. The hotel is in a fantastic location - there are great bars, cafes and restaurants right on the hotels doorstep in rembrantplein or its also really handy for leidesplein and dam square. Hotel is easy to get to either get tram #9 from centraal station or the metro to waterlooplein. Would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Review Eden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerry750
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Located in the centrum at the amstel river just perfect. see more info at : http://amsterdam-hotelroom.com/edenhotel.html

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff great location good value”
Reviews.Author: steavep7
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed here 2-5 september 2010 we got into the dam at 10.00am made a slow walk to the hotel from central stopping on the way to the hotel for some breakfast.got to the hotel about 11.30am to see if we could leave the suitcase there so we did'nt have to carry around untill check in time 3pm.we was greeted by a very polite member of staff who took our names went off to do her computer stuff came back to say that they have upgraded us to a room with a canal view and that our room was ready.we got into our room on the 2nd floor (room 228) by 11.45am (not bad for a 3pm check in).we opened the door to find a very large room a very large bed and a very good view of the amstel canal.location was second to none 2 min walk to rembrant square 5 min from the flower market and flea market .would use again.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bernie-Bantam
Reviews.Content: Just got back from am'dam and had a very enjoyable stay for 2 nights. Got there at 10a.m. to drop bags off and rooms were ready with an upgrade for me. Ended up on top floor (5th) at front with great views over Amstell. Large spacious room. Very comfy beds, made up as a double but was soon altered by staff to make into 2 singles. Can't say about breakfast as it seemed too pricey but there are plenty of places nearby. Best breakfast we had was at a cafe opposite the flower market 5 to 10 mins walk away. Bathroom very clean and all modern fittings. All staff give excellent service. Booked in March so got a very good rate through Hotels.com. (Â£83 prpn) A couple of very minor niggles, lift a bit slow and bottom of bath very slippy if having a shower but we enjoyed our stay and if we were in Amsterdam again, we would definitely stay here

Reviews.Title: “You are making problems!”
Reviews.Author: Sunfloo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel before and it always was a good value for money. But it seems that something happened to it (may be it's an impact of the crisis?). The elevator was out of service two days out of three I was staying there. They managed to clean the room properly only once, two other days it was just making a bed. But the worst part was the check-out, I had to leave at 5 am and they tried to charge me for breakfast 4 times (although I actually only had two). First, they tried to persuade me that I have signed for it - showing me some form saying nothing about the breakfast. In the bill it was written that on one day I had two breakfasts. When I started to ask questions the answer was "You are making problems!". Finally the bill was settled, but I don't think I would ever decide to go there again. Oh, one positive thing - the concierge there is very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for Amsterdam viewing!”
Reviews.Author: Red_Army1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden Hotel Amsterdam for a short break in August 2010 and was extremely happy with the choice to stay here. It was situated in the perfect location, with a beautiful canal one side and the butsling Rembrant square the other. The hotel was very near public transport and all major Amsterdam tourist sites, located within walking distance of the city centre itself but retaining a charm of being outside of the noise. Prior to going to the hotel, we had read some reviews questioning the cleanliness of the hotel but upon arrival we were very impressed with the appearance of the hotel which was modern and trendy, and the service of the staff. The rooms were quite small but ideal for a short break and were nicely furnished and decorated. Would most definately stay at this hotel again, perfect for an Amsterdam trip in every way.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience overall but a little eccentric”
Reviews.Author: kayjaybee09
Reviews.Content: Negatives first. Small room, TV not very responsive to tune, WiFi in lobby only and very slow - almost, but not quite as slow as the lift. In fact, nothing could be slower. No check in until 3.00pm. Positives. Pleasant, friendly, helpful staff. Exceptionally good barman - amicable, knowledgeable and professional. Very good location - depends of course where you want to go but the area is well served with public transport. Clean room. Good choice for breakfast. Room sizes in major cities tend to be smaller than where land is cheaper but the other negatives could be fixed and that would enhance the appeal of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK, I guess”
Reviews.Author: KiwiWithWings80
Reviews.Content: Room modern, clean, spare in size, no soap, only dispensers (which is the current trend, I suppose, but feels mean - and really reflects this hotel). No extras, only the bare essentials. Staff appeared overworked and harrassed - pleasant but tired. WiFi - may be free, but slow and unrelaible. Excellent location (but then again Amsterdam is a very walker-friendly town). Felt very safe. Poor noise control. Occasionally strong smell of dope (that is IRONY, for USA readers). Would I recommend?.......maybe, but I am sure there are other, better properties around. And remember - not all hotels have internet visibility.

Reviews.Title: “oh dear, oh dear.....!!!”
Reviews.Author: mmark101
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this hotel, and came here because of the quality of the first. I must say that this time i was very, very disapointed. I must say that the staff like last time were first class. But this time i found that the standards of cleanliness was a huge disapointment. I found the bathroom was dirty and there were no plugs for the bath or sink. When having a shower the whole room became damp with water running down the walls. The double room given was to small and would have suited a single bed rather than a double. The air con hardly worked so had to sleep with the windows open and above all, it certainly wasnt worth the money paid and due to this, i will not be staying here again and would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a central location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: sj134
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this hotel after departing a cruise around 12 p.m. The desk for the Eden Hotel was closed and signs indicated to go down a short hall to the Eden Rembrant Square reception desk. The line of other guests checking out was very long, they do not have express check out. We did manage to leave our luggage with the concierge and returned at 3 p.m. for our room. The elevator and stairs are controlled by key cards, which was nice given the lively neighborhood. We had an executive room with a view of the Amstel River. The room was spacious, but had two twin beds together to make a kind. They were very comfortable! Thankfully our windows opened because the air conditioner was not very strong, even on high on the lowest temperature setting of 19C and the heating pipes ran up a corner of the room and radiated heat 24 hours, even with the radiator off! This may not be an issue in winter, but in August it was toasty when we would return to the room. The windows have no screens, so expect a few flies, even on the 4th floor. We did not have any noise problem when the windows were shut and could not hear other guests. There is free internet in the lobby business center, but the Wi-fi did not reach our room on a high corner. The maids and front desk staff were very attentive, but also very busy. Breakfast was 15 euros, so we opted for the many pancake houses and cafes on the square nearby.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: mspeacockwi
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I were in Amsterdam from August 7-10th. The hotel has a great location near Rembrandt square and is easy to access via the no. 9 or 14 tram. It is also easy enough to hop on the tram again and go wherever you need to for a reasonable price. Very pleased about the location. When we arrived at 1:30 PM we had already been in Amsterdam since 9 in the morning with our luggage. I wanted to see if we could possibly check into our room early- and we did! We were also given a converter to borrow as we had forgot to bring ours. Another plus. The noise level was higher than I would have liked for the remainder of August 7th. Little did we know a gay pride festival was going on that day. Not the hotel's fault. The room was clean and the bed was much more comfortable than other hotels we had been at. The blow dryer in the room (which was connected to the wall) was not working properly the first evening. After telling the hotel staff, another blow dryer was brought up to the room for me to use for the remainder of our stay the following late morning/early afternoon. It got very warm during our stay. The air conditioning was running constantly and worked great. In door safes. The elevator was tricky to get working. The rooms do have internet access, but only with a plug-in. Not very helpful to someone with an iPhone. The wireless internet downstairs was okay but had a slow, weak signal. Staff were okay, but weren't good candidates for the hotels "Smile Campaign." We went to the "Amsterdam" room for a buffet breakfast- such a RIP OFF! 20 euro for what was provided. 12 euro would have been more reasonable. Skip the breakfast and walk to a nearby cafe! The price we paid was through a travel agency and was much lower than what I we would have gotten on their website. Considering the lower price we paid, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very bad start. A kind of average end.”
Reviews.Author: nhew
Reviews.Content: Its not explained on the Eden website but the Eden Hotel and the Eden Rembrandt Square are connected together and operated essentially as one hotel. One side is referred to by the staff as the 3 star side and the other is the 4 star side. The price difference for a standard room is 20 euros. We stayed for 4 nights. Day 1 We arrived in the evening to find out that the hotel had overbooked itself and given away our room. We were 2 couples. The other couple we were meeting had arrived earlier and received a room on the 3 star side in what felt like a basement with a view of a generator of sorts.(Room107 Eden hotel side) Prior to arriving we had requested via email, rooms close to each other. We had also advised that hotel that we would be arriving late. My partner and I were told that we would be put into separate single rooms for the first night and then moved into a standard double. One room was on the 4 star side and the other was on the 3 star side. When we expressed our dismay the girl behind the reception was curt, rude and said " This is all we've got. You can stay here or find somewhere else". When we went into the 4 star room, the room smelt like a sewer pipe. The sink in the bathroom had a yellowish ring of scum around the drain and there were oily streak marks in the tub. There was a balcony of sorts but the door had to be propped open with a garbage can. The noise outside was very loud. The night manager was helpful and equally horrified by the smell. He brought us an air freshener spray and promised to try and upgrade us the next day. Beware of Room 580 Eden Rembrandt side. Day 2 We were moved into our new room and upgraded to the 4 star side. Our friends also decided to upgrade and happily paid the 20 euros to get out of the basement. They gave us rooms next to each other. Rooms were a good size and clean. All was well. Day 3 + 4 No more complaints. The hotel location is fantastic. The location is without a doubt the best thing about this hotel. Overall Impression This was an adequate experience. The reception staff was not overly helpful or friendly. For the most part they answered your questions and offered nothing more. On more than one occasion a hotel front desk person could be heard loudly and rudely telling a guest to speak English even though the guest was speaking English, but with an accent. If you just want a place to sleep at night that lets you get out to see the city, this is a good choice. If you are looking for something special, romantic or especially memorable this is not recommended. Note: There was ironically, a "Smile Campaign" going on at the hotel with Laughing Seminars for guests. It was a common elevator joke among guests at the hotel that perhaps the hotel reception staff might benefit from attending a few of those sessions as well.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasent people, would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: amejm
Reviews.Content: i thought my stay at the eden hotel was very pleasent, the people were helpful and polite and for the price i paid i would definatly recommend it to anyone. The Down side to this hotel was when i booked it, it didnt state that you need a 50 euro deposit. But other then that it was very comfortable and in a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with our room, it wasnt what we had booked”
Reviews.Author: Kiwis-travelling
Reviews.Content: We booked an Executive room directly through the hotel's website, back in Feb '10 for our 3 night stay in July '10. Firstly, the hotel charged our credit card just after we made the booking, and their Terms and Conditions stated we would not be charged until the completion of our stay. Upon querying this with the hotel, they acknowledged they had in error, charged our credit card and offered to refund. We decided to let the charge to through, as we would have had to pay for our stay in a few months. However, when we got to the hotel, we were expecting an Executive room as we had booked. We were placed in a far less superior room, overlooking an office on the side of the building. We couldnt even open the curtains. We went back to the reception and explained that they must have made an error, and we were told that the hotel was fully booked, and that this was the best room they could offer us. We asked if they could refund the difference in room category, or offer us a complimentary breakfast. We were told definitely not, and we were not impressed. They agreed to change our room the next day, but once again, it was definitely not an Executive room. The room was very small, not what was on their website and not what we were expecting. So all in all, we were quite disappointed with our stay. In our 5 weeks of touring Europe, this is the only hotel we would not recommend. It is in a good location, near many restaurants. But beware, it seems there are two hotels in one here, as there are 2 entrances. We believe one is a 3 star, and one perhaps a 4 star. So you need to be sure what you are booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Draconian
Reviews.Content: Very near to all the must see place. In fact walking distance. We booked a standard room and although we had read other reviews that said that they found it small, we thought that the size was ok. No coffee making facilities in the room though and when we asked for a vending machine reception mentioned the bar (which is closed early morning probably because they would be serving breakfast). But at the same time this made us leave the hotel early and everytime enjoy breakfast in the various cafes that are in Amsterdam - the food and service was great everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: helenf23
Reviews.Content: Walked to the hotel from Central station, about 15mins stroll which was nice even with a suitcase! Arrived at the hotel to some confusion on how many rooms had been booked for me and my partner, this was sorted out by reception and thankfully I was only charged for one room not the 8 they had booked for me!!! There is a secure luggage room to keep all luggage in, that was great as we arrived very early and check in wasnt untill 3pm that they seemed very strict about. The room its self was ok, could do with a fresh coat of paint, afew marks on the walls and carpet. Bathroom was well equipped with soaps, towles etc but very small. Difficult to squeeze past the toilet to get into the shower, but bearable for afew days! We had a canal view that was lovely, quite quiet and easy to sleep on the comfy bed, only down side was the bed was two singles pushed together with single sheets, duvet etc on. Location was fab for all the city attractions and within easy walking distance to lots of cafes, bars and restaurants! We stayed on room only that was fine as there are plenty of places to eat surrounding the hotel. Check out was 12 noon. The hotel seemed very eager to get you to leave before then, as we had atleat 4 knocks on the door by 11:30. Again we took advantage of the luggage store as our flight home was late in the evening. It was great to check out and not worry about the suitcase all day while enjoying the last day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to everything”
Reviews.Author: andi_wilson
Reviews.Content: Not a bad little hotel, particularly the location. It's a crawl away from Rembrandt Square and within walking distance of everything else. The rooms themselves are modern and clean with well needed air conditioning. The bathrooms are a little on the small side but perfectly manageable. There is also a safe in the room which is handy. My one complaint would be the view...a kind of airless shaft with view of three more walls. Still, perfectly adequate for the price we paid and the fact we just needed to sleep there and be close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rhnmckill
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a 4 night stay to find friendly reception staff. We were impressed with the fact we had to use the keycard for our room to call the lift (excellent security). When we entered our room we felt the room was trendy but the bathroom very small. The bathrooms have glass doors and the door hit off the toilet. The floor at the bath was covered in what appeared to be mould but not sure. There were also hairs on the floor, a hair on the glass surround of the sink and a hair in the bath. I phoned reception and was immediately asked whether I wished the room cleaned or another room. We went for another room. This time there were no complaints. The room was slightly bigger and so was the bathroom. The bathroom was faultless. We were pleased with the safe and the style of the room. The headboard lit up, it was easy to control all the lights, excellent reading lamps. Lovely built in cupboards, not enough hangers. The toilettries were in dispensers on the walls. Gorgeous Rituals toilettries. I even bought some in a shop. However could have done with a bar of soap. The beds were soft but so comfy. We had no view but the quiet was fantastic as the hotel was just off our favourite area of Rembrantplein. The only thing was we wanted two pillows for each bed. There was a spare pillow in the cupboard and I phoned reception to ask if it was possible for another one. I was told housekeeping would bring one up in a few minutes. After half an hour I went to reception and was told again, housekeeping would bring one up in a few minutes. After a further two hours I contacted reception to be told housekeeping had left for the day ( it was after 11pm at night), I explained I had been trying and was told I should have phoned again after it didnt appear. I gave up after this. I felt the hotel was excellent value for money, in an excellent location, also 15 mins from Dam Square, excellent bar area with lovely cocktails, very friendly staff and I would return to the hotel. I would request a superior room in order to get tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Also the hotel appears to be the same as the Eden in Remrandt Square, Strange I know, but 2 reception areas, 2 entrances on different streets, same hotel but different types of rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrFr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 2 night break with friends at the end of June. The hotel was exactly what we needed for the break at a good price. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the lobby area was good. The staff were very helpful particularly the concierge. The hotel is in a good location to see the sights of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: cageykezzastrip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located near Rembrandt Square. The rooms have been updated with good English programs on the modern digital TV. There is free internet service with a good bar and TV room where we watched a lot of the World Cup. The only criticism was that we could not get into our room until 3pm due to large volume of guests checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: P0P0LA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for 4 nights on january 2010, and we had a great time there. Rooms are clean and comfortable - staff was also very nice to us, and helpful. Location is good - many good restaurants around, and we could walk from the hotel to many museums and other attractions - though it was really freazing! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't beat the location. Room fine but noisy from nightclub if on outside room.”
Reviews.Author: FlibbleMcWibble
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 2.30pm, half an hour before the designated time of 3.00. Lobby nice with free wi-fi. One small lift which was temperamental when you tried to call it with your plastic key card. Room was a good size with room to walk around the bed. Space for suitcase. Safe with keypad. No tea or coffee making facilities, minibar or iron. Only 2 flimsy plastic cups by sink provided. Excellent bed, soft and very comfy. Clean. Lit up glass picture very pretty behind bed but no other things of character, all a bit brown and cream. We were in room 347 which overlooked a small street, with a reasonable view of the top story of some typical dutch buildings. We realised that the glitter ball suspended from one, was part of a nightclub. From 12.00 to 3.30 am there was continual shouting, whooping and revelry from the club which was not dulled at all by the poor double-glazing - great!! This was identical the second night (a Thursday) and we asked to change to a new room. Staff helpful ( I'm sure we were not the first to have complained!) and moved us to room 134 which was identical but overlooked a meter away another room's window. This room was fine with no noise at all which was pretty impressive as it was a Friday night and Holland had just won a game in the world cup. Check out was fine, no problem with leaving our case in the suitcase room until we needed it to travel home. Didn't try the breakfast, save your money and go to the square within walking distance for all of the food and drink you need. Pancakes with bananas and cream, yum for about 7Es. Fantastic location this is the hotel's best feature. Easy to walk in about 20 mins from the station or you can get a tram from the square directly there. We would use the hotel again but would phone up at booking to ensure we got an internal room ( sleep much more important than the view!)

Reviews.Title: “~ Comfy & Clean ~”
Reviews.Author: Xin-Fang
Reviews.Content: I reached the hotel at 3.30pm and i was told to wait for another 30 minutes before my room was ready for me to check-in. In the end, i walked around the city and returned after my dinner which was nearly 8.30pm. And i was told to wait for a while to check whether the room was ready. Luckily, i did not have to wait for long as i was exhausted for visiting the city whole day. The room was at first floor, single-room type. Hot shower, towel, shampoo & body foam were provided, but i did not see any other basic toiletries. Since i brought mine along, so that was fine for me. I did not have my breakfast there since i needed to check-out very early in the following day. Room rate obtained was the "best package of the day" and included with city tax for a night - EURO 150+. Clean & comfortable. I like it even just for spending a night there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amenities and price”
Reviews.Author: igorek
Reviews.Content: For my two nights stay in Amsterdam, I searched for a budget accommodation with good reviews. I was VERY surprised to see our room: recently remodeled, meticulously clean and rather large (on european standards). Bathroom was well decorated with all modern look and a big tub. I requested a quiet location and got one with a view on minuscule garden. Overall this hotel shoud be celarly ranked above 3 stars. I paid $214 for two nights , double room on expedia.com, including all fees and coupon. You still need to pay extra city tax (7E for me) on checkout.

Reviews.Title: “ITP 2 Workshop”
Reviews.Author: ZeroKul
Reviews.Content: Hotel proximity to Rembrandt Square and other attraction.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: mackyUK
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to Amsterdam and on a recent trip I decided to book into the Eden having stayed their 5 Â½ years ago. Since my first stay in January 2005 the hotel has had a major makeover inside. The lobby, multiple receptions, bar and restaurant all seem above the official 3 star rating and the room I stayed in seemed more like a 5 star â€“ it was very large and specious with an on-the-wall LCD TV, min bar, large wardrobe and desk and the bathroom was huge with range of shower shells, soaps and shampoos. The location of the hotel is very good, just off the lively Rembrandt square area and within walking distance to the floating flower market, Ann Franks House and other major attractions. I usually like to eat out when I am travelling but because of the heavy rain I decided to use the brasserie which offered excellent food at reasonable prices

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diamondlover
Reviews.Content: I was in charge of securing accommodation for our group of 10 in Amsterdam, for 2 nights in May. After a bit of research, I chose The Eden Amsterdam, for it's location, and the price. I knew it was relatively "budget", and didn't expect any frills - and advised all my friends of the same. We were all delighted with our stay in this hotel! The beds were extremely comfortable, we had clean rooms, clean bathrooms (all that matters to me, really), and the location was spectacular. The hotel staff were incredibly accommodating, we bothered them endlessly with questions, and they never appeared fed up with us (I would have been - LOL). All in all, if you want convenience, a great location, good, friendly front desk and concierge staff, a good rate, I'd say this is a good bet for you. If you want more amenities and fridges in your rooms etc etc...just remember this is 3 star. But it's a darn good 3 star! I'll recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very helpfull staff and concierge....”
Reviews.Author: Livingalife
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Eden with my wife and family, the staff is great.... Concierge was very helpfull and concern about our group and activities. We were there during the Giro D'Italia that cause a lot of trouble to the tourists added with the garbage collectors strike, so Amsterdam is not a good place to be if they decide to do a race in the middle of the town. The only problem is that the rooms are very small (too small for the price). The manager (Robert) is very professional and has his eyes all around. The location is great as Amsterdam is a party town you will be there in the middle of it. The restaurant (Brasserie) together with the Hotel is great, the service is excelent and the food is very good (ordered a artichoke and fish stew delicious).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: lilacs109
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleasantly surprised by the city of Amsterdam and this hotel which was in the perfect location to be in = near restaurants and museums, right on a canal

Reviews.Title: “Great location, moden hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucie_uk89
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here over christmas for 3 days, its a lovely hotel placed right on the canel, and a few minuits walk to bars/shops and attractions. ourh otel rooms was a lovely size, very modern and clean, however our view was a wall. but as it was a cheap late break it didnt bother us to much. the staff were very nice, there was a lovely man giving us maps every day and showing us places we wanted to go. This is a very modern hotel at a good price with a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Second chance”
Reviews.Author: samodagreat
Reviews.Content: To all who have had a bad experience, or are considering a stay with the Eden on Amstel, I will give you an update. Last bad review in 09 I took off yesterday because of nice communications with new Manager Thomas Kahnt and his heart felt apology for my complains and the promise of correcting my problems ( as you may have read on that review) and others problems. I was asked for a chance to correct my bad experience. I am going there in May to see if all was true. After a week of trying to contact him (EDENBUZZ) I have not heard anything yet, but I guarantee a review, with the same and more photos, on this hotel in two weeks. Ratings are from my last visit

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: NPR27
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel, clean and functional. Free wifi in the bar area. Seemed to be quiet, rooms a little small, but well decorated and beds comfortable. No car park, but concierge arranged for car to be parked for us and delivered back the following morning at a time that suited. Breakfast OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: KatzUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Hotel was easy to find, get a no. 9 or 14 tram from Centraal Station and get off at Rembrandtplein. Check in was quick and easy. We had room 409. It was one of the smallest rooms that I have ever stayed in and it was difficult to move around but we had a proper double bed rather than two twins pushed together and the bathroom was a reasonable size and it was all very clean. The room faced an alley which was generally quiet. The room was airconditioned so at least we could keep cool when noise did force us to close the window. It is very centrally located - easy to walk to Centraal Station, Vondelpark, the Van Gogh museum, the Rijskmuseum and the flower market. There is a PC that you can use for free internet access. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as it seemed extortinate to us. The only complaint was that the handwash in the bathroom was empty when we arrived and not replenished the next day so had to ask for this to be done.
