I don't know how the staff are supposed to know when these things are empty as the bottles they use are not transparent.

Reviews.Title: “A good value central choice”
Reviews.Author: dublin_boy
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room for â‚¬105/night over Easter. Amsterdam is a busy spot and I've had some bad experiences with hotels over the years but I was pleasantly surprised with the Eden. The location is excellent, very central and with a tram stop practically outside. Our room was surprisingly large, though with an internal window facing into a corridor. Others in our groups had external windows but smaller rooms so it all seems to depend. The hotel offers free WiFi in the lobby but in the rooms only Ethernet connections but it turned out we could pick up WiFi in our room so it pays to check. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The concierge sells tickets to the Amsterdam Hermitage which is only 300m which saves a long queue in the gallery itself. I'd happily stay here again. For anyone travelling by public transport from the airport and/or Centraal station I'd suggest getting the 9 or 14 tram to Rembrandplein from where it's 100m to the hotel's entrance on Amstelstraat 14. We got the Metro to Waterlooplein which looked simple on the map but ended up lost...

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Planter77
Reviews.Content: Whilst the location was excellent, and the communal areas were in good condition, that's where the positives ended for me. The reception staff were unfriendly and rude to the point of not using pleasantries and manners, the concierge was permanently un-manned and the porters also rude. The bedroom was small, which we expected, but poorly designed. On the surface the room was clean, but the carpets/curtains/walls were dirty. We will be more careful in chosing value rather than low cost going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good, just a bit rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: bonjourtoulemonde
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 20mins walk from Centraal station and everything else, shops, bars, restaurants, coffeeshops, bike rental, markets are all walking distance. Most attractions are very close by too. Room was a 'queen bed' which was actually two singles pushed together. Very comfortable and clean bed. Room was very well designed, but a bit rough around the edges. Bathroom suite again, contemporary design, but bath was damaged in a number of places and water leaked out of shower cubicle. The carpet was stained in some places and the walls were in places too. These were mostly cosmetic observations and for the price, a few stains on the wall but a clean bed is a fair compromise to make, I think. Other problem was the noise of guests. I was kept awake all night twice in a four night stay and that's no exaggeration! Could hear upstairs bed creaking - ahem! Can't blame this on the hotel though. Free internet access and printing was another bonus to print boarding passes for plane home. Didn't have a credit card so had to leave a 50euro deposit. Final thing was the door into the bathroom is frosted glass. Not much privacy for toilet and showering! Overall, this place was not absolutely perfect but was reasonable and I would recommend it as long as you're aware of the downpoints!

Reviews.Title: “It's such a perfact day”
Reviews.Author: o1sumter
Reviews.Content: The room was perfect, clean, big, and comfortable. The staff is so nice and helpfull. Hotel is in amstel and it is so close to Dam Square so you can go every where without taking a tram or something. Or if u want take a tram it's just 3 minutes. So thanks for eden Hotel, and the crew. if you make rezervasion early it will be a good price :) dont stop go to eden&amsterdam :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tonynoshins
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, Staff very helpful took our car for the days we were staying there only 30 euros a day to park. Hotel room was clean and also had a lovely bathroom! location was exellent as just round the corner was one of the squares loads of resteraunts, bars and shops. We wish we had booked a few more days to stay!! Will definetley be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “more 2 star than 3 star”
Reviews.Author: kuepper
Reviews.Content: I was only expecting a no frills sort of place so had no great expectations but It was disappointing to find on arrival obviously longstanding cobwebs in the corner of the room, and hairs from a previous occupant on the floor of the bathroom and shower cubicle. Having to use a card key to use the lift and open the door to go up the stairs seemed a little odd. Decent value with the deal I got but i think I'd try elsewhere nextime

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: alpiot
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, nicely - but simply - fitted rooms, very efficient concierge. Unbeatable price for *** in Amsterdam (84â‚¬ double, 64.5â‚¬ single including an excellent breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: polly1Manchester
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room but were given a twin room. When we enquired about this we were told that a 'standard double room' can mean a twin or a double!. A pair of dirty male underpants and a vest were in the wardrobe when we arrived in the room. When my partner handed them in, no apology was offered. I didnt unpack my case as I knew the wardrobes etc couldn;t have been cleaned. There were rips in the bed sheets. We were not told that we would have to pay extra for the tea making facilities in the room. After ordering the tea, we waited so long that we went out and bought coffees. We couldn,t use the tea making facilities as the lime scale from the kettle was floating in my cup of tea. Positive; Good location. Most of the staff were really accommodating, polite and pleasant. (apart from the above mentioned lady who appeared to be irritated by our polite enquiries .) The concierge was wonderful. Very helpful. The room was comfortable and nicely decorated. Conclusion. We enjoyed our holiday but stayed out of the hotel as much as possible due to our first day experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rowdee
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending three nights at this hotel on a short break with my wife. It has a great location about 50 meters from Rembrandt Square with all its nightlife and trams stops to other parts of Amsterdam. The hotel staff were all friendly and professional. The bar is OK for a late drink. The best thing was the value for money. We booked ahead and got a room rate of about 60 euros per night plus tax. I'd thoroughly recommend it for this sort of short break. If you fancy a night at the cinema try the nearby Pathe Tuschinski, a fantastic art deco cinema, english films have original sound and dutch subtitles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregj2209
Reviews.Content: We stayed Easter 2007 and this hotel was a great find (by my partner!), we got a special internet rate so didn't cost us much at all. The location is excellent, you can walk to pretty much anything, the only time we took the tram was back to the station and that was just to save wheeling bags with us. The room was very nice, you could argue a bit small but seeing as you're only there to sleep this wasn't a problem at all. The bathroom was very good, essentially a wet room as it was tiled throughout. I honestly can't remember what the breakfast was like but that probably means it was your standard good buffet. Overall I'd recommend this hotel for a weekend in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - don't believe bad reviews !”
Reviews.Author: ValleyGirl127
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at The eden Hotel for 2 nights to celebrate his birthday. After reading some bad reviews we were a a bit wary and didn't quite know what to expect. As soon as we arrived tho, the worries disappeared. The reception staff were very welcoming, spoke very good english and were helpful and friendly, the same goes for the bar staff. They also supplied us with a new key card when we lost ours on a drunken night out !! Our room was very clean, modern, a little bit small but we didn't mind for 2 nights. The bar and lounge area is very comfortable and they serve lovely cocktails and the most gorgeous hot chocolate !! The only problem we had was with the shower, the water wasn't draining away, so my fiance went to reception to ask for help. The maintenance man was at our room to fix it before my fiance had returned, within a few minutes the problem was sorted, we were also offered a different room if we preferred but decided not to move. The hotel is in a good location, close to bars, restaurants, shops and coffee shops and is also close to tram stops. We would definately stay here again and would reccommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a bit wannabe posh”
Reviews.Author: xsoph14x
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov 2009 with partner, bit of a last minute booking as there was a big cock up with the hotel we had initially booked at, and very much wanted to stay on Rembrantplein. Very well priced for what you get, very large and modern hotel compared to most in Amsterdam. One half of the hotel is Eden hotel a 3* and the other half is Eden Rembrant which is a 4*, slightly strange if you ask me, as all guests can use either entrance, check in desk the same etc, maybe one half has slightly nicer rooms.. Anyway, check in fairly quick, make you sign an agreement not to smoke though, our room was on 4th floor, easy to get to via lift (very grateful, as this is a bit of a luxury in Amsterdam), right in the far corner. Reception staff ok, not the most helpful, and didnt show us to the room, just directed us. Nice room, massive for what we payed was almost a suite, two single beds pushed together, fairly comfortable. Tv, kettle, tea etc, although they wont supply milk?! weird. Desk, and chairs, armchairs and table and wardrobe/drawers. Bathroom really nice, shower over a bath, all modern and well finished decent size aswell, very clean on arrival. Fresh towels daily, put a do not disturb sign on your door and they will leave everything for you. Room was quiet, didnt here any noise from other guests and none from outside either. Unfortunately we wernt facing the Amstel, just a side road but nice view over Amsterdam anyway. Didnt eat in hotel so cant comment on food/drinks, bar area always looked empty though. Overall not a bad place to stay at all, but really depends what you want. Extremely good value for money on room size, but a bit shady about the 4* rooms attached to the 3* building?!? A friend we went with stayed on the opposite side of the square in a hostel right next to bushdocter coffeeshop, he had private entrance to room, double bed, smoking allowed and cheaper. But he had to share a bathroom, room wasnt done up (cracked paint etc), it was much noisier and the steps to room were ridiculous so really depends what you want from your holiday. Not a bad find for last minuite but Amsterdam 3* is nowhere near the UKs standard of 3* hotels so just think about that when booking, and dont expect the same standard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for solo female traveller”
Reviews.Author: LondonSalsadiva
Reviews.Content: As a single female traveller I have stayed in lots of cities, and not being of the back packing kind usually have to pay over the odds for a miniscule room in the eaves! The Eden Hotel is in a very nice and convenient area of Amsterdam. I stayed there for 3 nights over NYE and I found my single room excellent. The bed and pillow were downy soft and so comfortable.The wardrobe had a full lengh mirror with plenty of good lighting, space and coat hangers (a rarity) oh and if you really needed it the room had a flat screen TV and full temperature control! The bathroom is compact but with plenty of lighting and enough space for toiletries (although the Eden had all you needed to accompany a lovely refreshing shower). I never managed to get up in time for breakfast on any of the days so can't comment on the food but the cocktails at the bar before a nite on the town, the free internet, the lovely courteous and helpfull staff both on reception and the concierge desk means that I will definately be staying here again. Incidentally other friends of mine stayed at Schillers hotel and as I couldnt get in the Eden was the closest but had bad reviews. Glad I ignored them as by comparison I had the better deal Thank you Eden for contributing to a good stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice rooms and good location. No room service.”
Reviews.Author: Dman7878
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel for seeing Amsterdam. Really great spot to see all the sites. However, it is expensive given that it is only a 3 star hotel. There is no room service which is really annoying. Recommended for short stays. Too small for longer than a a couple of nights. Free internet is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: danrelv
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in the summer when I went on a stag do with about 30 lads. Now I must admit that the hotel wasn't the main focus of our little trip, but nevertheless, this hotel is fine and in a good location. We walked everywhere and its close to bars, red light district, Heineken museum and coffee shops. The hotel itself is clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. It is quite expensive (about 6 euros for a beer) but then you are in Europe and the exchange rate is rubbish, so take a bit of cash! The room was a good size (i stayed in a twin on the 4rd floor) and again it was clean and well presented with a good size bathroom. If you are looking for an OK hotel, somewhere to rest and explore the city then I reckon you cant go far wrong than here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Ignore the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: madmelcramlington
Reviews.Content: My wife and i were a little worried after the recent bad reviews about this Hotel but we needn't have worried. I really cannot see what people can complain about ( although there is the professional complainer out there ) We went to Amsterdam for my wifes 40th birthday and she has stayed at this hotel before about 10 years ago so decided to book as its location is fantastic. Clean, nicely laid out modern Hotel overlooking the canal. Nice bar and restaurant, yes the rooms a little small but very nice. Staff first class always willing to help especially the gentleman on the concierge desk. The hotel even give us a voucher for free drinks at the bar because it was my wifes birthday- nice touch. We did all 3 canal bus tours (20 euros each for 24 hours well worth it espacially when you can hop on and off ) Trams, Ann Franks, Red Light, coffee shops brilliant. Thanks to The Eden Hotel for a very pleasant stay Mel and Christine

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: JKG84
Reviews.Content: Myself and a few friends stayed in the Eden hotel last weekend, and it was great! I have read some terrible reviews on Trip Advisor but ours was nothing like any of the bad reviews! The 2 rooms we had were quite small, but we were sleeping and showering in there and thats it! The beds were super comfy and the rooms clean and warm. The bathroom was really quite small but for a couple of nights, who cares?! The staff were very nice and helpful, and the whole hotel had a nice feel to it. The best thing about it was the location, around the corner from Rembrant Square which has everything you need - especially the club Escape, lots of fun! All in all it was a great stay and I would definately go back and would recommend it to anyone as it is value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Employees with bad habits, hotel not trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: Weston15
Reviews.Content: I am really disappointed with my stay at the hotel. I do not have any complaint for my two nights stay (Nov 17, 18). However, someone took 3 new Longchamp purses and a scarf that my wife had accidentally left in the room and just few hours after we had checked out and having communicated the incident to the reception upon our return to the hotel to get the luggage left in the storage room, those items could not be found. There was little effort to contact the employees responsible for cleaning up the room and get the problem resolved before my departure.I may have lost those valuable items but the hotel is loosing much more since your reputation is being badly hurt by the actions of some of your employees that cannot be trusted. For being a hotel guest you must expect some kind of respect and we did not.

Reviews.Title: “worst than in the past”
Reviews.Author: anthony_mi
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights in this hotel. It's the fourth time I've been to this hotel and my impression is that all things got worse this year. Arrived at 2 pm and my room wasn't ready yet although I booked 3 months in advance! In addition the hotel used to have 2 receptions working, one on Amstel and the other behind: when I arrived only one reception was working. But I was astonished when after a day outside I found my room not cleaned up and not arranged. I needed 2 phone calls to the main desk to have 2 new towels in my room because nobody cared about this. I won't never book again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, good location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: M_Hately
Reviews.Content: The eden hotel was very nice, myself and my partner throughly enjoyed our stay. Rooms are very nice, very clean and fairly spacious. A 10/15 minute walk from the centre of amsterdam and even quicker if you cycle. All in all a nice hotel and would definetly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate hotel with small rooms - great location”
Reviews.Author: Bashky
Reviews.Content: Me and the Mrs booked this hotel due to its price and location and because we had stayed at the sister hotel (Rembrandt) before. Slightly worried after reading the reviews but we needn't be. The hotel is clean and tidy but our standard room was very small but manageable. Barely enough room for our luggage. It felt crowded when we were getting ready in the mornings but it's not too bad. The bed, like the room, is a bit on the small side but very comfortable. The bathroom was new and clean with a bath and shower head. Small shower screen meant the floor got wet but that's no biggie as there is a drainage system along the floor. We had a room on the 3rd floor and our window looked out on to a pedestrian side road and to the right you could see the canal. The mrs moaned that there was no minibar but I was glad as once the munchies struck I would have cleaned that baby out. Overall this hotel was very good for us as it provided a clean and comfortable base to explore the city from and sleep in. Would definitely recommend to anyone with doubts, as long as a small room doesn't put you off. The view all depends on your luck unless you book a canal facing room.

Reviews.Title: “great place, good location - shame about the room leaks”
Reviews.Author: Sharona6
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, it's in a nice and quiet location very close to Rembrandt square. The first night and first room we got was great until we got woken up the next morning because of a massive water leak from the ceiling, the water was literally flooding in from the ceiling right next to the bed and cause it was such a small room a few things got wet but you get what you pay for because other than that the cleanliness was great apart from the ceiling! You could see stains on the ceiling from where there were water leaks from before. They did move us into another room, it was quite smelly and the staff were a little funny when I mentioned that it was and there was nothing they did so I just used mr spray. All in all i would say this is only an average hotel, nothing special and the prices could be taken down abit because the rooms are tiny!

Reviews.Title: “Average..... but be aware”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1802
Reviews.Content: that the hotel is not as it presents itself on the internet, the lobby looks nice and is o.k., the elevator is not very reliable and it takes sometimes ages until it comes, rooms seem o.k. on first sight, but carpets are very worn out and full of stains, also the entrance doors to the rooms look very used. My colleagues found the bath a bit dirty, I had no problem here. The service is o.k. concerning concierge, bar and breakfast, but the reception staff is sometimes very stubborn when it comes to changes in already booked dates in terms of changing travel plans what can be normal in business. I would not recommend this hotel from my experience, but for sure location is great and convieniant to shops and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AandWPerth
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eden was our first stop of an extended vacation. We arrived early (around 8:00am) after long flight and the very friendly and helpful staff were able to check us in to our rooms, a bonus we didn't expect. The room was small (expected) but clean and well appointed with comfortable beds. The en-suite was also small but adequate and clean. We had four nights there and would stay again. The location was excellent with Rembrandtplien a short walk away, shorter still once we found the exit through the sister hotel at the rear. The Hotel is what I expected from a budget priced hotel in a major city. Be aware that the lift is a little slow and small but gets you there (you may prefer to walk down the stairs though)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful accomodations and great location”
Reviews.Author: citygirl4evah
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a part of Amsterdam that gives the first time visitor a wonderful impression of this fun city! although our check in time wasn' t until 3pm (we had arrived at 7:30am), the hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly in storing our bags and working on getting us a room as early as possible. Our room was so comfortable and had a view of the canal. The housekeeping staff were so diligent about keeping our room well stocked and clean, and we felt so comfortable asking for anything we needed during our week long stay (extra coffee!). Although the lobby is not very attractive or a comfortable place to sit, we did use the second level seating area to meet with some colleagues for drinks. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful with our questions, and the bellhop never let me carry me own bags. The location is perfect for touring - close to the museums, de pyjp, and other areas of interest, we walked everywhere and only caught the tram to get to the conference. We hated leaving the hotel and the city and would definitely stay again if we should ever return to Holland.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience ALL AROUND”
Reviews.Author: melissagt23
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever written a hotel review on trip advisor, but I felt I needed to make my experience here known! DO NOT STAY HERE!! If you have another option for a hotel, take it. From check in to check out this place was a complete nightmare! Upon check in we arrived slightly early and the person at the reception desk was SO rude about gicing us a room. He said check in is at 3p and there would be no exceptions. He would not even check to see if there was something available. He was talking to us like we came from another planet. We left the hotel and came back about an hour later. Once we arrived it was the same receptionist and he didn't even say one word to me when I gave him my reservation form. Just handed me a key to the room. We got upstairs and the room smelled like someone had JUST been smoking cigarettes in the room. All the linens had a stench. The room was decorated nicely and looks like it's been renovated recently. However, the rooms are TINY. The elevator takes forever by the way. Everytime we would ask reception a question they would give me attitude. HORRIBLE SERVICE. The phone in the room was not working so I walked downstairs and told the receptionist who simply did not believe me and literally would not send someone upstairs to take a look. They charge you for the TV so watch out there as well. Check out was fine because we paid through a third party website so no problems there, however many people in front of us in line were complaining of false chargers on their bill. All in all, this was a bad experience. The service at this hotel was mortifying. They need a new staff of people.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: MassEd66
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a student tour group for two weeks that my brother was escorting. Stayed with them in lower rated hotel not near city center. After they left my brother and I wanted a room closer to city center so booked at Eden for two nights. The room was very nice if a bit small and had very good design. I assumed that breakfast was included with the stay but it turns out it is a very expensive add on. The entertainment in the room was good but only if you wanted to pay the expensive rate for it's services which are optional. Otherwise very limited television. The really bad part is the phone service. On the phone there is a sticker displaying the international calling rates from the room. It listed the U.S. at a rate of less than $1.00 per minute although I forget the exact amount. After double checking at the desk they told me this is the calling rate and did not explain further. Imagine my surprise some weeks later to receive a phone bill for $111.50 for a ten minute call. Seems the hotel contracts with a shady (probably criminal) company called International Satellite Communications for the phone service. The fact that all amenities and services are charged extra and that they use a phone company like this without informing their guests leaves a very bad impression despite the nice atmosphere. By the way, the lower end hotel was called the Casa 400. The rooms are old and not fancy and look somewhat like student housing, but the service is excellent and the food is very good. Good showers too. The hotel without the nice packaging turns out to be the better place to stay and it is only a short walk from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, needs some work....”
Reviews.Author: LOCKr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and as first time Amsterdam travelers,we were pleased with the location of the Eden Amsterdam.Paying extra for an upgrade to a canal view was pricey butr well worth it.Only problem with the front view is the street, Amstelstraat was just under our window and ther was a bit of noise from the traffic and revelers of the coffee shops but sleeping wasn't too much of a problem. Breakfast was truly expensive, 22eu ,but I decided to splurge one morning and being a buffet we had our fill of food that was pretty tasty.One thing you cannot get anywhere in the "Dam" is a good "cup "o" joe", coffee. and just to get one at this hotel...if you've finished the little complementory packets in your room,your gonna have to pay full breakfast price to get a cup of Euro coffee.This should change! The room service only made the beds and emptied garbage regularly.we had to ask once for towels and coffee/tea(which never arrived on our last day and the rug in the room was never vacumned during our stay. The staff was as helpful as they could be so the complaints there aren't worth a mention. We were not able to access our room one evening due to a scuffle,short of a take over of our hotel by soccer hooligans which lasted for about three hours and not for nothing,an acknowlegement would have been nice from the Eden. Over all...a nice stay though!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny space.”
Reviews.Author: BlueWhirl
Reviews.Content: I had a tiny tiny single room on the ground floor in the bottom of the atrium. So the window may as well not exist. But I do like what they did with the furnishing and decoration. Sleek functional designs. If you just need a convenient place (within walking distance to Reguliersdwarstraat) to sleep, that should be fine. The room had a lot of spider webs at first though. I don't know why the staff would have tolerated that. But if you look around the whole city, seems like everyone is rather too tolerant of spider webs. Otherwise the room is clean and tidy enough. Free internet at the lobby is a nice touch. It managed to be quiet and calm even during gay pride with its abundance of partying around -- so that's a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel... a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: edwie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice. The first time because some friends had booked it and we all decided to stay close to each other; the 2nd time because I simply liked it. It is a very quiet hotel, and modern but not exactly new. The carpets are kind of old. It is a good place to sleep, it's silent, you never hear a thing in the other rooms. Bathroom is out of this world... they offer a nice case with top of the notch toiletries.. LCD TV, air conditioning. Internet is free in the lobby and the lower floors (if the wi fi signal makes it to the room). You need to ask for a code upon check-in. This hotel is just around the block from the Rembrandtplein... a square full of restaurants, cafes and commercial atmosphere. Not as crazy as the center, but it's a very lively place to be. It's also 5 minutes away from a metro station, Waterloopein. The funny thing is that both times I stayed in this hotel, I got the same room. I don't know if I'd stay here again... I think I will choose a place closer to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Corvette8
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel which is in a good central location. Was told on arrival that we had been "upgraded" to a studio apartment. What a joke... The "apartment" was outside the hotel in a back alley and was very old and rundown. Stains, peeling wallpaper and so on. We only stayed a night so decided not to bother complaining, but it was disappointing. Not happy.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hoodyman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights over the weekend, had a fine time. The hotel is easy to find and there's a good size sign outside so no danger of walking straight past it. The service was friendly but not overbearing, which was cool. We did get upgraded to an "executive room", but as I never saw an ordinary level room, I don't know how much of a difference that made. However, we had a tv, coffee & tea facilities and an enormous bed, and our room looked out on the canal, towards the opera house. During our four nights, we didn't visit either the bar or the restaurant facilites of the hotel. It is quite close to the Rembrandtsplein, where there was loads of bars and lots of people. There was a gym located virtually next to the hotel, and I think the hotel has an agreement so you get discounted entry. Everything about the hotel was great, although the air conditioning unit did leak on our 3rd night - but that was our fault I think! I would recommend it as an excellent place to stay for your time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the amount of money spent!”
Reviews.Author: AJR1London
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely disappointing depsite its great location. The overall standard of the communal areas and rooms were not up to scratch. The carpets in the bedrooms were particularly uncomfortable and covered in stains. Also, I don't need to see all the laundry for the hotel on the first floor landing. Furthermore, I have never stayed in a hotel where I've had to walk up to reception each time I needed the concierge as he wasn't there. The receptionist would then call him! To be fair, this seemed to be particular to one concierge. I was annoyed to find out that they don't guarantee to clean guests' rooms until 6pm on a Sunday - not ideal if you want to relax late afternoon. Finally, the toilets on the ground floor stank of something very unpleasant. All in all, overpriced and nowhere near the standard I would expect.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stau”
Reviews.Author: Mike_warsaw
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. I have done reaserch for very long time and choose this hotel due to its good location and quality versus price ratio. Nicy decorated, spacious rooms. Bathroom nice and clean. Hotel is in very good location. By walk: RLD- 5min Neuwmarkt- 6-7min Dam- 10 min Rembrantplein- 2 minutes Staff is very helpfull. Stayed there 3 nights and I am fully satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome”
Reviews.Author: YannisT80
Reviews.Content: First i was sceptic from other reviews but the minute i walked in the reception me and my partner said that it looked quite posh. It was turned out to be true. The staff was very helpful and always smiling and greeting everyone. I requested a room with an Amstel view for my partners birthday but the receptionist kinldy explained to me that we should upgrade to an Executive Room for 25 euros. We said its fine and we checked-in a standard room. Though it was small with no view as you would expect in a city centre hotel, it was so lovely. Anyway we only wanted it for sleep and a shower. The bed was absolutely fabulous and so comfortable that we couldnt get up in the morning. Flat screen TV also. The bathroom was sparkling clean and the housekeeper was keeping our room tidy everyday of our stay. On the first day of our stay we were delighted to find in our room a free-drinks voucher for my partner's birthday from the manager. We will deffinately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: MusicLuver00
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience. The Concierge was phenomenal and had great alternative suggestions when we found out the tulip tour had just ended. The bartender was very accomodating and fun. The location was outstanding and close to lots of restaurants, Rembrandt Square, the canal, etc. The room was pretty small, but charming and clean. Love how energy efficient this hotel is too. If we ever go back to Amsterdam, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheaters!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsLover
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 2 nights several days ago. This is far not my first stay in Amsterdam and in EU (Iâ€™m from Norway myself). But this is the first time when I would like to express my negative thinking about exactly that hotel. I selected it because of the rate- around 80 Euro per night and 7 Euro for city tax, central location and 3 stars level. But in reality I paid close to 100 Euro in addition, because staying in that hotel! I selected to take airport bus shuttle and prepaid for both ways, I used this service several times before and never had any troubles. When I asked in the hotel to book for me back way they refused to do so , by explaining that they not working with that company, although the shuttle bus company promised to picked me up from the Eden hotel. Reception said that I can use public transport (what was impossible for me because of the heavy bag) or ordered taxi via them. I remember that on the â€œtrip adviser â€œ site already has been negative expression that the hotel used not licensed taxi with over pricing, therefore I insist that they provided for me the telephone, so I ordered shuttle bus on my way back (what price a bit over 10 Euro, instead of taxi cost around 40). On the time of departure I waited 10 minutes and bus didnâ€™t come ( what never happened before) , I asked concierge to give the phone, so I would call the bus company to ask what happened , but he refused to do so. He said that I already have been said yesterday that the hotel doesnâ€™t use this company and they recommended to use the taxi. He said that the bus company should to pick me up next to another hotel, although when I called to them they said that they will pick me up to that hotel. Interesting, that I spoke about that with reception, the concierge werenâ€™tâ€™ there! I asked how much will cost taxi- he said 40 Euro and â€œaccidentallyâ€� there has been a taxi driver next to hotel, which arrived exactly on the time when I expected bus. Very clearly that the concierge knew that the bus will not come and the taxi come special for me, he knew that I will not have any other option! On the way to airport the taxi driver tried to take out 5-7 Euro extra if I want to use quicker way to airport, I refused , because I anyway werenâ€™t that late! When I arrived at home I found out that the 50 Euro deposit charge ( yes, you have to stay there 50 Euro deposit although there no any mini bar and refrigerator in the room) werenâ€™t released from my credit card although the reception said that it released immediately. I called to the hotel today and they said that they released it, but the card account showing that they took out this money. Iâ€™ll wait until tomorrow and will call to the bank to blocked that transaction and definitely will write complaint to the local police. The most of scaring in that situation that the hotel not didnâ€™t any complaining, they donâ€™t care about reputation, and if look on the whole situation I has been lucky that nothing else has been happened with me in that hotel. Because it looks very criminal. P.S. The room has been pretty large, I had windows inside of small yard, so there has been fresh breath from the canal. The hotel is totally non smoking from this year (Iâ€™m non smoking myself) but for cleaning rooms which before have been for smokers they using very strong chemicals, and I have been forced to keep open window all the time. It definitely wonâ€™t be suitable for the allergic humans and so on. Bad has been large and soft , bath has been nice and new, but carpet in the room and blanket on the bad have been extremely dirty , so totally there double impression about the room. And in the light what happened with the taxi and deposit (and that the hotel actively involved in the criminal actions) I definitely WILL NOT RECOMMEND TO STAY THERE FOR ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “great location but details spoil a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevjane
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay booked on a special offer and first impresions where good with a good reception area and aproached via a great canal scene with houseboats. We had a good size room (No 502) witha great bathroom flat screen tv. Then we opened the curtains and all we had to view was a wall of windows from one side and on the other side we where looking directly into an apartment opposite this made the room very dark so much for the great location overlooking the canals!! the tea/cofee facilities was very poor and only supplied enough for one cup each per day. We had bad rain storm on the 2nd day so returned to the hotel to dry off we turned on the TV to try and catch a weather forcast and found you had to pay 12.50 euros PER CHANNEL no free channels at all. We did not expect this penny pinching from a Â£115 per night hotel without breakfast. We took a look in the hotel resturant but the menu was not to our taste with main meals around 25 euros + and included such delights as poached calf brains in giblet gravy !!!On a brighter note the location is superb a 15 min walk from central station (8 euros fare for 2 from schiphol airport trains run every 15 mins) great choice of resturants nearby (some can be pricey but this is a city center) and 10 min scenic canal walk from the red light district. a little seedy but a great experiance with lots of couples enjoying the lively bars and coffee shops and the resturants in china town district next to the red light district offer better value eating. There is a good choice of canal trips nearby and this can be very pleasant way to get you bearings.

Reviews.Title: “would reccommend, will definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: fedr
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff', bright and cheerful foyer,bedroom/ toilet small but adequate.Stayed in front room overlooking canal which was cleaned and bed made every morning. Carpet in corridoors very drab .Breakfast consisting of juice, tea/coffee, 2 crossants at a price of â‚¬12.50 was rip off.Nice area,within walking distance of central station,markets,red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff, small rooms upgrade to an execute room!”
Reviews.Author: jmn42
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, the front overlooking the river and city hall, the rear backing on to Rembrandt Square with it's lovely square restaurant and bars. We upgraded from a standard room to an executive room when we checked in. It was well worth the 20 euros per night extra, as we had a larger room (although it was still small) with a fantastic river view, and tea and coffee facilities. The staff were brilliant, nothing was too much trouble - the conciege was helpful and offered free advise on the best sightseeing trips available. Any trips booked through the hotel can be added on to your room so you only end up with one bill, which we found really useful. The hotel backs on to it's sister hotel the Eden Rembrandt which leads directly onto Rembrandt Square - it's an odd set up with each hotel having a separate reception, conciege and luggage storage, but sharing a restaurant which is used by guests from both hotels at breakfast. We paid for bed and breakfast which consisted of 2 crossants, tea, coffee and orange juice. It's worth bearing in mind that for an extra 2 euros you can eat as much as you want from a buffet style breakfast that is served in the Eden Rembrandt...you'll need to walk past reception and follow the signs for the "Amsterdam Room", this leads you through into the Rembrandt hotel-the breakfast room, is opposite the reception. If you get lost, as it is very confusing, ask a member of staff to show you the breakfast room. It's hard to find anything negative about the hotel, as the staff make up for it's short falls, but if I did have to comment on anything, it would be the small rooms, you're definitely paying for the location. Also, there is a severe lack of signs within the hotel..I would suggest asking the staff to show you things like the lifts rather than looking for them yourself as you'll waste a lot of time wandering around. All in all, we had a great stay in a good hotel in a wonderful place that's defintely worth a visit. 3 or 4 days is enough to fit in all the local attractions....a visit to the windmills is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, Clean and professional hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdambaby
Reviews.Content: Woman says: "We stayed at the Eden hotel for 4 nights and we thought it was great. As we booked on a special offer, we thought we might get stuck with the worst of everything, however, besides the room being slightly small, it was still liveable, and what you need for a holiday in Amsterdam. The hotel was in a perfect location, next to Rembrandtplein and opposite Waterlooplein. The staff were very helpful and the conceirge were very friendly. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is still doing their research :)" Man says: "As soon as we got to the hotel we were instantly made to feel welcome by all the staff. As for the price, a '21 day advance booking' I felt it was the smallest room in the hotel, but we definitely got our moneys worth. In terms of location, it is a stone throw away from both Waterlooplein and Rembrandtplein, which are the decent nightlife areas with plenty to do. In terms of Coffeeshops, I must say some of the best ones we visted were around the hotel, giving us a comfortable walk back to an easy to find hotel. Be advised, Breakfast is overpriced!"

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, good location, Very warm rooms”
Reviews.Author: crizzy1982
Reviews.Content: Went for the weekend for Gay Pride. Good little hotel. They stick by the check in and check out times. We were put in the attic and it was very warm being Aug. It was are 5th trip to Amsterdam so we wouldn't fo back but the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub nightmare”
Reviews.Author: JandMEngland
Reviews.Content: We requested a quiet room. The first night we were lulled into a false sense of security. Silence.The second night was a nightmare. We discovered that our room was located right opposite the nightclub "Home". The shiny disco ball suspended right outside our window may have been a clue to the more observant. We could hear thumping music until the early hours and the noise of the revellers leaving the nighclub at 4am was horrendous. Our lack of sleep overshadowed any good points the hotel may have had. J and M England

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Spindly-Fox
Reviews.Content: Although there are good qualities to this hotel, my over-all experience has left a lingering feeling of disappointment and annoyance. Upon arrival (11am) we were gratefully allowed to check in and go to our room. The room was spotless but unfortunately the window we had was blocked with rows upon rows of towel and laundry cages and a public corridor giving us no privacy which resulted curtains closed and a darkened room . We were also next to a broken elevator which hummed and churned loudly into the night resulting in many sleepless nights. It was extremely noisy, the walls paper thin and we heard every mutter from other guests. A personal distaste was the bathroom door which was only frosted glass leaving nothing to the imagination. The hotel is very close to lots of lovely hotspots and shops though, however I do not think it is worth the money at all. On a plus, the beds are extremely comfortable, despite being two twins pushed together. Another plus is a free luggage storage room on check out which allows you to roam the city baggage free.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location!”
Reviews.Author: BryRee
Reviews.Content: Location was great! Right near the Rembrandtplein tram stop. Lots of restaurants and souvenirs shops nearby. Flower Market 5 minutes away. Stayed at this hotel; booked as a package deal with train. Very clean and great breakfast buffet. Room was small; but fine for single traveler. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Weird in a bad way.”
Reviews.Author: k8ld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over xmas 2008, hotel was weirdly set out, rooms looking onto one another, really crammed in. Breakfast price = extortionate, dont bother. First room we were alocated was above a club, noise all hours of the night. Asked to be moved, and was put in a room which seemed central in the building, it looked out onto other hotel rooms, but seemed as though it was the short straw room that never got used or even cleaned! There was dust everywhere, marks on carpet and curtains, lamps not working, window broken, smell of sewage actually coming out of the air conditioning and freezing cold as though it hadnt been used for some time. So whlist trying to warm the room with the air con, was also circulation the most putrid smell. Wasnt impressed, however after already asking to be moved once I didnt want to complain again as i felt it wouldn't be best recieved. We stayed in the ajoining hotel last yeat, the Eden Rembrandt,which was definately the better choice. I wont stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never agin”
Reviews.Author: VC3UK
Reviews.Content: I booked this with lastminute.com (normally have had positive experience)s and really do think that theyshould specify that the room we got for the price paid was in the basement and right by the kitchen. The room was stuffy and we were woken very early by staff using the kitchen, there was absolutely no consideration that people were sleeping as doors were slammed and there were lots of banging and crashing. The staff were not particularly friendly or helpful. I am a frequent visitor to Amsterdam and I definitely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place, Good Location, Two Hotels In One”
Reviews.Author: lostalongtheway
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is a clean and comfortable place to stay in a central location. The staff is friendly,especially at the bar/breakfast area. I would stay there again, but would try other hotels first. My wife and I stayed one night at the Eden Hotel Amsterdam between Christmas and New Years and made last minute reservations. The selection of hotels was limited by the time I made the booking so I chose Eden based on some decent reviews. The reservation process was quick. According to the bar staff, the Eden Hotel Amsterdam and the Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel are in the same building, and people don't always realize they are crossing into the "other" hotel for breakfast so I don't know how different they really are. The Eden Hotel Amsterdam is a 3 star hotel. I thought I was booking at the Rembrant version (4 stars), but ended up with a reservation for the Eden Hotel, so maybe I was just careless or maybe the booking tool needs some improvement; but whatever the case it's good to know in advance. After getting to our part of the building, the room was clean, smoke free, and comfortable. The only unusual thing was that our "window" opened into one of the hallways of the hotel so we could watch people walking down the hall and they could watch us if the curtains were left open. I'm not sure why they would even put a window in that room. The bathroom door is a piece of opaque glass which doesn't lock. If you are sharing the room and it's dark in the room, there's no way to be in the bathroom without the light shining through the glass door. The bed was comfortable, and it was quiet except for a few loud people strolling in at 3am.

Reviews.Title: “A real memory - like a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyAbroadCanada
Reviews.Content: This is easily the most memorable hotel our family has stayed it - for all the wrong reasons! It was booked online (non-refundable), so we did not know what what we were getting, but what an adventure! We had requested, non-smoking but got smoking! Our view was of the fire escape to the roof of another building...but the room - that was special! Entered the room to find a poorly repaired door (that had been recently kicked-in?). Poorly or unrepaired broken furnishings, huge dark stains on the carpet (coffe or blood?!?) and blood stains on the ceiling (bugs?). The best part was the smell of the room - like someone had just taken a C%^P and left it there. Surprisingly, the bathroom (except for the smell) was not as too nasty. If you want to part with your money for a truly nasty experience, please stay here - it will haunt your memories for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Amstel Area Awesome”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsDallas
Reviews.Content: As we decided to try going back to Amsterdam after our disappointment going to Th Belga... We Booked a City Break for couple of day Via KLM.. The Area we chose was Amstel..(as before stayed in Jordaan area which was Very quiet not much night life).. Amstel was beautiful, with everything we needed for an awesome stay.. The Eden Hotel was exactly as the pictures seemed... small but lovely rooms with bath/shower unlike our previous Trip where the Toilet was down corridor :( We Enjoyed everything about this second trip to Amsterdam There were plenty of Clubs.... Cafe's....bars etc just a short walk Rebrandt square was lively and had awesome atmosphere... We are booking up for next year lol But we will chose an apartment next time... but in the Amstel Area

Reviews.Title: “One night ok - two nights, might like to think twice”
Reviews.Author: Fitzcaraldo
Reviews.Content: I thought I would give this hotel a try, as I needed a room near the centre, but didn't want to pay too much. I had read the pretty varied reviews and so approached this with an open mind. the hotel is relatively near to the centre of town, just two hundred yards from the nearest underground and just two stops from the central station and near some tram lines. You could walk pretty much anywhere without any problems and the local scenery of buidlings and canals is pretty much as expected for Amsterdam. The hotel doesn't look much from outside, but inside the lobby it is bright and quite pleasant. I found the reception staff and conceierge quite helpful and friendly. The hotel has been refurbished. The corridors and layout inside is a little bit like a rabbit warren. The room (a single room) was small, badly ventilated, openen onto a very tiny air vent (courtyard would be overdoing it). There was no bath, but a shower. Depsite its size, the room was full of the latest designs and quite comfortable. The bathroom was clean and funtional and modern, but so modern there wasn't anywhere to hang a towel. I was served breakfast in the main lounge - I am not sure if they have somewhere else for breakfast which might have a little more on offer. I received a stodgy croissant, hard bread roll, slice of cheese and slice of ham, along with coffee and a juice. A waste of money. I won't be adding this to my list of favourite hotels. I'll try and stay around the corner next time, or take my chance at another hotel, unless desperation sinks in. But for just over Euro 110 in big town what should we expect?

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Rude Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: Christina014
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk were the least helpful people I have ever encountered in a hotel. The first room that I was given was very dark, and when I asked for a different room I was charged an extra $35 Euro per night for a room that was smaller and had a bathroon that was the size of a cruise ship bathroom (thoughit was light filled). My hotel room was supposed to include breakfast, a city map and a welcome drink - I had to fight for each of these and rather than being given an apology for them not being included I was given the run around. I also asked to have a FedEx package shipped out and was told they could not help me - they would not even tell me where the nearest FedEx drop off was. I'm not sure if this was just an Anit-American sentiment or if they treat everyone this way, but I would never stay at this hotel again. I later moved to the Hotel Rembrandt where the staff were extremely pleasant, the room was large and comfortable, the building was historial and unique and the price was 1/2 that of the Eden Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: walshst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden hotel 27 september on arrival the reception staff very good. the hotel does not look that great from the outside but once inside this all changed. a nice modern bar/resturant and reception area. the rooms are great with good beds lcd tv enough wardrobe space for the weekend and a very good clean bathroom. we had no mini bar or phone in our room (33) on the ground floor. but this did not bother us. we went as a group of ten and all said there rooms where to the same standard. we all had a great time in amsterdam and this hotel is one of the best i have stayed in. we will be going back to this hotel again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: kerrilp
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was very nervous about this hotel because of the reviews on this site. They are so hit or miss. I had a friend who had stayed here a number of times and always raved about it. What made my final decision was the price. I was there around Dec 20 and they had a FANTASTIC sale on hotel rooms through one of the hotel booking websites (not the hotel's website) where the room was $90 (with the service fee) a night. That's USD not Euros!! That's for a REAL hotel room, not a small budget accommdate that ran at that time for about $120 USD, some with shared baths. So I had to stay at the Eden for that price. I have to say, that my stay was very pleasurable. My husband and I had gotten separated before we made it to the hotel and he didn't know exactly where we were staying! Needless to say I was a bit upset about this situation. So I went to the reception and they were soooo helpful. A Front Desk clerk allowed me to use their front desk phone to call my husbands cell phone (a US number) as well as some family that lives in the Rotterdam area. I though that was very nice. Also, they brought me to the Internet stations so I could look something up (I can't remember what I needed on there) and got me a glass of water. And although I was very stressed, they went above & beyond in their help and made me feel much better. And those who are wondering, yes i did find my husband an hr later in Rembrandt Square. The room were nice. Typical hotel room. I have no complaints whatsoever. But there was construction going on until 5pm during the week at the time. Luckily most of my stay was over the weekend. The hallway lights were out when I arrived. I thought maybe there was some light trigger, but couldn't find it. So I was feeling the doors until I made it to my room. Turned out the lights were really out, so they put a couple of floor lamps in the corridor. One thing to watch out for is the breakfast. I didn't realize it wasn't included with my room and we had it one morning. It was 16euros a person! which was $50 blown on breakfast for much of nothing. If you go to breakfast and it's not included in your room, they will add it to your bill. So be careful if you choose it because the people checking you in at the breakfast room will not tell you that it is NOT included. If they had told me when I checked in for breakfast, I would have NEVER eaten there. There are great breakfast in rembrandt square. One I believed is called Opera cafe. It looks expensive, but a full egg breakfast was about 5euro and I got a great lunch ham sandwhich special for about 4euro that had sprouts and a nice bread. Very tasty and 9euros for both of us was better than the 32 for both of us at the hotel! So, all in all, if this price is placed well compared to other lesser quality accomodations, definitely go for the Eden.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: leannenufc
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Eden Hotel for two nights and had an excellent time there. On the same trip, we stayed in ten hotels around Europe and this was one of our absolute favourites. We booked the hotel because it was one of the cheaper options available in Amsterdam in the middle of summer, and as a result of this and some mixed reviews on this site, I wasn't entirely sure what to expect. However, I needn't have worried-it was a lovely place in which to spend a couple of days. After a crowded train journey, we arrived in Amsterdam to find heavy roadworks and crowds of people outside the station, which led to us becoming a bit overwhelmed and walking in completely the wrong direction to the hotel. We had heavy backpacks and it was quite a warm day, so needless to say, we weren't in the best of moods when we finally arrived at the hotel. However on entering, we were immediately cheered up. The lobby was really pretty, and the staff very welcoming. The lady on reception asked about our plans in Amsterdam and our trip so far, as well as advising us of the hotel's amenities and the services offered by the concierge. We've stayed in plenty of hotels where the check-in staff have practically tried to force us into speaking to the concierege and buy tours etc, but there was no pressure felt here at all. One thing I will mention about check-in is that they did expect a credit card on check-in, and were unable to accept a cash deposit in its place. We met halfway, and made a debit card payment, with the cash being returned to us on check-out. I imagine most people have a credit or debit card when travelling and won't have any problems, but I figured it was worth mentioning! We didn't ask for a renovated room on check-in, but were pleasantly surprised to find we got one anyway. We were on the fourth floor at the back of the hotel, and the room was beautiful. It was definitely the comfiest room of the whole trip; while it wasn't massive, it was more than big enough for two people and the decor and lighting made it feel very cosy. The bathroom was also very nice, with an excellent shower, and everything was impeccably clean. As for amenities, there was a mini bar, free hot drinks, an in-room safe and the TV had around 30 channels including BBC1 and Sky News. The only bad point (and this is nitpicking really) was that the view was a little strange-we were basically looking out into someone's apartment, meaning they could see straight into our room also, so we kept the curtains shut for a lot of the time we were there! Location-wise, the hotel isn't exactly in the very centre of things, but Amsterdam is a small enough city that it doesn't take long to walk anywhere. It took about ten minutes in various different directions to reach places like the Dam, Leidseplein and the Red Light District, and the train station was a twenty minute walk, as was the Anne Frank Huis. Rembrandtplein and Waterlooplein are only 2-5 minutes away, and there are various canal boat tour options practically on the doorstep. There are plenty of restaurant and cafe options nearby (and if you're tired after a long day's sightseeing, I can recommend the chinese chain Wok to Walk-it's on a street behind the hotel, very cheap and we were able to relax and enjoy it in front of the TV in our room!). Overall, I would say that the hotel is certainly on a higher level than the 3* it is rated as, and superb value for the price we paid (Â£63 a night)-we had a brilliant time, and would love to stay there again if we ever return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “not more than average”
Reviews.Author: timeless211
Reviews.Content: location is prime, walking distance to pretty much all of central amsterdam! but it ends right there with the prime. rooms are small and crampy, cleanliness leaves to be desired, had dirty towels with holes. windows opened to a closed interior court, so not really any fresh air.. The bathroom is too large compared to the bedroom. no cloth hangers in the bathroom, only 1 bar to hang a towel, quite interesting if you are 2, as only 1 towel can dry.. 2nd night, no housekeeping provided though we left the room around noon and only came back around 16.00 (4 pm) had placed the please make up my room sign.. left again at 5 pm with the same sign outside.. nothing.. overall not really worth their regular rates.. we had a special rate so it was ok.. but would not recommend the hotel, except for the location..

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel. not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Ketles
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of friends using this hotel and another nearby. My wife (who is disabled) and i felt the price per room at â‚¬144 with breakfast as an extra rather over the top. The room was small but clean but the hot water ran out on Saturday night. This affected the whole hotel and my party of friends was less than pleased as it meant none could shower and generally clean up before going out for the evening. Whilst staff apologised no compensation was forthcoming, not even a free drink at the bar. Surprisingly no mini bar in the room. The hallways on the first floor where we stayed could do with a coat of paint and our bathroom whilst modern was difficult to use and the ventilation fan did not work so got very steamy. The door to the bathroom did not work correctly either. On the friday night the disco in the bar was not welcome as my room was above the bar and the disco bass was far too high. Fortunately this ended early as the bar was empty Not an impressive stay all all and rather overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel, this is not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: pulla
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny, they advertised "large beds", but the bed in the double room was hardly queen size. If you didn't leave the room empty early enough (by 2pm or so), usually no cleaning was to be expected. Breakfast was disgusting, 9,50 euros for two pieces of dried out cheese, rotten (honestly, it was) garlic butter, pieces of white airy toast or rolls, bad coffee and bad orange juice. Breakfast buffet was 17,50, wasn't too tempted to try after the first breakfast experience. There was complimentary coffee, but many times only decaf, for some weird reason... Also more than one creamer a week seemed to be too much to hope for. Also they were proud about the view, well, our view was to some interior part, where no sky was to be seen, only the opposite wall. Also many small things that wouldn't require too much money were unsatisfactory, like no place where to hang your wet towel in the bathroom. No mirror, except the small one in the bathroom. Only positive surprise was free fixed line internet, provided you have your laptop with you, which I did. The staff was not very nice, when we came, the guy told us that we are lucky getting the last room as they are over booked. I had booked and paid the room 5 months before, so I damn well expect to have a room when I arrive! I don't mind staying in cheap dormitories with limited comfortability, but when I pay almost 1000 euros a week, I would expect a bit - no, a lot - more!!!! Please choose another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dotcom
Reviews.Content: Got a good advance rate online and have stayed at this hotel before so knew what I was getting. True the rooms can be small and the views well aren't really a view, but I love the hotel due to the good location, friendly staff and great decor. One negative is the smell, kind of raw sewage, I'd guess this hotel has old plumbing, but it was really quite bad coming from the bathroom and the trendy glass door doesn't seal the doorway so no way to stop it. Overall though I had a nice room, bigger than average and was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Below average room”
Reviews.Author: Apple_and_Pie
Reviews.Content: The Eden has a great location and some very friendly and helpful staff. It looks great from the outside and the lobby/bar/reception are very nice indeed. However, the double room we were given was very disappointing. It was extremely dingy as the window looked onto a central shaft - as we were on floor one, we were at the bottom of the shaft, so even if the sun was shining brightly, it felt as if it was overcast. The room was also very small, but was relatively palatial when compared to the bathroom which barely allowed room to turn around without hitting anything. It was also difficult to get to sleep in the room as the bed was very soft and was made worse by the wall onto the corridor having zero soundproofing which meant that any loud guests walking past were clearly heard (exclusively English and Americans...). There were also random scraping sounds which lasted our entire stay, which we attributed to people in the bar downstairs. One final problem was an uninvited room guest - I'm no entomologist, but it looked like a mosquito to me. All in all, extremely disappointing for the expensive room rate - and no breakfast included! Weâ€™ve been to many hotels in Amsterdam, but we won't be returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to get around, but not for relaxing holiday.”
Reviews.Author: luvfortravelling
Reviews.Content: After reading the review warning us not to get room 100 for the noise, we asked for different room, but was asked to pay extra 80 euros for it. So we just took the room they gave us, Room 308. Tiny, but clean and efficient. RIps on bed linen, but didn't notice till 2nd day. The room looked right across the next building's windows, so we had to have our curtains shut most of the time. Be aware! EXTREMELY noisy till dawn from the bar, nightclub next door. We couldn't sleep well for the whole 2 nights. Hotel location was very convenient. Beautiful canal and bridge, 10 minutes walk to Waterlooplein metro station, 10 minutes walk to catch tram in Rembrandtplein. I recommend this hotel for travellers who visit this city for late night drinking and parties. Not for those wanting a relaxing quiet holiday. I don't recommend dining in nearby Rembrandtplein. Get a tram to different areas. Poor choice of food, nothing dutch. Don't listen to hotel concierge's recommendation for food and good areas to go to. Do your research beforehand. Next time, we would rather stay near Rijksmuseum, or stay in a different city like Edam or Volendam which were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, cramped room”
Reviews.Author: ThedaBara
Reviews.Content: For a 'double occupancy' our standard double room in this hotel was terribly cramped. There was very little light as the room looked out onto to a service shaft with a dis-functioning air condition unit at the bottom of the shaft. If we opened the curtains the room occupants opposite us could see directly in to our room so we had to shut them. If we opened the window all we could hear was the noisy unit. I didn't get much sleep because of the unit noise. It was hard to see anything apart from the service duct as the room was on the first floor - suggest avoidance of room 113 at all costs! The beds were far too soft and the duvets seemed to be a very high 'tog' as we 'cooked' every night unless the window was open. Suggest you ask where the room is and what its outlook is like prior to booking at this hotel. The bar staff were ok but the alcohol prices very high. The room was a rip off at the high price we were charged.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Toyotacarina
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel and Perfect location just behind Rembrandt square facing the amstel canal (i cant stress how beautiful this place is!) Dam square is just a 10 minute stroll away. Very resonabley priced aswell-I paid a little over 300Euro for 3 nights! Receptionists could have been a little more polite when we where checking in but the room made up for that! It was huge [and spotless] with a very nice bathroom. Beds were so comfy and the decor was pretty stylish! We had huge windows too but they couldnt be opened so the air conditioning sorted us out. i really loved the Eden Hotel. Im itching to go back :]

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Un_namedUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for my stag weekend! Its close to bars and clubs and has plenty of places to eat! Its very easy to get to - take the train to Central Station from the airport (6 Euros return), then outside the train station take either the no.4 or 9 tram (3 Euros) to Rambrandt Square. When in the square cross over and walk towards the canal which will be in front of you, turn right and the hotel is about the 3rd building down on the right. Check in is at 3pm, the staff are really helpful, we asked for rooms next to each other which was no problem. The rooms are excellent, very clean! They all have a safe which is free to use and flat screen TV's. They are all very modern - see photos! The hotel is also open 24 hours so no concerns as to what time you get back - your room card will allow access through the front door of the building. There is a club called Home next door to the hotel, so if you are a light sleeper ask for a room on the left side of the hotel! We walked everywhere, Dam Square (Red Light District) is approx 15 minute walk away, just turn left out of the hotel and follow the canal. I would stay here again without question! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Herm0sa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 nite stay and were extremely disappointed. We had to upgrade twice to an executive room for over $400 a nite to have enough room for two adults to both stand on the floor at the same time. When we got ready for bed and turned back the covers it was to find blood stained sheets and dirty pillowcases...obviously the linens had not been changed from the previous tenant. The chambermaid balked at changing the linens since it was "someone else's job." We finally got the sheets changed the next morning, but the bloody bath mat was refolded and replaced for three days straight. Even in the hotel's bar, I was served a glass of wine in a lipstick covered, sticky, obviously dirty wine glass. The hotel had a nice location and most of the staff were pleasant as well as unhelpful, but I have never stayed in a hotel with such disgustingly filthy and unsanitary housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Memory!”
Reviews.Author: Iakinthos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eden Hotel Amsterdam for 3 nights and I was excited! Very friendly and helpful staff, very clean room and the beds were very comfortable. I was reading the reviews here and some people were suggesting to ask for a room on the 4th or 5th floor. I did that and I ended up with a tiny room like an attic and the window was facing a grey wall. I immediately made a complain at he front desk and the receptionist gave me a room on the second floor. As soon as I entered the room i said WOW, it was a large room facing the canal. Amazing view! Huge beds, very spacious room in general. The hotel is located close to Rembrandt square and the flower market but quite far from Leidseplein which is the best place to spend your evening/night as a tourist because it is one of the most lively areas of Amsterdam where all the restaurants and bars are found. We had to take a tram and then walk for a while to reach Leidseplein. Moreover, the hotel is about 3 tram stops to Dam square or a 20 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: almerc
Reviews.Content: Just came home from a 2 night stay at the Eden. Read the some what mixed reviews and decided to take a chance based on the overall positive reviews. So glad we did. For an extra 20 euros a night we upgraded to a room overlooking the river on the 2nd floor. Had clearly just been renovated and was very slick and modern. With the most comfortable beds and pillows I have ever slept in. Superb views over the River, road below was a bit noisy with the window open but wasn't enough to spoil the nights sleep. Above the bed was a large illuminated glass picture of tulips that along with the smoked glass bathroom really set the modern room off. Didn't see the lesser rooms not overlooking the river so cannot compare but I recommend upgrading as our room was superb. The staff was very friendly. Drinks at the bar were expensive 12 euros for a jack daniels and gin and tonic though there were larger measures than in the uk. Free internet in the bar. Perfect location as its just a 10 minute walk to the old town. All in all I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, i think the previous poor reviews are pre renovation which looks like its now complete. See photos below of our room and view outsie

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but noisy”
Reviews.Author: bunnyegg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden Hotel over the Easter period. Took the train from Amsterdam airport to the city centre and realise the hotel was at least half an hour walk through the busy main street. Alternatively, can catch the tram from the train station. The interior decor is modern and the room is a reasonable size. I couldn't say the room was spotless clean as lots of hair was found the basin, a bit disgusting. It can get quite noisy at night, can hear laughters and shouts from the next room. The hotel is located close to Rembrandtplein, and roughly 20 mins walk from the red light district or 30mins from the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, hotel”
Reviews.Author: little_squirrel
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Amsterdam, over the Easter period, with a friend sharing a room at the Eden Hotel. I found the room to be kept very clean and comfy although a bit cosy for two adults to move around in at the same time (please take comments about *all* Nederland/European hotels having similar tiny spaces with a pinch of salt, this is a rather sweeping generalisation unless you are used to having an entire penthouse suite.) I would recommend the hotel entirely for staff helpfulness: lending out travel adaptor plugs, gaining access to wifi, storing luggage on check out for a later collection. This is a very popular and busy hotel, especially for the 20's to 30's age range, so if you are a light or easily disturbed sleeper do take earplugs as there is usually some noise through the corridors at night. Oh, and this also goes for the rooms that only have single glazing and look out onto the side alley. Morning deliveries of beer to a bar do start around 7.00 a.m. That aside it makes an excellent base to explore the area and it is reasonably priced if you are sharing.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Harrison79
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 3 days at the Eden, the hotel was in a great location just mins from the shops and bars, rooms were only small but with a really comfy bed and decent bathroom. Plazma on wall, tea & coffee facilities and friendly staff !!! Ask for a room on the 4th floor, aparently these are refurbished rooms ( others not as modern/nice ) staff were happy to do this upon arrival.... A great place to stay in a good location !

Reviews.Title: “had an amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: cowbsicuit
Reviews.Content: the hotel was lovely (had the wow factor), the room was beautifully decorated and clean, the beds were so comfortable, and it had a bath and shower. We were also lucky to get an amazing view of the amstel river. The hotel was no more than 25 mins walk away from any of the main sites, and 2 mins walk from rembrandt square. Despite a busy nightclub here, we didnt hear any noise from it. The hotel added nice touches.... we mentioned our visit was for a birthday and there was a complementary happy birthday drinks voucher in the room for pipa's bar in the lobby, and also a complementary bottle of kruindenbitter. we would definitely stay here again, and highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Fairly priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnB1977
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from a long weekend in Amsterdam with my girlfriend - I'm 30yrs, her 26yrs. I have been many times but generally staying with friends who lived there. Chose hotel due to location, right on top of Rembrandt square and in the middle of leidsplein/vondel park and the centre of town the other way. Room was newly refurbished (according to reception all renovations are now complete, but I only saw our room) and although extremely compact it was fine to sleep in and spend minimal time getting ready to go out for the day/night. Overally I found the standard of the hotel and price to be pretty good & would definately consider it again if I return to the dam. We got an all in 3night stay (thurs-sun) and flights with Expedia for about Â£300 for both of us.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mitchgo21
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on the Eden Hotel Amsterdam, I was unsure of what I would arrive to. But I was very satisfied with my stay. Per previous postings, I requested a renovated room and also one in a quiet area (not overlooking nightclubs or near renovations). My request was kindly granted and the room was clean and had comfortable beds. Sure the room was a bit on the small side, but you are in Europe, get used to it. Besides, you are in Amsterdam, how much time are you really going to spend in a hotel room. The location was great, near lots of sights and close to the tram line. If I return to Amsterdam, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “generally good & heavenly beds!”
Reviews.Author: roby73
Reviews.Content: the good: It's located in a great zone,rembrantplein,practicaly in the center of Amsterdam. The room was newly refurb and modern and decently clean. The most incredibly confortable beds!
