Free internet in the hotel lounge. the bad: The room we booked via internet was a double standard.It was normal size but with a terrible view towards the wall of the other building. There was never natural light as it was on the second floor. The cleaning ladys dont do much apart from making the bed and changing the towles. We did't have breakfast as it was 18euros per person and didn't seem like worthing it. Go and have breakfast in the self service restaurant LA PLACE...its great and cheap! Generally it's good and good price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Beds”
Reviews.Author: Chokopie
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We stayed here for 2 nights. The staff was great, but the best thing was the newly updated room. In fact, we were the first people to sleep in this new room. The new beds and comforters were so comfortable and soft, it was like lying on a cloud. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful, and the hotel is located in a very good central area not far (3 minutes on foot) from tram stations, restaurants and pubs. The one negative thing was that they are renovating the hotel, so the construction workers were working starting around 8 a.m., which didn't bother us because we wake up pretty early, but another guest was rather annoyed and too harsh about it with the front desk staff. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “cosi cosi”
Reviews.Author: geohou
Reviews.Content: It's located in a great zone,rembrantplein,practicaly in the center of Amsterdam. The room we booked via internet was a double standard.It was cute but very small and with a terrible view towards the wall of the other building.There was never natural light as it was on the first floor. The cleaning ladys didn;t do anything else but make the bed and change the towles. Never put in order the clothes and stuff. We did't have breakfast as it was 18euros per person and didn't seem like worthing it. The receptionists weren't the most gentle persons .. A good thing is that there is free internet in the main lounge of the hotel. Generally it's nothing special but ok if someone doesn't expect to be in a wonderful hotel but just needs a central place to sleep. P.S. it has VERY comfy beds..!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: SC85CAN
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site I was a little unsure as to what the hotel would be like. I went with my Partner and our two friends I can honestly say it was fabulous! The staff were really friendly and always happy to help. The rooms were very modern and very clean, I was impressed considering this was rated as a 3* hotel I would rate it at least a 4*. I asked on arrival for one of the refurbished rooms which I was given. There is a bar at the entrance, with comfy seating for you to chill out and drink or eat and also a internet area and smoking area. I dont think the pictures on the website do it justice to how nice it is. I would say this is ideally located as you are within a 5 minute walk from bars and restaurants and about a 20/ 30 walk to Dam Square, but everywhere is accessible as you can jump on a tram and be there in no time! I would higher recommed this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goodtimegal
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam staying at the Hotel Eden.After reading previous reviews on Trip Advisor we didnt know what to expect but the Hotel couldnt have been better. We stayed on the 5th floor in a lovely clean room with the most comfortable bed and pillows ever! The staff were friendly & helpful and the hotel is in a great location.Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Tiny rooms - fight for a clean one!”
Reviews.Author: Gecko-Toes
Reviews.Content: Ok,lets start with the positives: The hotel is in an excellent location by rembrandt square & within walking distance of all the major attractions. The room we ended up with was clean & newly renovated. Now the negatives: When we arrived we were told that a canal view room would be 30 euros extra per night.We refused & the receptionist offered an apartment with canal view for the same price... What we entered was not 3 star quality it was infact a dingy squat-like smelly hole with furniture from the 70's & mould from around the same period.Having read other reviews of the hotel mentioning renovated rooms I marched back to the desk & requested one.We were given a room on the 4th floor which was indeed renovated & clean.However there was a major problem - unless you are extremely thin or like pot-holing you will find the room tiny.It is without doubt the smallest room i have ever stayed in & I can't imagine our American friends being too impressed.It was so claustrophobic we spent as much time away from the room as possible.Having said all of this we enjoyed our time in Amsterdam enormously & would recommend the hotel on its location alone.My advice would be that when you book ,request in writing that you will be in a renovated room.Another word of warning - the food in the hotel is ridiculously overpriced & the selection is poor.We asked for a regular green salad - just leaves & tomatoes & were told that as the restaurant is 'Typically French' the chef did not have these ingredients...my boyfriend is French...this did not go down well! If you want a cheap option for brfeakfast go to the 'La Place Mangerie' on Rokin - they have every kind of food imaginable at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice”
Reviews.Author: travelingringo
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The location is very good, on a canal, and very near Rembrandt Square. Our room was small, but the bed was VERY comfortable, and the decor was modern. Our room had obviously been remodeled recently, and was kept quite clean as well. I noticed other reviews mentioned noise and thin walls, but we never heard anything (our room was on the 1st or 2nd floor, I think); in fact it was very quiet. All in all, the hotel had everything we needed, at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but cramped”
Reviews.Author: Shirls1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in Dec. Whilst we were on a budget we tried to get a decent hotel for our money. The hotel itself was very clean,tidy and modern and well equipped. Our beds were extremely comfortable but the room was let down by the size of the bathroom. The door was made of frosted glass and you had to open it outward into the bedroom. If you opened it inward, you banged it into the toilet. The shower doors were similar. There was very little space to put your toiletries, and I'm glad I didn't take my cat as there wouldn't have been room to swing it! The maid service also left a lot to be desired. On the first day we were a towel short and had to ask for another. My friend broke a coffe mug which was not replaced and the shower gel ran out and was not replenished. The floor also didn't look like it was hoovered on the second day. Quite poor. The bar area was nice and not too overpriced, the menu looked good too, although we never ate in there. Neither did we have breakfast as it was an additional 16 Euros. You will also get charged tourist tax on cecking out which in2.5 Euros. Whilst I was checking out, the receptionist was half way through dealing with me when she ignored me in favour of taking a reservation over the phone. Very rude. On the plus side the concierage was very helpful and his English was good. Not a bad location but there are others that are probably more central for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Clean hotel smack dead in the center well near enough”
Reviews.Author: fourandfivestar
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely....near tram to center Rembrant around the corner. would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....but.....”
Reviews.Author: elizacass
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews, somewhat mixed, but Amsterdam I found out can be an expensive city, so the price was reasonable at this Hotel, so we booked a room for 2 nights. I had read reviews to ask for a renovated room on the 4 or 5 floor, our first room was on the 5th, it was defenitly not newly remodeled. Our next try was on the 4th floor, I asked the front desk directly for one of their renovated rooms, we got a room on the 4th floor, looked about the same, had a small window overlooking the street and canal, we settled. So if any of you have stayed at hotels with rooms overlooking the street, nice for looking out at the local life ...but NOISY! The walls were super thin, it almost felt sometimes that we were not alone in the room, the voices from next door, and below really carried. The rooms were really basic and looked nothing like the pictures advertised on the website. The positives.....The location was close to everything, and was pretty easy to get to. The lobby is really nice, and looks like it was remodeled....they had free internet in the cafe. My friend that I was traveling with was great , and made the trip for me, so it didnt matter where we stayed,,,,,,, but I think that there are others hotels that would give you more value, and charm, so keeping looking!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it. Our room was awful. Service was fine.”
Reviews.Author: laivly
Reviews.Content: The location is nice, right around the theater, in Central Amsterdam. When you walk in, the lobby and reception area looks nice and updated. The concierge was very helpful with other guests, I was sitting in the reception area, waiting for my BF and watched. Service was fine. We had no problems with service. However, our room was awful. Dreadful. It was #137. I made sure to save the key card holder. I guess we checked in too late, they gave our original room away, #439. Maybe the higher the floor, the better the room? What I do know is that our room was a decent size, ugly as heck, the bed wasn't that comfortable, and the blanket was an army green fleece thing that I wouldn't keep in my own home. There was hardly any decor except for a tiny mirror and two cow portraits above our bed. That's not the worst part, the worst part is that we were somewhere next to the laundry room and I could hear it spinning ALL night. I could hardly sleep, not to mention the walls are very thin!!! I could hear everyone in the hallway, but they were loud. And be sure to lock your doors at night, someone tried to get into our room, but I think it was because he was drunk and didn't realize it was the wrong room. I later heard him next door talking so I'm pretty sure that's what happened. The price is rather inexpensive given the location so I think it might have more than its fair share of young rowdy people at night. I'm not even 30 yet, but I was annoyed as heck at all the noise till the early morning. Do not stay at this hotel! We were only there one night so we couldn't request another room.

Reviews.Title: “Insist on a good room”
Reviews.Author: Koran
Reviews.Content: My fiancee booked a 4 day holiday for us both for my 60th birthday. We both love Amsterdam and were accompanied this time by two friends who had stayed at the Eden Hotel previously. I was puzzled (and concerned) by the conflicting reviews on this site but I think I now understand the reason. There are two hotels on the site - the 3* Best Western Eden Hotel (lobby overlooks the Amstel River) and the 4* Eden Rembrandt Square Hotel (lobby overlooks, almost, Rembrandt Square). It seems clear that the 3* hotel is being upgraded and that the two will soon become one 4* hotel. My advice is to book into the 3* hotel and insist on having one of the renovated (4*) rooms. It will be a bargain!!! Ask for a room on the 4th floor. Our friends were originally put in a room overlooking the nightclub and asked to be given another room. They were jubilant with their room - 404 - and when we saw it we asked to be moved near them although our original room (on the 3rd floor) was very reasonable. We were given Room 403 and were delighted. It was very spacious, with modern bathroom, air conditioning, plasma TV, etc. All the rooms on the 4th floor were similar although they did vary in size and it seems from other reviews that the rooms on the 5th floor are similar. We found the staff very helpful and amenable and there was free internet access in the lobby of the 4* section which is available to both hotels. We did not eat in the hotel but there are so many other options in Rembrandt Square. And for entertainment do not miss the Boom Chicago improv group at Leidseplein. It is walkable from The Eden Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Tim964
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Eden for 2 nights in October, 2007. We had 3 rooms, all were very clean and in good condition. Location was pretty good. The only negatives were 1) breakfast is 16 Euro per person if not included in the rom rate, and it is definetely not worth the price 2) a 5 minute phone call to the US cost over 70 Euro - don't do it if you don;t have to!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Seedy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to most tourist amenities in the centre of Amsterdam. A pair of converted heritage properties, the change has been done with care to provide accommodation that is quiet and comfortable. Provides an excellent base for those who wish to explore Amsterdam. Room 413 is the one I stayed in. It is of reasonable size and in reasonable condition, but shows some wear and tear as a result of high occupancy rates. Problems with a defective tap (faucet) were resolved quickly and effectively though. Many rooms have no view, with windows opening on a central light well, as a result of the narrow frontage but deep construction of the building. Check-in and check-out is conducted quickly and efficiently. Bar and restaurant have an excellent ambience, but service was a little slow. On the whole, an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's about location”
Reviews.Author: djcynic
Reviews.Content: Small room but in a great location

Reviews.Title: “BEST western”
Reviews.Author: fireeves
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eden for 3 nights (11-13 Sept 07) and could not genuinely fault anything about the hotel. We had read mixed reviews of the hotel, but given the location and price (We got a great rate from the Best Western website of around â‚¬100 per night) we thought we would give it a go - we were not disappointed. The lobby is first class, and all the staff helpful. We originally arrived about 3 hours earlier than our check in time and there was no problems with us leaving our luggage in a secure room while we went off to explore. When we returned, we were given our key and went to check out our room. The room was on the 3rd floor and had not yet been updated (although there were a few signs around the hotel that showed further work was planned) but was spacious, faced the canal and was clean. There was noise from the street below (mainly traffic rather than people) but as we were in the city we expected this - apparently this was still much quieter than up near Dam square) We found the location to be ideal - approx 20 minutes walk from Central Station and another 20 minutes south to the Liedesplein/Museum quarter, with Dam square being a quick 5/10 min's away - we walked everywhere! A note to all people heading to Amsterdam, the 'pavements' and roads are manic with vehicles coming from every direction; make sure you keep alert at all times. All in all the hotel was better than expected, and the location faultless - I would definitely return and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out!”
Reviews.Author: Skyflier
Reviews.Content: I figured I had no reason to worry about the hotel as I entered the lobby. It looked ok and the staff was pleasant. I was given my room that seemed to be in a different building than the lobby as I had to trod through an indoor "walkway" before reaching it. At first glance the room seemed ok, but as I entered I realized that it stunk like a pot-party had just left minutes ago. Lampshades with holes in them, wallpaper torn in some areas. I opened the window just to be met by a view of two disco-balls and lights(!) hanging between the hotel and the next building and I had to make a choice of either getting rid of the stench or be kept awake by the noise from the club owning the discoballs. I opted for the latter as it was no a/c nor change of air in the room. The bathroom was spacious, but there was a lot of chips in the tub (no, not the potato-kind...) and the showercurtain was heavily milldewed. You might ask why I didn't ask for a new room. At the same time I was there, an international broadcasting conference was in town, occupying all that could be found of rooms in Amsterdam. The worst bit was when I layed down to try and go to sleep in the stench and noise from the club outside my window. The matress acted like a hammock would, making me feel like I tried sleeping in a miniature meteorite-crater. Did I mention that I found paperclips(!) under the covers? My colleague that stayed in a different part of the hotel got a totally different room and was very pleased - so when booking; watch out and try and beware that there might be a heaven-and-hell difference when it comes to the room-standard.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump: or is the glass really 9/10 empty?”
Reviews.Author: VotingRightsNow
Reviews.Content: There isn't enough room to write how awful this place is. One could start with the chaos of the check in process, go to the drabby lobby, surly staff, but that would only be looking at the glass being 9/10th empty instead of 1/10th full. We were given rooms with a canal view. Not being short people, the windows were usless. They started at the floor and came to my chest. Yes, one got a view of the canal, if you weren't afraid to lay down on filthy carpet. The noise from the traffic, so effectively transmitted throughout the room by the low windows, kept me up most of the night. The night staff seemed to think it an incovenience that someone would bring to their attention such problems. Life is too short; save your money; enjoy your vacation; go just about anywhere else in Amsterdam but this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay again, 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCanada
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here first in August 2005, and I wrote a good review at that time. We arrived at Best Western Eden after being bumped from a cheaper hotel, so our rate was very cheap and it was a superb deal. This time around we got a pretty good deal also, although not quite so cheap. I booked a cancellable rate of 79 Euros per night, 10 months in advance, through the hotel web site. I specified two single beds, and a quiet room, because our last stay had a room over a noisy nightclub (as mentioned by others). The hotel has been renovated in part, and I think they are continuing to refurbish the rooms. We arrived and noticed the lobby check-in area had been updated in a contemporary style. We were checked into our room, but discovered it had a double bed. I noticed it was refurbished and in a contemporary style, but rather small and poky, with little natural light. In any event, we needed two beds, although I knew they'd be in the adjacent formation. So I went back to the desk, and the clerk told us she'd have to give us an older room. This was fine, and we got a room that was extremely similar to our room two years ago. It's a bit worn, but everything was clean and in reasonably good condition. The room was larger than the more contemporary one, with more light. On our last visit, breakfast was included. I wasn't initially planning to have breakfast here, given the 16 Euro rate, but when we were raring to go at 7 AM, we decided we might as well. No breakfast cafes were open at that time, according to our guidebooks, and we wouldn't have the same choice and quantity of food. So we splurged that day, and splurged the next, and I think it was worth it. The third day we had to leave too early for breakfast, due to onward travel. The location remains extremely central, convenient, and pleasant. The only unfortunate thing is that for future visits, the hotel seems to have increased its rates significantly, when I checked the web site to consider a possible future stay. One note for families: The hotel web site does allow a free child 11 and under, but you will not get an extra bed for the child. The terms say something like "existing bedding". I saw one disappointed mother ask about this at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a Lovely City (by day!)”
Reviews.Author: Earlp78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Sept 2006 with a group of friends, while we were in Dam on a weekend break. The hotel is a little dated, but in saying that the rooms were in a pretty good condition considering the age of the hotel. We had three double rooms, two of which were quite large, however our room was a little small - but we managed! They were all clean and fairly well presented, the bathrooms were all ok and clean. The reception staff were helpful and pleasant. Gave us help getting a taxi to the airport upon check out which was great. Dam is a lovely city in the day time with the pretty canals etc, we had great weather which helped. Beware though bikes rule in Dam, if you're in there way they won't stop, so be careful!!!!!! Please be careful at night time, we walked through the red light district (because we thought we can't come here and not walk through!!!!) I have to say it was a weird experience!!!! We were all safe enough as we stayed together in our group, so I'd advice everyone else to do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: hardnoseblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the nights of the 15th and 16th of August,with my wife,wedding annivesary present from her,couldn't fault the hotel,staff polite and courteous on reception,all the others friendly,concierge was very helpful,bathroom one of the best I have used,the shower cubicle with ceiling shower was brill! the room had everything you would need,for a base,comfy bed,the room was immaculate on both days,top marks to the chamber maids!Getting to the hotel is easy,train from airport,20 mins then the tram no4 from right outside the station to Rembrandt square 50 yards walk and your there,enjoy people we did!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great location”
Reviews.Author: KittyCatLeamington
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m not sure if some of the reviews below are even of the same Best Western Eden hotel that my boyfriend and I stayed in from 12th to 14th August! Just so you can check, the Best Western Eden that we stayed at was on the Amstel just infront of Rembrantplein right on the canal and I can honestly say that it was perfect for the two night break we were on. We paid 79EUR per night (excluding breakfast) and got great value for money. We were given a lovely room on the 4th floor (room 403)â€“ it was huge and had a desk and two chairs and the comfiest bed Iâ€™ve slept in in ages! Even though only floor 5 is marked as non smoking on the lift buttons â€“ ours was actually non smoking too. There were two windows which both looked out over the internal courtyard but this didnâ€™t worry us as the only time we spent in the room was when we were sleeping. Also it meant that we didnâ€™t get any street noise which has often been a problem on other city breaks. Housekeeping came round quite early each morning (between 9 and 10) but if you want a lie in then put your do not disturb sign up and they wonâ€™t knock. We did this and then when we came back from our day out and about the room had been serviced while we were gone so thereâ€™s no need to worry about missing out on the morning rounds. Staff at reception were not overly friendly but were also not rude â€“ just efficient. We only dealt with them at check in and check out so did not have much contact with them. We didnâ€™t have the breakfast as itâ€™s much cheaper to go somewhere else and get something. Overall it was a great place to stay for a laid back couple of days. As lots of people have said the location was brilliant for seeing Amsterdam â€“ we walked everywhere and Iâ€™d definitely recommend people to stay here. Given how nice the room was Iâ€™d definitely give it a 3*+.

Reviews.Title: “Walked in room and then walked out!”
Reviews.Author: LesPol39
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel I have "never" stayed in. My husband and I arrived our 2nd trip to Amsterdam exicited and hoping our hotel would be as awsome as another hotel in Basel, Switzerland. But when we got to the hotel, the lobby was run down (which was a clue to the rest of the hotel). When we got to our "sparse" room with one small window facing a brick wall, there were stains on the carpets and decor that was so dreadful we immediately got on the internet to find another accomodation. There was no way I could ever actually sleep or even sit on the bed. It was just run down and didn't look clean. We did find a wonderful hotel not too far away (Hotel Toren) and immediately moved our belongings. The so-called bellhops saw us leaving with our bags after just arriving with our bags, and never asked what was wrong or offered to help. We were willing to pay for that nignt, but when we tried to cancel our 2nd night, the hotel had already charged our card and said that it was too late. This hotel was so bad that we completely paid for it and nevertheless paid for another hotel to actually stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm....”
Reviews.Author: euro2006
Reviews.Content: Nice and safe neighborhood. Terrible experience, they put me in a room on the basement, next to the kitchen. First of all, there was no remote control for TV (so can't turn it on), no soap in my room and a few flies in the bathroom. After I checked in, I left for a long walk and returned around 8pm. Believe it or not, there were many flies in the room. I rang up the front desk and after several minutes of complaint, he switched me to other room on the same floor (still the BASEMENT). I know I should write my comment or warning early.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base of Operations in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: the_real_flipflops
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was the last stop on our European Adventure and the Best Western Eden was a great base of operation-- especially if you like to walk and explore the way we do! Located on the Amstel River we walked everywhere -- didn't take public transpo until the morning we had to catch our flight home. The hotel was clean with a roomy bathroom(though the carpet and wallpaper was a little worn looking in places). The beds were also pretty comfortable. We stayed on the 5th floor which was the non smoking floor. The room didn't smell at all like smoke though the hall smelled a little smoky. The hotel had a couple of computers on the first floor with free internet access which was another plus but as they were free there was frequently a bit of a wait to get on. Not the most fabulous place but nice and clean enough that you're not skeeved out .

Reviews.Title: “Best Avoided”
Reviews.Author: tim2788
Reviews.Content: Despite alot of negative feedback me and my friend stayed here for 2 nights in July 2007. First of all if you are offered the chance to stay in the 'Apartments' (for want of a better word) then decline them, We were offered them and the way the staff speak it sounds like this is an upgrade, it is far from it. The apartments are small, shabby and dont look safe at all. We changed rooms and the room was average, although I have stayed in better rooms in Best Western hotels before. The main bugbear was that there was no mini bar. When we were at reception we overheard a couple who had had their bags stolen including credit cards etc just moments before we arived, For this reason we used the safe in the room and to be safe put the sign on the door so that the rooms wernt cleaned. A small price to bay for the safety of our belongings. To be fair the hotel lobby and bar looked quite posh and the concierge was happy to help. But I dont reccomend this hotel, there are probably better ones for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Could have felt safer..”
Reviews.Author: mwc88
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend of mine stayed in this hotel during July 07 and it isn't as bad as some make out. When we told the receptionist that we had reservation, she offered an apartment for free, so we accepted. The apartment was a 2 minute walk round the corner and was like some sort of youth hostel, so we asked for a room back in the hotel and they did it, but there was a couple there whose luggage was robbed whilst they were waiting to check in. We used the free safes in the room to prevent any theft and the hotel was clean and comfortable and quite central. I can see why some people have had bad experiences though.

Reviews.Title: “no problems at all with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wandawoobucks
Reviews.Content: we had no smoking rooms on 5th floor, they did look out over the rooms opposite but we were only there one night & there was no outside noises The rooms were on the small side especially the single one which had a double bed but had everything one could need for a weekend break,the bed was the most comfortable ever! Hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff helpful. The location is ideal,just two metro stops from Central Station or tram stops nearby. We didn't think the breakfast could be worth 16e each so we went to a big supermarket near the Rijksmuseum and sat in the park with some croissants and fruit salad - cost 16e for 3 of us. We would stay there again and recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Queens day bargain ”
Reviews.Author: SHFT54
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights. The room was small, but we're used to that having traveled to Europe many times. The room clean and centrally located, nothing took more than twenty minutes to walk to. Matresses were very cozy considering the rating this hotel got. I was very pleased with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: SauliusAd
Reviews.Content: Our company had three rooms for the weekend. Only one rooom had outside window, but was extremely small, under 10 sq. meters. Another two were bit biger, but dark, with windows facing not real outside, but kind of saft, opposite wall not further than 2 meters. Breakfast was very average, no vegetables, only some fruit. It's worth to book only for significantly reduced price, not for full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Perdido
Reviews.Content: Check in staff was rude. Got a better rate and tried to charge old rate. They had a chip on their shoulder and were snippy. Tried to put luggage in holding area and he said "I'll be there later" I waited 10 minutes. The hotel is old and dumpy compared to other Best Westerns in other countries such as Australia, Italy, Greece and the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket!”
Reviews.Author: 2Sweeties
Reviews.Content: A three day break in Amsterdam is what our family wanted, and staying at the Best Western Eden Hotel fitted the bill perfectly. It is located centrally right on the Amstel, in close proximity to all the major tourist attractions such as Dam Square, Opera House, Museums, Anne Frank's house etc; perfect for getting around Amsterdam by foot. The hotel itself is more than adequately comfortable, clean, and well presented. I have read reviews that staff are rude, but all we found was civility and efficiency. We had to wait till 3 pm to get into our room, but were allowed to check in and directed to an overhelpful concierge's desk who stored our cases (and also again on leaving), and gave us advice on travel, atarctions etc; Spacious modern rooms with excellent bathroom and shower, tea and coffee facilities. The breakfasts were 16 Euro's, but were very good, with plenty of choice and steaming hot coffee on the go constantly - just what you need to set you up for walking around Amsterdam. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on an Amsterdam break, or business trip. Can I also recommend two excellent restaurants in close proximity to the Eden where we enjoyed great meals and service. The Avram Grill Argentinjs is a family run steak house where we had gorgeous steaks and superb fries. It is on Waterlooplein, turn right out of the hotel, hit the bridge and cross over, where it is on the right hand side. Also the Indrapura Indonesian Restaurant on Rebrandtplein, where the Rijsttafel (Dutch for Rice Plate) was simply outstanding. Not cheap, but definitely worth it. Turn left out of the hotel, down the second alley on the left onto Rembrantplein where you will find it across the square.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel before I was really pleased to see a major refurbishment programme in place. I had a brand new room which was excellent. Plasma TV and lovely bathroom. The reception is now modern and bright. All the staff were excellent, helpful and friendly. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves!”
Reviews.Author: jemmaj090586
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of leaving my watch at the side of my bed. I went to wear it that same night, and noticed it had gone. I informed the supervisor, and said that it had gone. She said that she would have a word with the cleaners the next day, as they were not there until the morning. The next day came and the cleaner knocked on our door to clean the room. I asked her if she'd cleaned the room the previous day, and said that a watch had gone from the room. She didn't seem to know what a watch was, so I pointed to my wrist, and she replied 'no'. She said that she would go and get her supervisor, and walked off. The supervisor never came, so either she wasn't bothered, or the cleaner wanted to make a quick escape. We went down to the reception, and asked if the watch had been found, the receptionist told us to take a seat while she went and got the supervisor. We waited for 15 minutes. She eventually came, and said that the cleaner was one of the best, and that she had said the room was a mess, and that it might have got lost in my belongings. The room wasn't a mess, I had a abit of make-up on the dressing table. I said that I had checked my belongings numerous times, as you would before you go making accusations. She replied by saying, that if we find it, we will send you it in the post. She wasn't at all apologetic, she seemed to be blaming us! I didn't go to the police, as it was out last day, and I didn't want anything else spoiling our holiday, which I regret. If you are planning on staying at this hotel, beware of the cleaners, and anyone else who has a key to your room, 'they can't be trusted!!!!'Next time I go on holiday, I shall be packing everything I own into my suitcase everytime I step outside of the room, and will have a giant padlock on it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Apeldoorn555
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Me and my husband love the new decorated rooms and reception. The location is excellent, everything is within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and did everything to make us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go There!”
Reviews.Author: Irma1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and what an unpleasant experience it was! Room number 39. To be avoided at all costs. Small room, very dark due to tiny window in far corner. Room situated next door to staff room so they would congregate outside our window smoking and chatting on and off from 6AM, therefore we had to keep curtain closed all the time, anyway. Adjoining door outside our room leading to the hotel lobby was continually being opened and closed by staff as they made their way from staffroom into hotel proper. Door not a gradual closing door, rather, it slammed, which we again were subjected to from around 6AM. On asking to move rooms I was told most of the rooms were the same, but if I wanted a better one this would cost extra money each night. Great location, but terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, ear plugs are needed”
Reviews.Author: Malla73
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is good, at the opposite of The Artis Zoo. Neighbourhood is safe and there are no noisy bars or nightclubs near. But the room lets all the possible noises in, so it's really difficult to sleep if you have no ear plugs. You can hear clearly all the steps and talking outside and inside the hotel. At least in our room, at the ground floor. Maybe it's better in the upper floors... The room and bathroom are quite small, but there was enough room at least for two normal-sized ladies. There is internet at the lobby (5â‚¬/15min). Free sweets and apples at the reception. You can buy soft drinks, water and juice with coins, but it's quite expensive (water 3â‚¬ / half liter), so I recommend buying them at the supermarket before coming to the hotel (we found no supermarkets near the hotel). We did not eat breakfast at the hotel (15â‚¬). It's only a few minutes walk to other places where they sell breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: mayoleine
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western Eden Hotel in April 2007. We were very lucky because my husband and I got a brand new renovated room at the backside of the hotel. The decoration of the hotelroom as well as the lobby area is very nice. It looks very modern, and the beds are great! Our room had airconditioning and coffee and tea making facilities....great! The location of the hotel is perfect! The staff was very helpfull explaining us what to do in Amsterdam. I would recommend this hotel to everybody who is looking for a city centre location in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PrincessBex78
Reviews.Content: The best western is right on the Amstel opposite the opera house. It is in walking distance of every attracion. We didnt take any other transport. From Amsterdam Centraal station it is a straight walk up the Damrak about 15 mins. The bar/reception area is very nicely decorated and the staff are welcomin. We arrived at 11.30 am and went ot eh desk to check in and were surprised to be given our room key as check isnt until 3pm. The corridors leading to the rooms are very dark and dingy but your not in them long! When we open the door to the room it was VERy apparent that it hadnt been cleaned since the provious pccupants left. Bed was dirty and unmade and there was a lot of brokne glass on the floor of the bathroom. I called recpetion immediatly and they said they would get on to it. We left our luggage and went out to see th sights. When we retuened the room was clean and presnetable. Not a great start but didnt spoil the trip. Thr room (508) was small but it had everyhting you need for a city break. Bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom! The concierge was very helpful and stored our lugagge for us the next day. Over all for a city break hotel it does the job. I paid 99 euros plus 4 euros tourist tax and i wouldnt say it was worth any more than that! and one last thing dont pay for hotel breakfasts unless they are included. there are LOADS of cafes that will do one for half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pien98
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in the heart of the city. I think that the picturesof the hotel are old on the sites. The receptionist informed me that the hotel has had a complete renovation. The rooms are very nice and with airconditioning. If you go to Amsterdam, book the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Almost ruined our trip”
Reviews.Author: AngiAngel2
Reviews.Content: You may have read our family's previous entry "Saved my life!" We had stayed at this hotel last summer for 3 nights and they were absolutely wonderful to us! We had booked a stay at a different hotel that turned out to be AWFUL. The staff was very friendly and accomodated us by offering one of the apartment style rooms for the double bed room price. We absolutely loved it so much that upon visiting this year, we wouldn't have thought twice about staying anywhere else. The same family of four that had stayed there one year ago was going back and wanted to stay again. My dad contacted the hotel directly via e-mail saying how wonderful it was and even requested the same room for his family of four we had previously (told the entire story). They had responded telling us it was no problem, confirmed the reservation w/ a credit card number, no sweat. Upon arriving in A'dam after the long flight at 7:30 a.m. the reception staff informed us that our reservation was for one person and that there's no way a family of four can stay in the apartments. They woudln't listen to any of what we had to say (though we had been there and stayed there, as a family of four less than a year ago). They told us they've never let a family of four stay in their apartments. They then proceeded to talk very in a very rude tone to each other about us. What's worse is they wouldn't give us our money back! They only offered two double rooms (TWICE the amount of money). After an hour of arguing with us, they finally agreed to refund our money and offered no help whatsoever in finding another place to stay. The only good part of this hotel is the concierge staff who were extremely helpful in recommending hotels and even offered their cellphone for us to use to find somewhere to stay. This was by far the worst hotel experience I've ever had and would highly recommend you find somewhere else to stay! It's not worth traveling that far to find out you don't have a place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MeathJohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights, Easter weekend, we were not sure what to expect with the mixed reviews, the location is excellent , just around the corner from rembrandt square with the 4 or 9 tram going to central station, canal cruise just a few mins walk left of the hotel, flower market is less than 5 mins walk, dam square is about 15 mins walk but plenty of trams if preferred, Red Light is about 10 mins. Lots of restaurants and bars on Rembrandt square, El Torado Argentinan steak house off the square is excellent. Some confusion at check in but sorted out in a few minutes, staff were not very friendly, somewhat short but that did not bother us. Room 105 was excellent, newly refurbished, very comfortable bed, lcd tv, tea/coffee, great shower, although the window would not open and the newly installed air conditioning system was not working yet, room at the back of the hotel, very quiet, no noise at night. Did not eat/drink here, so many options near, would stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, despite disruption because of modernising it.”
Reviews.Author: debbiegratton
Reviews.Content: We were worried about staying in this hotel because of previous reviews. We caught a taxi to the hotel, and nearly died when we realised that the front of the hotel was boarded up!! we thought it had closed down, but we had to use the back entrance, through another posh hotel to access this one. We tried to be healthy and used the stairs to our room everyday, but there was very limited lighting on the stairs, and they are very steep! but you could always use the lift!!! Our room had been recently modernised, and it was lovely!! lots of lighting and the bathroom was gorgeous! The room was quit spacious too. we didnt have a view out of our room, but that didnt bother us. The beds are very comfy too!! The hotel is opposite the river, and in a great location generally. we had lots of beers and walks. There are some lovely restaurants nearby as well. We hired bikes for two days from MacBikes. It is so easy to do and doesnt cost much. The bike shop is about a ten minute walk away. There are bike paths everywhere. We cycled along the river out of the city on one day, into the counyryside. We would definately recommend not to hire bikes for longer than two days. we had awful saddle sore, and it makes you feel miserable!! We also visited Van Gogh museum and the Botanical Gardens, which were really nice. The Flower Market is just down the road and is worth a visit. We had a lovely holiday, and the weather was great, which was a bonus too!!! Would recommend this hotel, especially with the refirbishment which has only just occurred in the last week. Happy hols!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position- most unhelpfull staff ever known.”
Reviews.Author: teammoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently situated on the river and close to Rembrandt Sq. The room was OK -stank from smoke though (seems only 1 floor is non-smoking). The big problem was the staff. At check in we were bumped down from a double room to a twin without being asked or told. We had a number of other problems that the staff just would not sort out and were in fact dismissive. Not the attitude expected from a hotel at this price (or any price). I will NOT return here.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: Pre_kids_traveller
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to go to this hotel after reading some of the reviews posted prior to mine- but I was plesantly surprised! Our room was clean, huge, and had a magnificant view of the canals that was pretty both in the daytime and at night. The beds were so comfortable too- hard to get out of in the morning. The location is great- right buy the flower market and walking distance to everything. We didn't take transit at all! I would without a doubt go back to this hotel the next time I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Bombex
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we were a bit nervous about this hotel however we had a fantastic time here. On our arrival we were greeted by a clean and modern looking hotel ( No sign saying Best Western so may have changed ownweship to Eden Group) . The roomn was ready from 3pm but they looked after our bags free of charge. The staff were helpful and courteous especially when we requested a kettle its seems you may need to ask for this. ( Small cups you may like to take your own) . As for the room, Small bathroom however water hot and excellent shower. We were on the 4th floor overlooking the park and it was quietish with the windows shut at night. The room although small boasted an interactive TV whicvh you could watch CNN news BBC1 / BBC2 and various local stations. For the money we paid it was excellent. If you come out of hotel and turn left there is an excellent Indonesion restaurant on the corner of the block and a nice pub few doors down. Take a number 9 from central station keep checking the stops and get out at Plantage Middenlaan. If you go past the zoo and two huge dinosaur statues on the left you have gone too far. Just a short walk from hotel is fantastic market Waterlooplein ( not open Sundays) We also highly recomend Pizza Cruise which was yummy and all drinks inclouded. There is a voucher with the canal bus. Make sure your hungry before boarding. Lastly we have to recomend the Electric Ladyland museum. Its not too easy to find costs 5 euros . 1st Museum of florescent art 2e Leliedwarsstraat 5 420-3776 . Nick who runs it took 7 years to create his cave in the basement. Hes a fabulous old American hippy ( no point getting there before 12am! He has created a facinating museum albeit very small ( one room) he loves his stuff and is well worth meeting. He also creates wonderful art which you can buy. Have fun we did!!

Reviews.Title: “No problem with the room.”
Reviews.Author: EGMitch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for a young couple on a modest budget. It was clean, comfortable and convenient. The hotel staff was not overly friendly, but they took care of all our requests. The room is small, but cozy, comfy bed and just fine for 2 ppl. The bathroom was TINY, but it kept us clean. The zoo is across the road and made for a nice half-day and there are a few little restaurants in the area. Honorable mention goes to Cafe Palorma, a inexpensive AND tasty Italian restaurant. Also check out the restaurant across from the zoo, it was great for breakfast. All in all, good hotel for the price, in a nice quiet area, tram stop right nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: shankar1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. the location was great as it is a hop, skip and a jump from Rembrandt Square. Our room view consisted of a brick wall from the adjacent tower of the hotel. The hotel is in front of the many canals meandering through the city. Lots of restaraunts, coffee shops and tourist shopping nearby. All in all it was just a place to rest our heads while sight seeing Amsterdam. I would probably stay some place else the next time i visit though.

Reviews.Title: “Get it in writing!”
Reviews.Author: SFLO75009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January as part of a company trip. As a budget hotel in Amsterdam, there isn't much to complain about. It is basic, noisy and none too clean. But the price and location is great - our room even had a canal view and street noise wasn't that bad (the noise from the other rooms was, unfortunately). That said, the staff are terrible. We arranged for late check-out on our last day (paying extra for it), an order that apparently never reached the cleaning staff, who started banging on the door early that morning. After several through-the-door conversations, the maid actually walked in on us naked. Our calls to the front desk only resulted in the manager visiting to demand why we hadn't left. You get what you pay for, but make sure you actually GET what you PAY for here; they aren't very nice at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Me22NorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: Was recommended this hotel by hotelsrus after my choice was not available at that time. Great Hotel, clean lobby, friendly staff, great river view room, comfortable double bed, TV, Hairdryer, table, 2 chairs, shower over bath, wash basin and toilet. Clean!!!!! Buffet style breakfast was included in our stay which consisted of selection of cereals, toast, all kinds of preserves, English tea and various other variaties of herbal tea, scrambled egg, sausages, bacon, cheese, ham, fresh croissants, rolls etc etc. Great way to start the day before your sight seeing. Good location, within walking distance to centre although tram lines behind hotel approx 1 min walk. We walked miles getting lost in and out, up and down all the side streets. Shopping quite expensive except for usual souvenir type items, although if you explore as much as we did you are bound to find a bargain or two!! Would recommend to anyone. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not fancy”
Reviews.Author: LeeDixonChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, good location, close to things we wanted to see. One drawback is that there are a few nightclubs on the same street so you will hear some revelers if your room faces the street. We did not get the breakfast, as I recall it was 16 euros. Room was fine and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: pinkglitterprincess
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a quick visit to Amsterdam. Right in the city centre, easy walking distance to all the sights and shops. Plus a tram stop on the corner if you didnt want to walk. The hotel itself isn't the ritz, but the beds are comfy and its pretty central. Perfect for a cheap and easy base.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Genes
Reviews.Content: Well, we were also amongst those who were completely discouraged by the prior comments about the Best Westerd Eden Amsterdam Hotel on Tripadvisor. However, we have been positively suprised by the rooms & wc's which were big enough and clean. However, the lighting inside the room was poor and they could seriously do something about the sound insulation problem as it was clearly a minus.(though it was not so much disturbing as we thought it would be) On top of that the hotel was, yes, very central and the reception desk people did not give us any hard time. As there are thousands of cafes around in the city of Amsterdam, we preferred to skip the breakfast in the hotel. I'd say, one would not be so much dissapointed from a 3 Star hotel like B.Western Eden.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not worth full price”
Reviews.Author: Craigeryvr
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget, don't want the red light district and can get a room at a reduced rate, I paid 65 Euros a night, this is an okay choice. I would not pay full rate. Sure the rooms are small, but clean, and the breakfast is not worth the 15 Euros they charge, but you are staying in a great location on one of the main canals, 2 mins from the subway, and steps from Rembrantsplein. I got four different answers from four different staff about why wireless internet wouldn't work in the hotel until the concierge told me to use the network in the hotel next door.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: englander1966
Reviews.Content: Never book this hotel. It is the absolute pits and then some.

Reviews.Title: “A lilltle tierd”
Reviews.Author: MPOV
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this staying at this hotel 9 - 12 Nov 06. After reading the reviews i was a little worried. The staff were friendly, the hotel could do with a bit of a makeover. However,the rooms were clean & the lobby toilets were the best i came across in Amsterdam. Hotel is in an ideal location for exploring the city. The price we paid seemed to be average for a three star, I certainly would not stay in less than a 3* there. They do a great breakfast at the Irish bar just behind the hotel in the square.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviewers made out”
Reviews.Author: Dramateacher
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews on this website, I felt wary about being booked into the Eden hotel. I was expecting a filthy, noisy place with rude and arrogant staff. It may be the fact that my stay in Amsterdam was a competition win, and therefore I did not pay a penny for it, but I really did not find the Eden hotel that bad. Admittedly, we had to wait several times to be served at the check in desk as there were only ever 2 staff on, but they were friendly and always apologised for the delays. The concierge was also very helpful. The location of the hotel is fantastic - just around the corner from Rembrandtsplein, and a short walk to everywhere else. If walking is not your thing, the bus and tram stops are abundant and everything is easily accessible. Noise at the hotel was simply not an issue - this was probably because our room was on the inside of the building rather than overlooking the street. This meant our view from the window was of a brick wall - but I didn't go to Amsterdam to stare out of my window! The room could have been bigger, and the bathroom was just tiny! It meant a serious case of manoevuring around the toilet to get into the shower, but it was clean. The windows in the room would not open, which I found very odd, but the air conditioning unit worked so I don't suppose it mattered much. I had to request the tea and coffee making facilities, and the concierge brought me a tray with a kettle and plastic cups on, and they were a little stingy with the amount of coffee & tea provided. However they did produce more on request. Breakfast was plentiful - a large variety of breads, cheeses, meats, eggs, bacon, jams, cereals, fruit and yoghurt, as well as fruit juices, tea and coffee. The bar area, 'Garden of Eden' was also quite nice, overlooking the river, and the barman friendly. Overall, the hotel is in a good location, but is of average standard. If you are looking for somewhere more luxurious to relax in then Eden is not for you, but if it is simply somewhere to sleep and eat breakfast then go ahead as the location is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable choice”
Reviews.Author: Bilgen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Best Western Eden Hotel for 4 days. My husband and I generally would like to stay in 3 stars hotels in city center. I can honestly say that this hotel was the best in this category among the ones that we have ever stayed . It in near the Amstel river. A room by the river side is possible if you are willing to pay an extra 20â‚¬. But I do not think that it is necessary because you will be full of river views during your vsit in Amsterdam. Our room was quite large with a table and another single bed. Do not expect a very new room with new furnitures but having a large room is satisfactory enough for me after dark and narrow room in Barcelona. The most beautiful thing was the breakfast. There is an amazing breakfast that you can enjoy. Plus the staff of the hotel are very friendly. I can recommend this hotel with contentment.

Reviews.Title: “Book with caution”
Reviews.Author: OKAussie
Reviews.Content: On arrival, the reception staff hampered our check in at every turn. They queried our pre-payment claiming it was merely a deposit. Fortunately I had full documention which again they tried to query with other staff members. Snappy & argumentative would be an accurate description of a couple of reception staff. Avoid them like the plague. Future contacts were carefully chosen for advise & were much better. The room was average but cleanish, quiet & adequate but small. Fortunately we only spent one night here as any more could be challenging as far as space goes. If you are alone it would be adequate. Its well located, tv worked, porter was very helpful & our check-out lady was a dream by comparison to the initial experience. If you are able, try somewhere else - the staff are a little scarey when you're looking for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location but be very cautious....”
Reviews.Author: SuperStu
Reviews.Content: Great location 5*! Looks OK from front door to reception but.... check-in and step through the swipe card door entry (required to operate lift also) and you step into a 1* establishment that smells and has threadbare carpets. The standard room we had booked was not ready by 4pm (should have been available from 3pm) and an alternative was offered. Room 307 (and I suspect others) was awful - 1* is generous. Our bathroom smelled of stale urine. We complained and were offered a superior room at no extra charge. Better - now 2* (it had a great view over the Amstel). BUT REMEMBER location is very good and price was fair if booked in adsvance - just don't expect 3*

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: neme06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and while the location, staff and breakfast were (mostly) fantastic, I think we'd look elsewhere next time if we were staying more than one night. Our room was large (by European standards) but incredibly hot. No air-con, just two stand-fans that we had to have on constantly. It really was like a sauna and it would be absolutely unbearable in summer. While we heard nothing from the street, we heard everything from inside the hotel because the walls are so thin and the doors don't close properly so all night and day you hear the constant banging of people trying to shut their doors or thundering down the stairs because the lift takes forever. Oh, and the lighting! I don't know if they were trying to save electricity or something, but our room was so dark. The light bulbs were obviously the lowest wattage, which made it really annoying if you wanted to read. The only way to get some "natural" light was to open the curtains which revealed the corridor to everyone else's room, so they could all watch you as well. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Tiger
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Eden hotel on Amstel, is in my opinion a good hotel. The receptionist was polite, efficient and helpful. The same can be said of the concierge. Our double room was comfortable, clean and equipped with modern furnishings. Itâ€™s true that the rooms are not the largest, but this is Amsterdam, not The USA, and letâ€™s face it, you donâ€™t go to Amsterdam to stay in your hotel room! The Eden is in a good quiet location and an easy walk to Spui, Dam etc. If you take a tram from Centraal station, thereâ€™s a tram stop in Rembrandtplein. This is a short walk, but if you have more than 1 suitcase, it could present a minor challenge. We only had the one case on wheels so it was not a problem at all. At 150 Euro a night, you do pay a slight premium because of the location, but I think it was worth it. Take a peek in The Monopole as you pass, and youâ€™ll see why The Eden charges more! Both myself and my wife enjoyed our stay here, and would have no hesitation in making further bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: trayloua
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my partner for his birthday back in March 2006. The hotel upon check in demanded that we pay for our stay up front and that we give a security deposit also!! This I found highly unusual as I worked for Best Western here in Dublin and have never requested a security deposit from anyone and have never asked for payment up front off of guests who originally booked by credit card! I was very insulted by this in all honesty. I queried the receptionist on this (who was very very rude) and was passed from Bill to Jack until finally told I had no choice but to pay everything deposit and all up front. Eventually when we got to our room it was damp musty and had no extras to speak of (no trouser press, kettle etc etc) we proceeded out to have a look around and did find a lovely square (Rembrandt) just beside the hotel (right as you walk out and right at the souvenir shop) here we found a lovely Irish bar (The gate) and some lovely cafes and restaurants. After a long flight and night I wanted a good nightâ€™s sleep but I didnâ€™t get this as we were right beside the road and all I heard all night were cars music and noise in general. I requested a room change but was told the only room left was the one above ours which I knew would not have been much quieter. The bar closed at 1:30am which is very early for a residents bar. The hotel location is lovely being right on the canal but it is far away from the main train station and square. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend, not if I want to keep them that way!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel if you want a twin room”
Reviews.Author: Motspur
Reviews.Content: The twin room that I booked did indeed have two beds, however they were wedged into a fixed headboard that did not allow they to be separated. When raising this with reception I was told that this was normal for twin rooms, in all hotels, and that I must be mistaken in my belief that the beds should be separate. The receptionist also seemd to think that the situation was highly amusing and was extreamly patronising. To add the the problem the beds were extreamly narrow so it was impossible not to roll into the person in the other bed in your sleep. Whilst this hotel in in a great location it is run dowm and the staff need a few lessons in good custmer service.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hoschi
Reviews.Content: We, 3 friends of mine and i stay in the Eden for 3 Nights. We payed â‚¬ 140.00 per night: Dirty rooms, bad furniture, lights did not work, bathrooms had all time a bad smell. As we go to the reception to ask for a room change the women only say "you can be happy that you have a room in Amsterdam, and we not like to move you in another rooms, that will be too much word for the maids!" I am myself a worker in a Hotel but i were really shoked about the way they treat us and the other clients. As well i try to use the internet terminal of the hotel to buy a trin ticket for the deutsche bahn. i got a Internetpass by around Euro 10.00 as i acess to the internet, the deutshce bahn (train company) was blocked. A other worker of the Hotel say only "this is not our problem" as i ask to get my money back, bec. i canÂ´t use the internet for what i need, i got the answer "you can surf in the internet, this is what you pay for"!!!!!! We will never book again this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment - Do not expect Best Western Quality”
Reviews.Author: chrisjon2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Eden for two nights. There were a couple of bad things and a couple of good things... Negatives: We did not know there was not air conditioning or windows that opened enough to catch a breeze. When we arrived we found a long line at the check in counter. The woman who helped us was brief, but not rude. She quickly processed our information and then gave us room 037. We asked her which direction we needed to go in and she ended up pointing us in the wrong direction. When we finally got to our room we just wanted to sit down and relax for a few minutes. The room was very warm. No AC, just a small fan. (thank goodness for the fan though). The hotel is very 1970's. We live in Germany right now and have stayed in many European hotels. This was one of the worst so far. The room was little. Instead of a king, queen or two twin beds we were given a full size bed. With it being so stinking warm in the room the tight fit on the bed did not help. The room had a small desk, table and two chair, and a small wardrobe that would hang around 10 items. There is not a fridge, microwave or anything special about these rooms. The bed was kind of squishy, it could have been firmer. There were several stains on the floor. Breakfast was terrible. I over heard a staff member tell a guest that breakfast was 15E if it was not included with your room. It was not worth 2E. I am very familar with the European breakfasts of meat, cheese and bread. The selection was terrible. There was two choices of meat and two kinds of cheese. They looked like they had been sitting out for hours. They had a crazy attempt at scrambled eggs. It looked more like egg soup. There was so much water in the dish that they egg curds were floating. Yuk. The selection really was not that great. I would have preferred to have found something out in the town. The shower kept going from hot to cold. We would get it perfect and then have to change it again because the water would go really hot or really cold. Positives: The location is good. We were far enough away from the crowds that we were never really disturbed by other people. We were also very close to the Tram stop at the Rembrantplein. Maybe a 5 minute walk away. There are several restaurants and bars in this area. We found a wonderful Japanese place and had dinner there both nights. The hours for the breakfast were nice (even though the food was gross). They open for breakfast around 0700-1030. It is served buffet style in a large(ish) dinning room. The pillows in the room were pretty nice. We slept really well both nights. Usually hotel pillows are a little iffy. Top hotels have nice ones and the crappy hotels have the squishy ones that you have to fold 4 times to sleep good. This was not the case. I liked the pillows. The bathroom was simple with only a soap dispenser hanging to give soap and shampoo. No little bottles or extras to take home. They had a blow drier for guests and it was decent. Advice: If you are just looking for a cheap place to stay and do not expect ANY frills or perks this might be okay. Otherwise pick somewhere that you will not mind spending a rainy day in. Find a local baker or something and have breakfast there. The food is not worth the extra money paid or the time you spend. I hope this helps. If you have any questions please feel free to send me a note.

Reviews.Title: “All bad reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: nataliaNJ
Reviews.Content: We had one week planning before coming to Amsterdam in the beginning of June. All hotels and apartments were booked and this place was the only option which was in the city center and decently priced, although still in the $100-200 range. We went with very low expectations and every single one of them was met. We laughed at the stained, cigarrete burnt carpet in our room. The whole in the wall where the telephone line outlet supposed to be mounted was histerical. The receptionist's comment "What do you want, we are a 3-star hotel" was very cute. We could hear all the party people coming back from the Rembrant's Plein at night. The location is great, but don't stay if you have other options.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice place at all. Not your normal Best Western”
Reviews.Author: derekfap
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews before of people complaining about no air conditioning, and I thought, "what's the big deal? It's Europe, it's not that bad." Well, let me tell you, it IS a BIG deal! If you are going here during the warm season, do yourself a big favor, and DON'T stay here. It is at least 10 degrees warmer in your room than outside. The fan they gave us didn't work. The room had window view of a block wall 5 ft away. We also had tons of flies in our room, and a few bugs in the bed. We didn't think they were "bed bugs", but I'm not sure. If you want a nice hotel, try the Barbizon Palace. I stayed there last year and it is about 1000 times better than this hell hole. I will definitely not ever stay here again. One thing in their defense, is that the staff knew their hotel is really bad, and kept telling me that they're sorry, and that they will be completely remodeling everything this coming year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & tidy”
Reviews.Author: TAFFTAYLOR
Reviews.Content: August 3/4 2006 United football fan Just returned from watching the amsterdam football tournement. Booked the hotel over the net before we had read the reviews(some good & some bad) 1st the hotel is in a great location. very close to rembrandt square but not to close to get all the noise. Hotel is very close to tram service & metro service whch get you to all the relevant sites Rooms are fairly big & are very clean Bathroom very clean Hotel satff from reception/concierge very helpful & polite

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment for the brand.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked over the internet relying on the brand name of Best Western. I thought they would provide basic but good value accommodation.. I was sady disappointed. A small, shabby, cramped, dark room, without air-conditioning and not suitable for two guests. The wardrobe fell apart and the bathroom had no extractor fan so became extremely unpleasant to enter.

Reviews.Title: “Rembrandtplein district hotel”
Reviews.Author: rustermans
Reviews.Content: June 2006. I had an attractive modern room fronting on the canal. Unfortunately the air conditioing was not hooked up, and when the windows were opened, it was noisy and let in a lot of flies. Service was erratic --- often frustratingly slow at the reception desk, but a very good daytime concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadgeM
Reviews.Content: This being my second visit to the Eden Hotel, I have no complaints. Its not the ritz, but its clean, tidy and quite confortable. For the price, its brilliant. And the location is just perfect, your in walking distance to the main attractions. In terms of the hotel room, it was an average size, with air conditioning, the bathroom was big enough, everything was very clean and sure thats all you want. The only think I would have fault with, is the restaurnat, you'd be better off getting a meal up town instead of paying for their set menu, the starter is fab, the main course is poor and mean and the desert is only okay. Other that that, its great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but just don't get an overflow room”
Reviews.Author: Oreocookie
Reviews.Content: After a night in a truly awful hotel we saught refuge at Hotel Eden. We had walked past it and had stayed at Best Western's before. They were almost sold out, but did have a room (room #117) that they offered us for $200 a night in US dollars. We assumed it would be one of their standard rooms. We got to the room and it turned out that it was an overflow room (this was later confirmed by hotel staff). It was very tired and the window overlooked a brick wall. The bathroom was better than our last hotel, but our toliet smelled like sewer and that was truly disgusting. We had to brush our teeth outside the bathroom because of the smell. We had to hold our breath while using the toliet. We didn't tell the staff about it until checking out..which was dumb because they might have been able to rectify the problem. The size of the room was fine and it was clean (most important to me). It was just tired and looked like it hadn't been updated in 10 years. The wing we were in (rooms in the 100's) were the overflow rooms so I guess that was to be expected. However we felt like we should have been told that when checking in. Breakfast was not included, and we felt like we should be getting more for $200 a night. The location was fantastic however. Right around the corner from Remblantsplein, and a very easy walk to everything else in the city. The canal that the hotel sits on is very pretty and if we had a room overlooking the canal vs. a brick wall we probably would have felt much different about the room and not minded that it was tired. The staff was nice, and we asked the conceirge for advice on what canal tour to do. The location of all the Remblantspelin restaurants 1 minute away was nice. I would stay here again if I was assured that I wasn't going to have an overflow room in the overflow wing.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good size room, fairly clean and right in the center of the city and walking distance to all museums, red light, etc. Great Location.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel - well located”
Reviews.Author: frankrub
Reviews.Content: We had read terrible reviews about this hotel but, upon arriving, we were pleasantly surprised. We did not experience a noise problem. The rooms were small and were not updated but were clean. The bathrooms were large, clean with unusually hot water (be careful !!). The hotel was well located. The staff was accommodating and informative. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the rest!”
Reviews.Author: BlondePond
Reviews.Content: Arrived to a room with a very small window, impossible to read a book even WITH THE LIGHTS ON! Asked for a change, which was given readily, helpful staff at Reception. New room was through a rabbit warren of corridors, looking out onto some side street, but looked ok, went out for the evening. Returned at 1.00am to a VERY NOISY queue of clubbers queueing in the street under my bedroom window. Boom boom garage/techno music coming through walls. Asked for another change of room which was given after quite a long wait, onto the canal at the front (supposed to be superior rooms - yeah, right! NOT.) All bedrooms VERY basic, but clean. Bathrooms clean but tiny. Would NOT stay there again due to noise/disturbance problems, but the location was very handy for the flower market, Rembrandt museum, opera house., etc. Didn't know it was in the gay district, before we stayed, but wouldn't have any complaints about that anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: charliexx
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the hotel was basic but as always, you get what you pay for. Breakfast was expensive but there are good cafees in the area. I wouldnt mind staying there again if I got a good rate

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by other reviews”
Reviews.Author: MandyPlymouthEngland
Reviews.Content: Although our room was VERY basic but it was clean - we were more than happy with the reception, bar and staff who were extremely friendly and helpful, making us feel very welcome. The breakfast was very good - unlimited buffet style & plenty of choice continental style with cold meats and cheeses & also scrambled eggs & bacon or sausages. Great location - the square behind the hotel had a great choice of bars and resturants - the Australian bar had a great menu and happy hour for cocktails. Enjoy your stay - we would be happy to return there - just don't expect too much from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Western Eden Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Gemzy1011
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance spent 3 nights at this dreadful hotel in Feb 2006, it was our first visit to Amsterdam and meant to be a break with a difference away from the children..... A DIFFERENCE IS WHAT WE GOT!!!! Amsterdam itself was lovely, a great experience if you've never been and i'd highly recommend it, as for the hotel.. where do i start?? The first room we were allocated had a view of a brick wall and was so dark with the lights off my fiance ALMOST looked like Brad Pitt, it was damp and the smell was horendous. On my request my fiance went back to reception to request a different room which i later found out cost us an additional 30euros PER NIGHT... if this was an upgrade god help the other rooms. We did have a canal view with windows but you had to be on your knees to see out of them. The bathroom was probably about the best thing in the room, the bed was ok but the sheets & covers looked horrible... also if you like your sleep don't expect to get much, we heard ALL of our neighbours antics from bedroom to toilet the walls were that thin!!!! We are not a couple to complain but this hotel definatley does not score in our books!! DEFINATLEY NOT A 3* HOTEL THIS WAS THE PITTS!!!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: wareto
Reviews.Content: On the day of leaving for this hotel I read some horrendous reviews on this site and found previous visitors recommending not to stay there! This caused our party to expect the worst when arriving late in the evening. However, the staff on arrival were helpful and pleasant. The rooms average, but were clean with the bedlinen white and crisp. It was cleaned every day to the expected standard. Our room was at the rear of the hotel which we later found looks down onto the doorway of a night club, which opens late in the evening, however the double glazing keeps out most of the noise. Make sure you close the windows properly as when we didnt, it came open at about 3am and the room was shaking!!! Never saw any mice in the restaurant and the breakfast was great. Excellent location and the hotel helped to make our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobmac
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to AMS,but not to Europe,so am aware of ratings.This hotel was clean,the staff was more than helpful.The location can not be beat.The hallways looked a bit well used but our room which overlooked the canal was up todate and a good size for a 3star European hotel.I hope when they open up their new place around the corner ,they keep this as the view is fantastic,we booked this several months in advance and had a good rate from BW and we had to pay 20euro extra for the view but for us its worth it. We did not eat at the restaurant but the staff suggested nearby restaurants which were excellent.The bar staff very kindly opened our self bought wine bottles which we consumed in our room and in fact told us where to buy them and beer which the beer, at least they sold in vending machines but suggested we but it elsewhere for less.All in all a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wesley66
