Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 years ago and whilst I knew that the rooms can be shabby, due to the location and an excellent deal at $70 per night (inl breakfast) I thought it was worth the money. We seem to have lucked out though and got a far superior room to the one we had before (or they've just decorated!)and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. If you want an average 3* which is definitely a hotel and not a hostel, I would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “skip this place”
Reviews.Author: junebugtraveler
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at this hotel. I also stayed here Dec. 2003. In two years this place fell apart. They are building a new hotel that will face the square. They had banners that said it was to be completed in 2005 but it was far from being done. Our room for 3 people was worn out with bleach stains and holes in the carpeting. It was so dirty that we couldn't take off our shoes. The construction pounding went on all day. The walls are paper thin and we heard all the activities of the young couple next door. Didn't get much sleep that night! The breakfast went down hill too. We paid $125 usd so the price was good for Amsterdam but I wouldn't stay there again. I like the location. There are a few other hotels in the same square I will try next visit. Loved Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodation, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: katecolorado
Reviews.Content: I paid $75 a night, and could not have been happier with the location or the staff of the Best Western Eden, Amsterdam. This hotel is in walking distance to the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijksmuseum, the Anne Frank House, the train station (with light luggage). The staff was lovely and never hesitated to help with directions or general questions. After reading the many reviews about this hotel (complaints about the noise, the shabby carpet, the club next door), I was truly afraid of what I might find after booking the hotel. However, it was simply a basic room in need of a makeover, perfect and reasonably priced for the traveler who doesn't plan on staying in a hotel room all day. Sheets, towels, and bathroom were all clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eden Hotel in late November. We arrived early and went to the hotel at 7 am. Although check-in time was not until that afternoon, because the hotel was not full, they allowed us to check in immediately. After a long night of traveling, it was wonderful to be able to rest and refresh (and drop off our luggage). The location is excellent - walking distance to everything. This was our 2nd stay at the Eden - it is a clean, standard hotel but the location is great and price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Best Western?”
Reviews.Author: Kirkm
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions of this hotel from the canal or foyer are quite good. However we had a generally bad experience overall. The rooms are pretty shabby. Check-in did not register our extra night so on our last day they emptied our rooms. My colleage's stuff was saved i ntheir safe as he had his passport in there. Mine was all destroyed as far as I know! The person at the front desk was rude and did not even appologise. Thanksfully the manager did! But on all calling their staff involved their answer was just "your room was empty". Needless to say I do not recommend this hotel to anyone except lawyers or detectives who may wish to test some of their skills - or people who teach front-desk staff how to behave properly.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Eden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst 3star hotels I have ever stayed in. Wallpaper falling off , no tea and coffee unless specifically asked for, and then not refreshed the following day. Toilets and bathrooms so small that if you are on the loo you can't shut door. Towells so thin you could almost see through. The ceiling outside my friends room falling down. When we complained had to pay 20E to upgrade to a room that was little better. At least it was clean. Never up to 3star standard. Although charged at 3 star rate. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a very basic three star!”
Reviews.Author: Missfitz
Reviews.Content: The Eden is located in a lovely part of Amsterdam and the staff are friendly. However it was one of the most basic three stars I have stayed in. Small room (with tiny bathroom) overlooked a brick wall. The beds weren't made properly and the corridors really stank of smoke (there is one non-smoking floor). Also, as previous reviewer mentioned, the sound proofing is very poor - I could here the man next door coughing all night and the squeals of the girls down the corridors coming in late from clubbing. Not a place to get a good nights sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: xpis3
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at the hotel. I was attending two conferences, and the hotel was one of the conferences' choices, thus I paid less than the usual price. The room (a single room) was at the back of the hotel, it is very small, with a small window that opens to the wall of a corridor (from this corridor one can see what is going on in the room unless the curtain is drawn), so there is hardly any air in it. It was warm in Amsterdam and I needed a fan, lucky for me there was a fan in the room, probably left there by the previous occupant. The room was clean, and so was the sheets and the towels. Breakfast was not included, and as the price of it is outrageous, I did not eat breakfast at the hotel. I think that at the regular price of this hotel one can get a better one. I found the reception staff not friendly at all, uncooperative and unhelpful. The hotel has one advantage, its location on the Amstel river, opposite the Town Hall and the Opera, near Rembrandt Plein and in walking distance for most of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Conventient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hans_Staden
Reviews.Content: I had a very spacious room (although with no view at all), and although another part is currently being added to the hotel I had no problems regarding noise of the ongoing construction. The room was clean, well appointed, the breakfast buffet was copious and of good quality. The lobby is nothing to write home about, internet access absurdly overpriced, and very innocent web-sites (like the timetables of the Belgian and German Railways) are banned! Very friendly staff. Great location for everything remotely interesting in Amsterdam, and, if you don't pay the rack rate, good value.

Reviews.Title: “a far cry from what i was led to expect”
Reviews.Author: FrannieHaifa
Reviews.Content: first of all, the tiny two windows of the room overlooked the roof of the next building and offered us quite a look into its tennants' rooms (those living on lower floors). the radiator was adapted to summer time and thus didn't work to its full capacity. we requested to be given an additional heater (we came on a very rainy and cold day which is not unusual at all for the climate in holland) and the heater was brought to our room two days after we requested it and only after a few calls to the reception desk. breakfast was very poor and dull, the same kind of foods greeted us almost every morning, there was no kind of vegetables at all. one evening we returned to the room and were amazed to see that all wastebins hadn't been emptied. when we called reception and let them know, we were told that "the maid probably forgot to empty the bins". unbelievable ! we also noticed that some of the sheets had yellowish stains on them. there was no sugar or coffee available in the room. on top of everything, upon leaving the hotel' we asked the concierge to order us a taxi that will take us to the airport. he promptly did so while stating that taxi fare ranges from 35 to 40 euro and strongly suggested we should not pay a cent more. when we got to the airport, the taxi driver said that we owed him 51.90 euros and came up with a strange explanation about different taxi companies each charging its own fare. we were left with a strong feeling of being cheated both by the concierge and the taxi driver who most probably struck a deal between themselves to make a profit from us foreigners. and i haven't mentioned the noise that could be heard from the music that was being played almost all night long in the pubs that surround the hotel. and to think that we paid 1000 euros for spending 7 nights at this hotel is truly enraging. we didn't get our money's worth. simply outrageous. all this being said, i strongly recommend you stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Building works”
Reviews.Author: CRose8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing substanial building works and its noisy from 7am in the morning. There is also works going on outside in the street that will be present for a while. Our room was small and tired, it also has a few minor irritating faults. No Tea/Coffee making (unless specifically requested and then you had to balance it on a foldup chair). A shortage of plugs, to name a few. The public area's were pleaseant and the Breakfast was good value. The Hotel is well posistioned, with good transport connections. However, I would tend NOT to use this hotel until ALL the building works are complete and the rooms have been brought up to a better standard.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: xedonis
Reviews.Content: Checked in at noon and was pleasantly surprised by the room. Located on the fourth floor (room 360- lobby is floor 0) and overlooking the Amstel. The hotel is located very close to Rembrandtplein, so getting around Amsterdam is very easy- either by tram or by foot. Rembrantplein is also home to many restaurants, pubs and so on- so there isn't any need to look long for any place to eat or go out. The lobby wasn't very big- but looked pretty good considering it's a three star property. My room was a familyroom, so it was actually pretty decent sized with two large beds, a desk, table and two chairs, a tv, minisafe and a bathroom with a bathtub. No aircon, but there was two fans. However, as it was quite cold during my stay there weren't any need for the fans. There was some noise coming from the street when the window was open- but I didn't have any problems to sleep. The bed was quite comfy, and although the decor was a bit tacky it seemed pretty clean and not so worn. The corridors are however not so nice, and is in fact quite a maze. I saw that some of the rooms overlook a very small atrium- which didn't look very nice (see picture), but that didn't apply to my room luckily. I wasn't expecting much- but this hotel surprised me. If you get a good rate this is a nice place to spend the night, but don't expect this to be a fashionable five star hotel- because it clearly isn't. But as a three star hotel- this is good. The concierge was very friendly, and stored our luggage for some hours. Reception was friendly as well, but seemed a bit busy at check-out. Would I stay here again? Perhaps. If I was looking to stay at a hotel on a low budget- yes!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: davidpf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. We were pleasantly surprised at how clean and nice it was. Breakfast was above average and location was excellent. We had no issues or problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Average Best Western Eden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GypsyCleo
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for travellers who won't be staying the room for long periods of time. It is centrally located on the Amstel canal and restaurants. The rooms are well-sized for Europe, but paperthin walls. The occupants next door could be heard well into the night. If the lift is broken, like it was on the night we stayed, it can be difficult to locate the other two on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel for good price.”
Reviews.Author: jmffl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel at the end of May. They were apparently having unseasonably warm weather in Amsterdam the two days that we were in town, and it was unfortunate that the window in our hotel room only opened a couple of inches. The room location was on the side of the building and faced other buildings with balconies, and at night, and into the early morning, people would sit on the balconies and talk rather loudly. As if the heat didn't make it difficult to sleep, the constant voices was very distracting. (Try to request a room in the front of the hotel, if possible.) However, this hotel is in a very convenient location. A very short walk to the Rembrandtplein tram stop and within walking distance of many restaurants and bars. The room is very basic, but if you're not too picky, the price is right. We didn't spend much time in the room anyway so it wasn't that big a deal. The bathroom was clean and modern. The staff was fairly helpful. Overall, not a terrible experience, and if it weren't so hot, which isn't normal anyway, it would probably have been very enjoyable. If you plan to get a museum pass when you arrive, there is a place in the Central Station that sells them. I recommend buying it there rather than the tourist office across from Central Station. Much shorter line and less chaotic. Also, to get to this hotel, take tram 4 or 9 from Central Station. It will drop you at Rembrandtplein and then you just need to duck through the alley (towards the canal) in front of the tram stop to get to the hotel. Once facing the canal, go right. The hotel is just a few buildings down.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, just what you need”
Reviews.Author: moggy669
Reviews.Content: if you are looking to stay somewhere pleasant but not too posh then this place is in a great location and not badly priced. we asked for a room with a view over the canal and it had great large windows for us to look out of.brekkie was nice and the bar at the front of the hotel was a nice atmosphere. For most people going to amsterdam, this place would be entirely suitable and in a great location. (quiet, just off rembrantsplain) if your looking for a plush pad, then go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Good!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLady30
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in Amsterdam for 3 days. The location is great...outdoor bars, nightclubs, and of course "coffee shops" are just around the corner. The hotel is situated right in front of cool canal, and a beautiful bridge. The hotel staff was VERY friendly. Our room was clean, the bathroom big, (watch out, the water in Holland heats up really fast!! You'll burn your face off if your're not careful!!!). It was very noisy outside, and a train station was nearby, but the windows were pretty thick...so we were not bothered at all. You get what you pay for...if you're on a budget, but can afford to stay in something better than a hostel...this is a GREAT deal. Overall, I would give this hotel an A-. Have fun in Amsterdam!! :)

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: kmmccorm
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that we got our room at the Best Western Eden for 60 euros a night. When it comes to hotels, obviously the price will color your opinion. If this was 200 euros a night for the same hotel, I wouldn't be raving about it. But the "Web Special" on (---) gave us 60/night. This is a great place. The lobby is nice and the staff is very welcoming, which is a pleasant way to start a stay. My girlfriend bought some flowers the first day and she asked for a vase - we had barely shut the door to our room when someone knocked with a vase for her flowers. The room was decent sized, clean, the bathroom was spotless with a very warm, very strong shower. The TV carried CNN and BBC. The morning breakfast is large with eggs, cereal, various breads, juices and yogurt. Very filling and a pleasant surprise. The location is fantastic. Yes, our "queen" bed was two singles together ... not a huge deal in my book. This is a great hotel and a great value. I didn't notice any excessive noise or have any other notable issues. Your mileage (of course) may vary during your stay, but I can very heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Place To Sleep & Shower”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Snoop
Reviews.Content: If you just need a reasonably priced room to stay in overnight - nothing more, this hotel may be for you. It is in a good location only about 2 blocks from Rembrantplein. My room was 80 Euros per night and to say the room was plain would be a big understatement...a double bed, a window with no view, a room safe, a TV, and a bathroom....but that's all I needed. The lobby was attractive and the staff was helpful. The only negatives were that there was a nose tissue (unused) lying on the floor of my room beside the bed when I checked in and the hotel has an 11:00AM check-out time. I requested a late check-out of 1:00PM as I had a later flight out, but the night desk clerk would only extend my check-out until Noon (which I consider normal check-out time). The next day, at 12:05PM, they phoned me in the room to ask if I was leaving....geez! Given that this was only an overnight stay for me between flights, I would stay here again under the same conditions. If you're on your honeymoon, or want to impress someone, I would recommend you find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 night at the BW Eden. The best part of my stay at the hotel was probably its location. We could easily walk to most of the major attractions of the city. We were first given a room that had no view except for the brick wall of the building next door. After negotiating with the friendly staff working at the front desk we were upgraded to a bigger room with nice furniture. Best of all, the room had a direct view of the Amstel River. Breakfast, which was included in the price, was a nice way to start the day. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: cherub74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money. The rooms are all clean and tidy, though could do with decorating. The location is excellent. I would deffo stay there on my next visit to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: azrael
Reviews.Content: I had no problems with this hotel. I stayed there for 1 night last weekend and the rooms were comfortable, location was excellent and I had a good time in Amsterdam. Its fine for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: deecee61
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a mini break in Amsterdam. We booked a family room (Double and single beds) through the Ryanair Hotel website for Â£66 per night including breakfast. We were located on the back of the hotel overlooking a lovely garden. The room was clean , spacious and comfortable. There was a TV in the room which had BBC1 and BBC2 on it but no mini bar or tea making facilities. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We ate in the restaurant on the first night and found it very reasonable - 3 course meal 24 Euros. The bar was small but friendly. There is an Irish bar a few doors away which has live music and is very friendly. Canal boats stop directly opposite the hotel and the hotel is within walking distance of other attractions, bars, restaurants, shopping area and floating flower market. We had a lovely walk back from the Anne Frank House. We took a taxi from the hotel to central station (10 Euros) and then we got the train to the airport (3.40 Euros). All in all I would recommend the hotel and we would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for exploring amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: linperrie
Reviews.Content: There seems to be a lot of moaning going on about this hotel, but I have just got back from staying there for 2 nights and thought it was really good for the price (we paid ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½69 per night). The location is great as it is near all the main bars etc. The staff where very friendly and the rooms where OK. The beds are very comfy and there was more than enough cupboard space. Yes there are no tea/coffee facilities, mini bar or air con, but it is only a 3 star hotel and these things don't bother a lot of people. We had a fair sized room on the side of the hotel where you could see some of the canal. Maybe this is why we where quite happy with it. Having stayed in barcelona a few times and seen the size of the rooms there that are like postage stamps, I was pleasantly surprised to find the Eden hotel provides rooms big enough to spread out. The decor and furniture are a bit dated, but its neutral and is not offensive. I didn't encounter any weird smells, stains or nightclub noise, so I cannot comment on them. Breakfast was filling and quite varied.Not a great full english, but if we wanted that we could have stayed at home. In summary its a good mid range hotel that does everything it should. I would stay here again! If you want luxury - find a five star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “3***????”
Reviews.Author: sbunnie
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was because we booked a triple room, but it was an odd 'L shaped' layout and the decor was was very dated. I'm not sure if we were facing 'Sinners' nightclub but it certainly wasn't a view of the canal. (The nightclub only operates Weds to Sun by the way, so this wasn't a problem noisewise). There was no fridge/mini bar and when we requested tea/coffee making facilites were presented with a tray of 3 plastic cups. I expected more from a hotel chain like this.

Reviews.Title: “there is better”
Reviews.Author: crozierio
Reviews.Content: Having being to Amsterdam several times, I can not recommend this hotel. I have stayed in much better and much more unique. After reading the tripadvisor reviews I complained when we were given a room right near the disco (with no air con). We were accomodated to be moved but had to pay the extra fee of course. Breakfast is alright especially if you are hungry. If staying a week or more, type in a search for apartments. We did this last summer and stayed in a fully furnished apartment for cheaper than staying at this run of the mill hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: american_expat_CPH
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the location, which I was happy with. There isn't much else to say about this place. The room we had was small, with old furniture, and looked out into an ugly alleyway. Strange smells came from parts of the lobby, (and it wasn't you know what), smelled like something rotten. Carpets everywhere were stained. You have to pay for internet access, and the staff was not particularly pleasant. In addition, the whole time we were there, busloads of tourists, some of whom didn't seem to use deodorant, were sitting in the lobby. Maybe that explains the rotten smell I talked about earlier. However, if you are looking for a convenient hotel and can deal with what I mentioned above, this place is okay. There is a great Irish bar and 2 or 3 coffehouses within a 2-3 minute walk from the hotel. We paid USD 100 for the room through best western hotels website, and that is about the limit you should ever consider paying. I have stayed at Best Westerns in the US and this one was a dissappointment. If they renovated this hotel, it could be fantastic. Right now, it is very down on its heels.

Reviews.Title: “B.W. Eden Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. The hotel is at 144 Amstel corner of Wagenstraat. The Sinners night club on Wagenstraat will play loud music to keep you awake (even with the windows closed) until 3AM. Rooms that do not face Wagenstraat are ok, but not worth 170 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “we liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: despite reading other reviews that somewhat slate this hotel we found it more than satisfactory. we got the room on a web special deal for Â£64 (double), breakfast not included. we did ask for non-smoking but got smoking rooms but they didn't smell. the concierge was very helpful and up for a laugh! the check-in desk staff could have been a little warmer. bar's ok but watch the prices i got overcharged. you can't knock the location, perfect and central, walking distance to eveything. rembrandt square on your doorstep so eating out ideal with much choice. recommend coco's outback, australian food and massive good value portions. would definetly go back and recommend if you want good standard rooms and central location.

Reviews.Title: “what a complete dump, don't bother”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay in Best Western hotels when on city breaks and so far the standards for 3 star hotels has been comfortable (given the amount of time that you actaully spend in the room) but I had the total displeasure of staying in the Eden. 1. The guide photo is a con - they only show you half of the building and only the upper floors. 2. The first room allocated had a window no bigger than 1 m x 0.5 m and the view was a brick wall, so no natural light. Wallpaper was pealing off the wall and nice big damp patch. Walked straight out. 3. Second room was slightly better, but later found out that it over looked the entrance to a night club -so don't expect to get any sleep whatsoever considering they open at 1 and kick out at 5. 4. Didn't get a no smoking room, so nice yellow tinge to the wallpaper and lovely smell. 5. Checked out and spent the second night elsewhere. Save yourself the bother, this is not a 3 star hotel at all. Have stayed in better hostels. Total and utter dump.

Reviews.Title: “The location makes this place”
Reviews.Author: JamJar
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the reception area were "this seems like a nice place". Upon check in I was allocated a double non-smoking room although on my booking i had requested a twin smoking room. The staff were happy to change it immediately but we were allocated a much smaller room with little natural light. By the way, it seems many of the reviewers got a cheaper deal than us which included breakfast. Shop around before booking as if you book directly with best western you pay 110 - 135 euros per night without breakfast. So much for being a gold crown club member. The bar and restaurant were fine. The fact that the bar stays open until 1am was a bonus as we could finish our night there. The staff here were very friendly and even gave us advice as to which nightspots to visit. The maids were another matter. They knock and immediately let themselves into your room. I didnt have time to shout "hold on a minute" before she was in there. On the final morning she didnt even knock. My modesty was spared as i was still in bed, but my friend was in a state of undress. But it is the location that made this hotel. I had noticed it on previous trips and decided that it would be a good base. The bars and restaurants in and around the Rembrandtplein and Thorbeckplein mean that you dont have to go far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and the room facilities are satisfactory. The rooms aren't anything special, so if you are looking for basic accommodation, i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Eden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moontheodos
Reviews.Content: Nice location and nice room for the price we paid [110 eur breakfast incl] The room was clean, the staff was friendly. The bad thing is that we could hear everyone who was walking down the corridor. Breakfast was not something special. I strongly reccomend this hotel for someone who does not expect all the joy of Amsterdam from his hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cayce11
Reviews.Content: We were dumped in this hotel at the beginning and end of a bike tour and I couldn't believe how bad it was! I've been in dorm rooms that were way more inviting. I'm astonished that anyone could like it and have to wonder if they've ever stayed in a nice hotel. The rooms we had were small, dingy and institutional looking. There was graffiti scratched into the elevators, stains on the room carpet and walls and the furniture was completely cheap and functional without even a hint of design. I'm amazed it rates 3 stars. The staff was friendly, but that didn't stop the place from desperately needing a renovation. Best Western should be ashamed.

HotelInfo.Name: Eden Hotel Amsterdam - Hampshire Eden
HotelInfo.Address: Amstel 144, Amsterdam 1017 AE, The Netherlands
